Com o emprestimo de pretende comprar mais redes de pesca, uma vez que nao dispoe de fundos suficientes para sua reposicao e ultimamente a pesca nao tem lhes dados muita receita, devido a reducao drastica do produto pesqueiro no rio Maputo. No futuro tenciona melhorar seu barco e comprar motor para pescar nas aguas do oceano indico.

loans.use: To buy nets

loans.name: Budumuli East A B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Joan N.. She is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to add more furniture like chairs and tables. Joan is 35 years old and is married. She has 5 children ranging from age 7 to 15 and her children go to school. Each week, Joan makes approximately UGX 60000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the house rent and school fees for her children. Joan has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 700000 in order to buy more stock and the loan was paid back on time.

Joan is joined in her small group by Najabu N., Clare N., Margret K., and Beatrice K.. Najabu N. has a business in used clothing sales and wants to buy more clothes and add stock. Clare N. is currently operating a business selling water and wants a loan to purchase another tank and machine. Margret K. operates a business selling charcoal and wants to purchase more charcoal in bulk. Beatrice K. is currently in the business of charcoal sales and is requesting a loan to add capital.

loans.use: To add more restaurant equipment

loans.name: Bernadette Ndew

texts.fr:
Mrs Bernadette Ndew N., born in 1949, is a widow and a member of the Ngollar Village Bank. She buys wood and pays for the labor to turn it into charcoal, which she then sells. Bernadette is a good customer who has been in the program for five and a half years and has always repaid her loans. Her income enables her to pay for her children's schooling, buy cows and support her family. She is requesting a loan that she plans to repay after six months in one installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme Bernadette Ndew N., née 1949, veuve est membre du Banc villageois de Ngollar, Elle achète du bois et paie la main d'oeuvre pour produire du charbon qu'elle vend. Bernadette est une bonne cliente qui a fait 5 ans et demie dans le programme et a toujours remboursé ses prêts. Ses revenus lui permettent de payer la scolarité de ses enfants, acheter des vaches et entretenir la famille.Elle sollicite un prêt qu'elle compte rembourser au bout de 6 mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To pay for wood and labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying bicycles that can be salvaged

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen M., age 30, is married and has 2 children (ages 5 and 1). She has an alcohol and soft drinks business, which she began 2 years ago. She works from 4:00 PM to 11:00 PM daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about US$1020 from her sales.

Doreen has taken out 2 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her drinks stock. She hopes for a new loan to increase her inventory once more, and her dream is to open another shop as well.

loans.use: To buy more alcohol and soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr:
42 year-old Mrs Sokhna Sene, married and a member of the Ngollar Village Bank, runs a business selling brooms made from twigs by local craftsmen. She has been a customer of the Program for many years and has always respected her commitments. Her income enables her to support the needs of her family. Sokhna is requesting a 12th loan that she plans to repay after six months in one installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme Sokhna SENE, mariée, 42 ans membre du Banc villageois de Ngollar mène une activité de commerce de balaies de fabrication artisanale fait à partir de tiges d'arbres. Elle est cliente du programme depuis des années et a toujours respecté ses engagements. Ses revenus lui permettent de subvenir au besoin de la famille. Sokhna sollicite un 12ème prêt qu'elle compte rembourser au bout de 6 mois en un seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy brooms

loans.name: Ndiouthe

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ndouthe Sene is 30 years old, married and has been a reliable member of the Ngollar Village Bank for five and a half years. In order to help with the upkeep of her household, she would like to build her cattle and sheep business. She is requesting a 12th loan, which will be for a six-month term with a one-time repayment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme Ndouthe SENE , 30 ans, mariée est une bonne membre du Banc villageois de Ngollar depuis cinq ans et demie . Afin d'aider à l'entretien de son foyer, elle souhaite renforcer son activité d'embouche bovine et ovine. Elle sollicite un 12ème prêt qui sera d'une durée de 6 mois avec une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy animals and feed

loans.name: Marleny Yanet

texts.es:
For the last 3 years, Marleny has been a part of “Banco Comunal “Rikchariy””, which means “Wake Up” in Quechua. Marleny is a 30 year-old single mother of a 7 year-old daughter. She sells vegetables and seasoning at a stand at the central market in the town of Ayucucho. She also peddles candy and sweets at the city plaza of Ayacucho until very late at night.

Marleny requests a loan of 3000 soles ($1,050) to be spent on the purchase of cigarettes, gum, candy, lollipops, soy sauce, vinegar, cumin, and pepper. Her savings will be spent on building her home and the education of her daughter. Marleny’s dream is for her daughter to become a professional, for her business to grow and to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Marleny pertenece al Banco Comunal “Rikchariy” que significa “Despiértate” en quechua, hace 3 años. Marleny es madre soltera, tiene 30 años y 1 hija de 7 años. Marleny vende verduras y condimentos en un puesto del mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Marleny vende golosinas de manera ambulatoria en la plaza de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza hasta altas horas de la noche.

Marleny necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cigarro, chicle, caramelos, chupetines, sillao, vinagre, comino, pimienta. Sus ahorros son para construir su casa y la educación de su hija. Los sueños de Marleny son que su hija sea profesional, su negocio crezca y la construcción de su casa.

loans.use: To purchase cigarettes, gum, candy, lollipops, soy sauce, vinegar, cumin, and pepper to make a business grow.

loans.name: Olga Carmen

texts.es:
For the past year Olga has been a part of “Banco Comunal “Rikchariy”” which means “Wake Up” en Quechua. She lives with her partner, is 40 years old and has 3 children, she sells potato and cereal in the Ayacuchana jungle and she also takes her products to the city of Lima and they are sold at the wholesale food market in the town of Ayuchucho and at the farms. From the Ayacuchana jungle she brings fruits and coke which are sold at the Nery García market.

Olga requests a loan of 2000 soles ($700) to invest in buying potato. Her savings will be used to increase the business capital and for the education of her children. It is Olga’s dream that her children will become professionals and her business will grow.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Olga pertenece al Banco Comunal “Rikchariy” que significa “Despiértate” en Quechua, hace 1 año. Olga es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, Olga vende papa y cereales en la selva ayacuchana y también lleva a la ciudad de Lima, sus productos los compra en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho y en las chacras. Además Olga trae de la selva Ayacuchana frutas, coca, productos que vende en el mercado Nery Garcia.

Olga necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa. Sus ahorros son para incrementar el capital de su negocio y la educación de sus hijos. Los sueños de Olga son que sus hijos sean profesionales y su negocio más grande.

loans.use: Purchase potato to increase sales and make business grow.

loans.name: Haydee Filonila's Group

texts.es:
Haydee and Tania are associates of the Communal Bank "Rikchariy" which means "Wake Up" in Quechua since 12 and 1 year ago respectively. In their Communal Bank they learned to save, be responsible and rely on business partners.

Haydee is married, is 54 years old and has 4 children of whom only 2 live with her. Before, Haydee used to buy and sell cereals; currently she grows potatoes, beans and quinoa in her fields in the province of Sucre and in the District of Chiara, and she sells them in the city of Lima. What is more, Haydee creates clothing typical to the region of Sucre. Haydee has been thinking to start a "recreo" (a privately owned village center for recreation and food) in Sucre.

On the other hand Tania is cohabitating, 27 years old with two daughters. Tania sells cosmetics via catalogs; products she offers to friends and acquaintances. Also Tania sells algarrobina (local sweet carob syrup) coffee that has curative properties; she also sells craftwork. Those two products are local traD.-goods of the north of Peru.

Haydee and Tania need loans of 600 each one, money that will be invested in the purchase of algarrobina coffee, craftworks and to implement the "recreo" with tables and chairs.

Their savings for increasing the capital of their business. The dreams of Haydee and Tania are to expand their business, offer a good education to their children, to fulfill their professions and dedicate themselves to the growth of animal vaccines.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Haydee y Tania son socias del Banco Comunal “Rikchariy” que significa “Despiértate” en quechua, hace 12, 1 años respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ahorrar, ser responsable y el apoyo entre socias.

Haydee es casada, tiene 54 años y 4 hijos D. los cuales solo 2 viven con ella, Haydee antes compraba y vendía cereales, actualmente siembra papa, haba, quinua en sus terrenos D. la provincia D. Sucre y en el Distrito D. Chiara, y los venD. en la ciudad D. Lima. Además Haydee confecciona vestimenta típica D. la región D. Sucre. Haydee tiene proyectado iniciar un recreo en Sucre.

Por otro lado Tania es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 2 hijas, Tania venD. cosméticos por catálogos, productos que ofrece a amigos, familiares. Además Tania venD. café D. algorrobina que tiene propiedades curativas, también venD. artesanías, estos dos productos son traídos del norte del Perú.

Haydee y Tania necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles cada una, dinero que será invertido en la compra café D. algarrobina, artesanías y para implementar su recreo con mesas, sillas.

Sus ahorros son para incrementar el capital D. su negocio. Los sueños D. Haydee y Tania son ampliar su negocio, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, realizarse profesionalmente y dedicarse a la crianza D. animal vacuno.

loans.use: Haydee and Tania need loans of 600 each one, money that will be invested in the purchase of algarrobina coffee, craftworks and to implement the "recreo" with tables and chairs. - Haydee y Tania necesitan préstamos de 600 soles cada una, dinero que será invertido en la compra café de algarrobina, artesanías y para implementar su recreo con mesas, sillas.

loans.name: Khenane

texts.fr:
Mrs. Khenane GING, married and 53 years old, has been a member of the Ngollar village bank for the last five and a half years and runs a beverage business. She is one of the best customers in her group. The income drawn from her business allows her to look after her household and her surroundings. Khenane is seeking a loan which she will reimburse at the end of six months with a single repayment.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme Khenane G., mariée, 53 ans ,membre du Banc villageois de Ngollar depuis cinq ans et demie mène un commerce de boisson. Elle est une des meilleurs clientes de son groupe.Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d'entretenir son foyer et son environnement .Khenane sollicite un prêt qu'elle compte rembourser au bout de 6 mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase of beverages, payment of transport, electricity, and labor

loans.name: Karla F.

texts.es:
Karla Fernández is a 32-year-old divorcée who has been selling cosmetics for 3 years. After her divorce, she started her business in an effort to generate income for her two children, ages 4 and 2. She was also looking for an activity to occupy her time.

Because of her hard work and determination, her business is now prosperous with a sizeable clientele, which is why she needs a loan of $250.00 USD that she is willing to repay in 3 months. She will purchase merchandise with that loan because she has several orders that she cannot fill due to lack of capital. With your help, you will support Karla and her children.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Karla Fernández es una mujer divorciada de 32 años que desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, la cual inicio cuando se divorcio buscando un ingreso para sus 2 pequeños hijos de 4 y 2 años; además de una actividad para mantener su tiempo ocupado.

Debido a su empeño y excelente labor de venta actualmente su negocio ha prosperado y cuenta con una amplia clientela razón por la que requiere un crédito por US $250.00 y esta dispuesta a pagarlo en 3 meses para comprar mercancía, ya que tiene pedidos pero no cuenta con capital suficiente para surtirlos. Con tu ayuda apoyaras a Karla y sus pequeños.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Mrs. Tony, as her customers affectionately refer to her, started her fast food business 3 years ago in an effort to help her husband with the family expenses. Her family is comprised of 3 females and 1 male.

Thanks to her delicious way of preparing her meals, she is preferred among the people of Mérida, Yucatán. She would now like to expand her menu, offering up to 3 different casseroles for her diners, which is why she would like to obtain a loan of $250.00 USD that she is willing to repay in 3 months. She will use this loan in order to purchase the supplies necessary for this change. Let’s help Tony achieve her goal!

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Tony como cariñosamente la llaman sus clientes inicio hace 3 años un negocio de venta de comida para apoyar en la economía familiar a su esposo, su familia esta conformada por 3 mujeres y un hombre.

Gracias a su delicioso sazón ella goza de la preferencia de la gente de la ciudad de Mérida, Yucatán ahora desea expandir su menú ofreciendo hasta 3 guisos diferentes para sus comensales razón por la cual quiere contar con un crédito de US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar lo necesario para llevar a cabo este cambio. Ayudemos a Tony a cumplir su meta!!!.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana María R. is a strong woman who became a widow 15 years ago, being left to take care of her 4 children, to whom she always wants to give the best, on her own. Because she is the head of household, she started selling cosmetics door-to-door. Little by little, things started to turn around for her. She currently sells perfume and cosmetics in order to meet her customers’ demands.

Nevertheless, Ana María currently does not have enough merchandise to offer to her customers, which is why she is requesting a loan of $375.00 USD to be repaid in 6 monthly installments. With this money, Ana María will be able to move her youngest children forward because she would like to one day see them attend college. With your help, Ana María will be able to make her dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Ana María R., es una mujer con mucha fuerza, Hace 15 años que enviudó quedando a cargo de sus 4 hijos. A los cuales desea brindarles siempre lo mejor. Debido a que ella es el sostén de su casa fue por lo que comenzó a vender cosméticos casa por casa. Y poco a poco fue cambiando su giro. Actualmente vende perfumes y cosméticos para poder complementar las necesidades de sus clientes.

Sin embargo actualmente Ana María no cuenta con la mercancía suficiente para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Ana María podrá sacar adelante a los hijos más chicos a quienes desea que estudien una carrera universitaria. Con tu ayuda Ana María logrará hacer su sueño realidad.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Beatriz Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ms. Beatriz Díaz sells fast food, such as hot dogs and hamburgers, for a living. She started this business 3 years ago, and she now needs a loan of $250.00 USD, which she will repay in 3 monthly installments. She needs the loan in order to buy supplies because her business is very prosperous and she receives more and more customers each day. Among her future goals are saving enough money so that she can open her own store and engage in both activities.

She is a single mother with a 19-year-old son who occasionally helps her prepare the meals and serve the customers. Beatriz started this business knowing that it would allow her to both generate income and same time stay home without neglecting her son. Betty and her son thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Beatriz Díaz se dedica a la venta de comida rápida hot dogs y hamburguesas, hace 3 años empezó con este negocio, ahora necesita de un crédito de US $250 que liquidara en un plazo de 3 meses para la compra de insumos ya que su negocio ha prosperado y cada día cuenta con más clientes. Entre sus metas futuras desea reunir un capital mayor para abrir su tienda y dedicarse a ambas actividades.

Ella es madre soltera de un joven que actualmente cuenta con 19 años quien ocasionalmente le ayuda en la preparación de los alimentos y la atención a los clientes, inicio esta actividad dado que esta le permitía generar ingresos y a su vez permanecer en su casa sin descuidar a su hijo. Betty y su hijo te agradecerán tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva Mélendez likes to see her family get ahead in life, which is why twenty years ago, she started selling seasonal items, such as gifts, flowers, and home décor, among other things. Genoveva realized that both her family and living expenses were growing while her husband’s income was insufficient to raise their 4 children. Thanks to Genoveva’s constant struggle to move her business forward, her children are currently receiving an education. Nevertheless, her struggle continues, which is why Genoveva wishes to expand her business.

Genoveva is requesting a loan of $375.00 USD, which she is willing to repay in 6 monthly installments. With this money, she will be able to purchase more merchandise, thus increasing her variety. With your help Genoveva will be able to move her family forward and help her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Genoveva Mélendez, es una mujer a la que le gusta que su familia salga adelante. Es por es que hace 20 años atrás que Genoveva comenzó a vender artículos de temporada como son; regalos, flores, mercancía para adornar las casa entre otras cosas. Genoveva comenzó a ver que su familia crecía y los gastos también, y con lo que gana su esposo no era suficiente para poder cubrir los gastos de sus 4 hijos. Actualmente Gracias a que Genoveva a luchado por sacar adelante su negocio es que sus hijos se mantienen estudiando. Sin embargo la lucha continua y es por eso que Genoveva desea crecer su negocio.

Genoveva está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Genoveva podrá comprar mercancía para poder tener más variedad en su negocio. Con tu ayuda Genoveva podrá sacar a su familia adelante y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su casa.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
Mrs. María de Lourdes is mother of a 6-year-old boy and an 8-year-old girl. Like many enterprising women, two years ago, she decided to open up a gift and novelty shop called “La Pachanga” with the aim of generating her own income, thus not depending on her husband for both her personal and any unforeseen expenses.

She hopes to receive a loan of $250.00 USD, which she will repay in 3 monthly installments, so that she can become more prosperous and increase her clientele in the city of Mérida, Yucatán. Let’s help Lulú reach her goals!

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. María de Lourdes es madre de familia de 2 pequeños hijos un niño de 6 años y una niña de 8 años, como muchas mujeres emprendedoras ella decidió iniciar un negocio de venta de regalos y novedades llamado “La Pachanga” hace 2 años, con el fin de generar ingresos propios y así no depender de su marido para gastos personales y algunos imprevistos.

Espera recibir un crédito de US $250 que liquidara en 3 meses para poder comprar más mercancía para su negocio y que esto le permita prosperar más e incrementar sus clientes en la ciudad de Mérida, Yucatán. Ayudemos a Lulú a alcanzar sus metas!!.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Maria Isabel Del Car

texts.es:
Mrs. María Isabel is a 44-year-old woman who has always had an affinity for retail. Through many efforts, she was able to save enough money to open a general store, thus generating her own income. Little by little she has been able to stock her store, and now she offers a wide variety of products, meeting her customers’ demands for 4 years.

She currently needs $250.00 USD, which she will repay in 3 months, so that she can buy more products for her store and provide excellent service to her customers. She would like to convert her general store into a supermarket in the future. With your help, Isabel’s wishes can come true.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. María Isabel de 44 años de edad es una mujer a la que siempre le han gustado las ventas y en base a su esfuerzo pudo ahorrar para abrir una tienda de abarrotes y así generar su propios ingreso, poco a poco ha ido surtiéndola contando ahora con una amplia variedad de productos y satisfaciendo así las necesidades de sus clientes desde hace 4 años.

Actualmente ella requiere de apoyo financiero de US $250 que liquidara en 3 meses para comprar mas mercancía para su tienda y dar un excelente servicio a sus clientes. En un futuro ella desea convertir esta tienda en un supermercado. Con tu apoyo los deseos de Isabel se podran realizar.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Cruz Ch°En 1 Group

texts.es:
PascuaL. is 35 years of age. Despite her young age, she has 8 children. It is for this reason that she sees the need to look for various ways to obtain money and support her family. She sells fruits and vegetables in the San Cristobal market. While waiting to make a sale, she embroiders blouses, which she sells to handicraft shop owners in the city. With her loan, she would like to expand her business and purchase materials to keep making blouses. The other members of the group, Rosa Elisea H. H., PascuaL. J. D. L. C. and PascuaL. J. H. are all artisans who make traditional blouses and skirts.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

PASCUAL. TIENE 35 AÑOS, A PESAR D. SER MUY JOVEN TIENE 8 HIJOS, POR TAL MOTIVO SE VE EN L. NECESIDAD D. BUSCAR VARIAS OPCIONES PARA TENER DINERO Y MANTENER A SU FAMILIA, VEND. FRUTAS Y VERDURAS EN EL MERCADO D. SAN CRISTÓBAL, MIENTRAS ESPERA VENDER ALGO BORDA BLUSAS, LAS CUALES VEND. A PERSONAS QUE TIENEN TIENDA D. ARTESANIAS EN L. CIUDAD, CON SU CREDITO QUIERE AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO Y COMPRAR MATERIAL PARA SEGUIR ELABORANDO BLUSAS, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO, ROSA ELISEA H. H., PASCUAL. J. D. L. C. Y PASCUAL. J. H. SON ARTESANAS, ELABORAN BLUSAS Y FALDAS TIPICAS.

loans.use: Expansion of business and purchase of materials to make more blouses

loans.name: Macom 1 Group

texts.es:
Andrea is 22 years old and has two children. She dedicates her time to the creation of shirts, cushions, table cloths and napkins typical to her region. She tries to create various things to be able to leave her community one time a month to sell them in the city of San Cristobal or to people who come to Zinacantan to buy handiwork for resale. With her loan, she would like to buy basic materials (cloth, thread and dyes). The other members of her group, Juana Victoria L. L., Juana G. L., PascuaL. L. L. and Catalina V. are artisans.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

ANDREA TIENE 22 AÑOS Y TIENE 2 HIJOS SE DEDICA A ELABORAR BLUSAS, COJINES, MANTELES Y SERVILLETAS TIPICAS D. SU REGION TRATA D. ELABORAR VARIAS COSAS PARA PODER SALIR D. SU COMUNIDAD UNA VEZ AL MES A VENDERLAS A L. CIUDAD D. SAN CRISTOBAL O A PERSONAS QUE LLEGAN A ZINACANTAN A COMPRAR ARTESANIAS PARA L. REVENTA, CON SU CREDITO LE GUSTARIA COMPRAR MATERIA PRIMA(TEL., HILOS Y TINTAS), LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO JUANA VICTORIA L. L., JUANA G. L., PASCUAL. L. LOPEZY CATALINA V. L. SON ARTESANAS.

loans.use: To buy basic materials (cloth, thread and dyes). - COMPRAR MATERIA PRIMA(TELAS, hILOS Y TINTAS).

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Alternativa Solidaria Chiapas (AlSol) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Cruz Ch°En 2 Group

texts.es:
Lorenza is 46 years old and she is responsible of feeding 7 children, she manufactures blouses, skirts, shawls, tablecloths, and napkins typical for her region and she sells them in the town of San Cristobal and when she has an opportunity she sells at Nachij. With the loan she will buy material and different colored yarn to embroider her handicrafts. The other members of the group are PascuaL. G. P., Maria J. H., and Rosa J. H., all of them are craftswomen.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

LORENZA TIENE 46 AÑOS Y ES L. ENCARGADA D. MANTENER A 7 HIJOS, SE DEDICA A ELABORAR BLUSAS, FALDAS, REBOSOS, MANTELES Y SERVILLETAS TIPICAS D. SU REGION, MISMAS QUE SALE A VENDER A L. CIUDAD D. SAN CRISTÓBAL Y CUANDO HAY OPORTUNIDAD LAS VEND. EN NACHIJ. CON EL CREDITO LE GUSTARIA COMPRAR TEL. Y MUCHOS HILOS D. COLORES PARA BORDAR SU ARTESANIA, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO, PASCUAL. G. P., MARIA J. H. Y ROSA J. H. SON ARTESANAS

loans.use: Purchase material, yarn, and dye.

loans.name: Máxima

texts.es:
Mrs. Máxima had to assume radical changes for the well-being of her family. Twenty years ago in her native land of San Martín de Pangoa, due to the political violence of terrorism that beat upon her beautiful city, she fled leaving her cultivation lands and her humble abode in order to save the life of her husband and their ten children, all of whom were still little, and they chose the city of Huancayo and with the help of many generous people they recouperated. With time they purchased in this city a house and some plots for cultivation in which Mrs. Máxima used it to sow potatoes and corn and breed animals, especially piglets. At present she lives alone with with five of her children who are still minors; the others are already grown into good men who have formed their own households. It has been many years since her husband abondoned her. Two years ago she returned to her native land to recoup that which she once had to leave behind and now she has taken back to her cultivation lands coffee and cocoa. Her loan request attends to the need to convey her produce from the countryside to the city in order to sell them.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Máxima, tuvo que asumir cambios radicales por la seguridad de su familia, hace 20 años en su tierra natal San Martín de Pangoa, debido a la violencia política del terrorismo que azotó su bella ciudad huyó dejando sus tierras de cultivo y su humilde casita para salvar la vida de su esposo y sus 10 hijos, todos eran pequeños y escogieron la ciudad de Huancayo y con ayuda de muchas personas generosas resurgieron, con el tiempo compraron en esta ciudad una casa y algunos terrenos de cultivo en los que actualmente Doña Máxima se dedica a sembrar papa y maíz y a la crianza de animales, especialmente cerditos. En la actualidad vive sólo con 5 de sus hijos que son los menores, los otros ya son hombres de bien, que han forjado su propio hogar, hace varios años su esposo la abandonó. Hace 2 años volvió a su tierra natal a recuperar lo que una vez tuvo que dejar y ahora ha retomado en sus tierras el cultivo del café y del cacao. Su solicitud atiende a su necesidad de trasladar sus productos del campo a la ciudad para su comercialización.

loans.use: Rental of a transport vehicle. - Alquiler de un vehículo de transporte.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
The daily work is assumed by Tomasa. With her humility and kindness since forever she has looked to invite better options for development to her children. Years ago she suffered a great tragedy due to a vehicular accident in which her husband was the victim. Since that event Tomasa had to assume completely the work of sustaining her own. At first it was very hard to face up to this responsibility. The scanty employment opportunities did not allow for her to exceed a certain income, and her need to maintain the safekeeping of her beloved family led her to solicit a group loan from her district to begin with vigor in agricultural activities. She has sown until now potatoes, corn, barley, beans and peas, while awaiting harvest time she chose to also dedicate her time to the breeding of guinea pigs for her neighbors. If this money is not enough she goes on the weekends to the commercial markets to sell the typical dishes. Her proposition is focused on converting to a respectable living and she wishes to begin this long road with the purchase of a little cow for this project.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

El trabajo de cada día es asumido por Tomasa, con suma humildad y bondad ya que siempre ha buscado brindar las mejores opciones de desarrollo a sus hijos. Años atrás sufrió una gran tristeza tras un accidente de transporte en el que su esposo fue víctima. Tras este hecho Tomasa tuvo que asumir completamente la tarea de sostener a los suyos al inicio fue muy duro afrontar esta responsabilidad, la escasa plaza de puestos de trabajo no le permitían acceder a un ingreso fijo y su preocupación por mantener a buen recaudo a su amada familia la conducieron a solicitar un préstamo grupal de su zona para empezar con fuerza en las actividades agrícolas, siembra hasta ahora papa, maíz, cebada, frejoles y arveja, mientras espera el tiempo de su cosecha Tomasa optó también por dedicarse a la crianza de cuyes a sus vecinos, si este dinero no es suficiente sale los fines de semana a las ferias comerciales a vender platos típicos. Su propósito está centrado en convertirse en una ganadera respetable y desea iniciar este largo camino con la compra de una pequeña vaca para su proyecto.

loans.use: Purchase of a cow. - Compra de una vaca.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar is very enthusiastic and always motivates her own to be vigorous. Thanks to her iniciative and her husband's talent for the work, they have acquired two motor taxis with which they give transportation service to their community. She is in charge of administration and her husband drives one while they rent out the other. Hard days when their earnings weren't enough increased Pilar's worries, so she decided to breed piglets and guinea pigs in order to placate these epochs and increased the family earnings with the dream of soon establishing a motor taxi enterprise in their little community. Your important support will serve to increase the number of baby animals and the earnings and desires for progress of this family.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Pilar, es muy entusiasta y siempre motiva a los suyos a esforzarse, gracias a su iniciativa y el talento para el trabajo de su esposo han adquirido dos mototaxis con los que prestan servicios de transporte a su comunidad; ella se en carga de la administración y su esposo conduce uno mientras el otro permanece en alquiler, los días duros en los que los ingresos no eran los suficientes la preocupación de Pilar se incrementaba, fue entonces que decidió criar cerditos y cuyes para aplacar estas épocas e incrementar sus ingresos familiares con el sueño de pronto establecer una empresa de mototaxis en su pequeña comunidad.Tu importante aporte servirá para incrementar el número de animalitos y las ganancias y deseos de progreso de esta familia.

loans.use: Purchase of more baby animals. - Compra de mayor cantidad de animalitos.

loans.name: Udelia

texts.es:
Doña Udelia is very valiant and vigorous; her desire to elevate the level of living of her beloved family has led her down many different paths. She cultivates fodder in a small plot of land in order to offer it to the cattle ranchers and small animal breeders of her beautiful city; she also loans out a piece of land and finally due to her facination with weaving, she creates some garments sporadically with the objective of offering them in her travels. The request for a loan attends to the betterment of the quality and quantity of the produce that she sows.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Udelia, es muy valiente y esforzada, su deseo de elevar el nivel de vida de su querida familia la ha conducido por diversos caminos. Cultiva forraje en una pequeña parcela de tierra para ofertarla a los ganaderos y criaderos de animalitos de su bella ciudad, también otorga en alquiler un espacio de tierra y finalmente debido a su fascinación por el tejido elabora algunas prendas esporádicamente con el objetivo de ofertarla en sus viajes.La solicitud de un préstamo atiende a mejorar la calidad y cantidad del producto que siembra.

loans.use: Increase the quality and quantity of the fodder she grows. - Incrementar la calidad y cantidad del forraje.

loans.name: Rubén

texts.es:
Ruben is a person with dreams of self-improvement. The studies he completed successfuly have granted him the possibility to help support his beloved parents. He works every day in a small lab that he has rented to provide his services. And due to his expenses he has not been able to make any improvements to his office, nor the equipment he uses for his work. For this reason he has decided to remodel a space in his house so that he might be able to relocate his lab there, thereby improving his workspace and the services he provides. Your support is very important and it will help him acquire the tools that he needs and to remodel the space in his house to be more welcoming.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Rubén, es una persona con muchos deseos de superación, la carrera que culminó con éxito le ha dado la posibilidad de contribuir con sus amorosos padres. Se desempeña a diario en un pequeño taller que ha alquilado para prestar sus servicios y debido al costo del arrendamiento no ha podido mejorar este espacio ni las herramientas que utiliza para su trabajo; por este motivo ha decidido acondicionar un espacio en su domicilio a fin de mudar su taller con el objetivo de mejorar sus instalaciones y servicio.Tu importante aporte servirá para adquirir las herramientas que le hacen falta y para otorgarle un ambiente acogedor a este pequeño nuevo taller.

loans.use: To purchase tools and equipment.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza is a devoted mother that struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. When she moved to Jauja after she was married she got the idea to start raising small farm animals to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available in their land for this business. Slowly the numbers of little pigs and chickens increased and with them, her clients started asking for more and more. With an endless list of requests she has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps and for this reason she is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Maritza, es una madre abnegada que se esfuerza día a día para ofrecer lo mejor a su familia, cuando se mudó a Jauja luego de haber contraído matrimonio no tuvo mejor idea que dedicarse a criar animalitos pequeños para contribuir con la economía de su hogar aprovechando el espacio disponible de su hogar para esta actividad.Poco a poco la cantidad de cerditos y gallinitas se ha ido incrementando de la misma manera que las solicitudes de sus clientes, por su inmensa lista de peticiones ha decidido incrementar la cantidad de animalitos y a esa razón atiende la solicitud de un préstamo.

loans.use: Compra de mayor cantidad de animalitos.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.es:
Mr. Leonidas has in his home a distribution business for gasoline fuel that is disruptive to his neighbours. Thanks to the help of his beloved son they can run this business from their home. He earns enough income to provide his wife a dignified life and he has enough to spare to plant a small plot of tubers for their own consumption. On an infrequent basis he also works as an electrician. His request is for the improvement of the facilities of his small business to be able to offer tanks of gas in larger number and in less time.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Leonidas, posee en su hogar una empresa distribuidora de gas que abastece a sus vecinos con este combustible, gracias a la incursión de su querido hijo en esta labor puede ofertarlos desde su domicilio; obteniendo ingresos económicos suficientes para ofrecerle una vida digna a su compañera, de manera adicional siembra algunos tubérculos para consumo propio y esporádicamente ofrece servicios eléctricos.Su solicitud atiende a mejorar las instalaciones de su pequeño establecimiento para ofertar mayor cantidad de balones de gas en menor tiempo.

loans.use: To upgrade the gasoline fuel distribution facilities.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
A few years ago, Nancy opened a little store in her community with the help of her father who has since passed away. Little by little, thanks to her hard work, this little rental space of a store has gained notoriety; every day, new customers come in to shop for basic items. Currently, she is planning to move her store into her home to eliminate the expensive rental fee, and thus, offer more products at much better prices to the satisfaction of her esteemed clientele. Your generous support will help Nancy put her much-yearned-for plan into action.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace un par de años Nancy, aperturó una pequeña bodega en su comunidad con ayuda de su fallecido padre, poco a poco y gracias a su empeño este pequeño espacio de ventas alquilado ha ido cobrando notoriedad y a diario son más las personas que acuden en búsqueda de algún articulo de primera necesidad. Ha decidido mudar su bodeguita a su domicilio para evitar las inmensas sumas de dinero por el alquiler, con el objetivo de ofertar mayor cantidad de productos a mejor precio para la satisfacción plena de sus estimados clientes.Tu importante apoyo contribuirá con este anhelado plan.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items and merchandise.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis has always worked to give the best to his beloved family. He used to only work in the agriculture business, but when he saw that demand would increase around sowing time he decided to open a small grocery store with the help of a friend. Now his friend is the administrator of the store. Luis has a fairly large crop plot at his disposal and therefore needs to acquire fertilizer to care for his crops and ensure their quality.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Luis desde siempre ha trabajado para otorgarle lo mejor a su amada familia, en un principio se dedicaba sólo a la agricultura y cuando observó que las necesidades se incrementaban en época de siembra decidió aperturar una pequeña bodega en casa con ayuda de su compañera, quien ahora está a cargo de la administración de la misma. Dispone de un espacio amplio de cultivo listo para su explotación y su solicitud atiende a la necesidad de adquirir abonos para prepararla y obtener mejor calidad de productos.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar has been in sales for ten years. She offers a diverse range of items depending on the demands and trends of the season. Her desire to improve the quality of life of her children motivates her to solicit a loan for school supplies, which she will sell wholesale at the various local markets. Your important support will contribute to improving the quality of life of Pilar’s family.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

Pilar se dedica a la labor comercial hace diez años y durante este período ha ofertado diversos artículos deacuerdo a la demanda de cada temporada. Su ímpetu por mejorar la calidad de vida de los suyos, la conducen a solicitar un préstamo para en esta temporada escolar ofertar artículos escolares al por mayor en las diversas ferias de su localidad.Tu importante apoyo contribuirá a mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia de Pilar.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (school supplies) for her store.

loans.name: Elisabet

texts.es:
Elisabet crochets and sells beautiful, colorful bedspreads and tablecloths. She started working because she wanted to improve her family’s quality of life when her husband’s income as a farmer just wasn’t enough to cover the basic necessities of her dear children. She also sells her products at a local market every 15 days. She plans to increase the amount of products she has, to satisfy customer demand. That’s why she is asking for your help to put her plan into action.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

Elisabet, se dedica a tejer hermosas y coloridas colchas y tapetes a crochet, su deseo por mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia la ha conducido a desempeñarse en esta labor ya que el ingreso de su esposo como agricultor es insuficiente para satisfacer las necesidades de sus amados hijos; también vende sus pequeñas ovejitas en una feria local y cada quince días.Tiene en mente incrementar la cantidad de ovejitas ya que ha obtenido mayor cantidad de pedidos, por esa razón solicita tu ayuda para poner en marcha este proyecto.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
Every day Felicia traverses the streets of her city selling high-quality natural products. She has a 19 year-old daughter with whom she has shared innumerable happy days. Owing to the fact that Felicia would like to keep developing as an entrepreneur, she has decided to invest more money in her business and start working longer hours. For these reasons she is asking for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

A diario Felicia, recorre las calles de su ciudad ofertando los productos naturales de una prestigiosa marca, tiene una hija de 19 años de edad, con la que comparte innumerables días llenos de alegría; debido a que desea seguir contribuyendo con su formación profesional ha decidido incrementar su capital de trabajo y las horas de labor para conseguir su propósito; y a esta razón atiende su solicitud de un préstamo.

loans.use: To increase investment capital

loans.name: Nelva

texts.es:
Nelva is a mother of a young girl and a hard working salesperson. Every day of the year, and on a daily basis, she manages a small warehouse in her beautiful community ever since five years ago. Thanks to her diligence, this small establishment has turned into the most popular and sought after establishment. She wishes to supply it with a greater quantity of items to satisfy her small, but wonderful clientele who day in and day out, and especially in the mornings, continue to visit her.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Nelva, es madre de una pequeña niña y una trabajadora comerciante. A diario y todos los días del año administra su pequeña bodeguita aperturaza hace cinco años en su bella comunidad; gracias a su diligencia este pequeño establecimiento se hecho el más popular y concurrido y desea dotarlo de mayor cantidad de artículos para complacer a su pequeño gran público que día a día y en especial por las mañanas no deja de visitarla.

loans.use: Increase capital to sell greater quantity of high demand items.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda has been in the sales business for many years without a whole lot of success. Nevertheless, thanks to her perseverance she is proud and satisfied with the income she has generated selling decorative plants. With her newfound redemption and upward mobility she has been able to forget her days of despair. Her main wish is to increase her investment capital, which is why she is asking for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Hilda, durante muchos años había incursionado en el campo de las ventas sin mayor éxito, sin embargo gracias a su perseverancia ahora puede comentarnos que se siente muy bien y satisfecha por las ganancias que le genera la venta de plantas ornamentales, con su desempeño y apogeo ha podido dejar atrás los innumerables días de tristeza. Su deseo de incrementar su capital de trabajo la conduce a solicitar vuestra ayuda.

loans.use: To obtain more decorative plants

loans.name: Edita

texts.es:
Edita has worked in the agriculture fields since she was young. When she decided to support her household, the work intensified and her product yield increased. However, the needs of her young children kept increasing, and for this reason she decided to acquire a greater quantity of land to cultivate a more products. Despite this, she has difficulty growing crop due to lack of capital, which is the reason why she is asking for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Edita, desde pequeña trabajó en sus campos de cultivo, cuando decidió formar su hogar las tareas se intensificaron y la cantidad de productos se incrementaron, sin embargo las necesidades de sus dos pequeños hijos iban en aumento por esa razón decidió adquirir mayor cantidad de terrenos, para cultivar mayor cantidad de productos a pesar de este hecho tiene la dificultad de siembra por la falta de capital de inversión y este es el motivo por el cual solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: Capital to grow tubers on her ample agriculture land

loans.name: Elida Cristina

texts.es:
For the last 4 years, Elida has been a partner of “Banco Comunal Atinchik” which means “We are able to” in Quechua. In her “Banco Comunal” she has learned to save money, be punctual and responsible. Elida is single, 27 years old, she is studying social service at the university. Elida sells cosmetics from catalogues, such as Esika, Unique, and Natura, she offers her products to friends and family. She also sells clothes and school and office supplies depending on campaigns and demand. She buys her products in Lima. With the loan from “Banco Comunal” she will buy supplies and uniforms which she will sell in the district of Tambo.

Elida needs a loan of 2000 soles ($700) to buy notebooks, pencils, paper, and uniforms. Her savings will be spent on building her house and for her academic qualifications. It is Elida’s dream to own a wholesale general store, to make business grow, and to study another degree.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Elida es socia del Banco Comunal Atinchik que significa “Podemos” en Quechua, hace 4 años. En su Banco Comunal aprendió a ahorrar, ser puntual y responsable. Elida es soltera y tiene 27 años, estudiante de trabajo social en la universidad, Elida vende cosméticos por catálogos como Esika, Unique, Natura, sus productos los ofrece a amigos y familiares. Además Elida vende ropa, útiles dependiendo de las campañas y demanda, sus productos lo trae de Lima. Elida con el préstamo que obtendrá de su Banco Comunal tiene proyectado traer útiles, uniformes y lo venderá en el distrito de Tambo.

Elida necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de cuadernos, lapiceros, papeles y uniformes. Sus ahorros los utilizará en la construcción de su casa y para su titulación. Los sueños de Elida son tener una tienda de abarrotes por mayor, que sus negocios prosperen y estudiar otra carrera más.

loans.use: Purchase notebooks, pencils, paper, and uniforms to increase sales.

loans.name: Narda's Group

texts.es:
Narda, Esther, and Ronalda have been part of “Banco Comunal Atinchik” which means “We are able to” in Quechua for 2, 7, and 6 years respectively. In their “Banco Comunal” they learned to be punctual, responsible, supportive and good colleagues. Narda lives with her partner, she is 29 years old and has a 6 year-old daughter. For the past 2 months she has been selling candy at her house which is close to the zoo, previously she sold food at an urban transportation stop, activity she stopped doing as it was very exhausting. Esther is single and 27 years old. She sells vegetables and groceries in the Ayacuchana jungle where she travels every two weeks to do business. She also sells shoes and anything her clients might need. Ronalda lives with her partner, she is 37 years old and has a 9 year-old daughter. She sells used spare parts and started her business as her husband is a mechanic and there was demand for those products.

Narda, Esther, and Ronalda need loans for 1000 soles, 300 soles, and 600 soles ($675) to be invested in buying soft drinks, gum, cookies, sugar, noodles, salt, and spare parts. The savings will be used to build their house and to cover emergencies. Their dream is to own a wholesale store, a vehicle to transport their merchandise and to improve the life standard of their mother, and to support their children to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Narda, Esther y Ronalda pertenecen al Banco Comunal Atinchik que significa “Podemos” en Quechua hace 2, 7, 6 años respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ser puntuales, responsables, solidarias y compañeras. Narda es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 1 hija de 6 años, Narda vende golosinas en su casa hace 2 meses, que esta ubicado cerca de un zoológico, anteriormente vendía comida en un paradero de transporte urbano, actividad que dejo de realizar porque era muy forzado. Por otro lado Esther es soltera y tiene 27 años, Esther vende verduras, abarrotes en la selva Ayacuchana, a donde viaja quincenalmente para realizar su negocio. Además Esther vende zapatos y todo cuanto le pidan sus clientes. Mientras que Ronalda es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 1 hija de 9 años, Ronalda vende repuestos de segunda, inició su negocio porque su esposo es mecánico y había demanda de estos productos.

Narda, Esther y Ronalda necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles, 300 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas, chicles, galletas, azúcar, fideo, sal y repuestos. Sus ahorros son para la construcción de su casa y alguna emergencia. Los sueños de Narda, Esther y Ronalda son tener una tienda mayorista, un carro para transportar su mercadería, brindarle todo lo mejor a su mama y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks, gum, cookies, sugar, noodles, salt, and spare parts to increase business.

loans.name: Miluzka Madeleine's Group

texts.es:
Miluzka, Mirtha and Victoria have been associates of the Community Bank named “Atinchik”, which means “We can” in Peru’s native language of Quechua, for ten, one and one years, respectively. At the Community Bank, they were taught how to save and invest. In essence, they learned the value of money.

Miluzka is a 32-year-old, single mother of a ten-month old baby girl. For two years she’s been a cosmetics sales rep, offering makeup lines such as Unique, Ebel and Natura, by catalogue. In addition to this job, she works in an office that provides IT consultations.

Mirtha is a 25-year-old wife who is an elementary school teacher by profession. She sells prepaid cell phones and phone cards in the city’s center.

Victoria is a 52-year-old, separated, mother of 3 children. Of her children, 2 still live with her. She walks around the Magdalena market selling small items like shoe polish, brushes and bags.

Miluzka and Mirtha each need a loan of 600 soles and Mirtha needs a loan of 450 soles. These loans will be invested in specialized creams, cellular equipment, phone cards, paper, batteries and bags.

Miluzka’s dream is to start a small business of her own and hopes that in the future, her daughter will become a professional. Mirtha’s dream is to maintain a stable business that prospers. Victoria’s dream is to build a house.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

Miluzka, Mirtha y Victoria pertenecen al Banco Comunal Atinchik que significa “Podemos” en quechua hace 10, 1, 1 años respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendió a ahorrar, como invertir el dinero y los valores.

Miluzka es madre soltera, tiene 32 años y 1 hija de 10 años, Miluzka vende cosméticos por catálogo de las líneas Unique, Ebel, Natura, actividad que realiza hace 2 años. Además Miluzka trabaja en una consultora en el área de informática.

Por otro lado Mirtha es casada y tiene 25 años, de profesión profesora de educación secundaria, Mirtha vende celulares prepago y tarjetas telefónicas, su punto de venta esta ubicada en una calle céntrica de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Mientras que Victoria es separada, tiene 52 años y 3 hijos de los cuales solo 2 viven con ella, Victoria vende pequeños artículos como betún, cepillo, bolsas, actividad que realiza de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Magdalena.

Miluzka, Mirtha y Victoria necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 600 soles, 450 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de cremas de tratamiento, equipos de celulares, tarjetas telefónicas, papel, pilas y costales.

Los sueños de Miluzka, Mirtha y Victoria son crear una microempresa, su hija sea profesional, tener un negocio estable y construir su casa.

loans.use: To buy specialized creams, cellular equipment, phone cards, paper, batteries and bags.

loans.name: Adela's Group

texts.es:
The Community Bank “Casaorcco” is a new bank that opened 6 month ago. It has 15 female associates who live in the community of Casaorcco in the Carmen Alto district, one hour from the city of Ayacucho. Here, they learned how to be punctual, responsible and care for their children.

The associates have different businesses like raising and selling small animals, grain, livestock fattening, candy, clothing and wood. But, each one has a different story. Adela Calderón, for example, sells clothing at the markets and also buys grain there.

Since each associate’s need is different, the loans differ too. The amounts solicited range from 300 soles to 450 soles to 600 soles, for a total of 8,700 soles (3 soles = 1 US dollar) in loans from the Community Bank. This money will be invested in cattle, bulls, sheep, corn, wheat, barley, peas, wood, clothing and animal feed.

They’ll use their savings to buy school supplies for their children, increase business capital and buy basic needs.

The associates have big hopes for the future: that their children will aspire to something better than their parents; their businesses will grow and prosper; they’ll be able to improve their living conditions; and their children will become professionals.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

El Banco Comunal Casaorcco es un banco joven que se inició hace 6 meses. Actualmente tiene 2 ciclos y 15 socias. Las socias D. este Banco Comunal son D. la comunidad D. Casaorcco que pertenece al distrito D. Carmen Alto, ubicado a 1 hora D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Las socias nos cuentan que en el Banco Comunal las socias aprendieron a ser puntuales, responsables y como atender a los hijos.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como crianza y venta D. animales menores, venta D. cereales, engorD. D. animales, venta D. golosinas, ropa y leña. Cada socia tiene una historia diferente como es el caso D. Adela Calderón que venD. ropa en las ferias y D. las ferias compra cereales.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 600 soles, 450 soles, haciendo un total D. 8,700 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal. Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra D. ganado, toros, ovino, maíz, trigo, cebada, arveja, leña, ropa y alimento para sus animales.

Los ahorros los utilizarán para comprar los útiles escolares D. sus hijos, incrementar el capital D. sus negocios y para alguna necesidad.

Los sueños D. las socias es que sus hijos sean mejores que ellos, negocios crezcan, mejorar sus casas y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: To buy cattle, bulls, sheep, corn, wheat, barley, peas, wood, clothing and animal feed.

loans.name: Raida Paulina

texts.es:
For 9 years, Raida has been a member of the community bank nameded "Llapanchik”, which means “Everyone” in Peru’s native language of Quechua. Here, she learned how to save money, be punctual and responsible, and the importance of friendship and community.

Raida is a 40 year old, separated mother of 2 boys. She sells groceries, meat and vegetables. She started her business with very little capital and since then it has been slowly prospering.

Raida is asking for a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = 1 US dollar) with which she will buy sugar, rice, noodles, milk, soda, cookies, soap and detergent.

She will use her savings to pay for her children’s education. She was able to build a house and buy her sons a computer with the money she learned how to save at the Community Bank. Raida hopes that her sons will grow up to be good people and one day become professionals. She also wants to buy a car so her son can work.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

Raida es socia del Banco Comunal “Llapanchik” que significa “Todos” en quechua hace 9 años. En su Banco Comunal aprendió a ahorrar, ser puntual, responsable y el compañerismo.

Raida es separada, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos varones, Raida tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes, carne, verduras. Raida menciona que su negocio inició con muy poco capital y actualmente su negocio ha crecido.

Raida necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, fideo, leche, gaseosas, galletas, jabón, detergente.

Sus ahorros lo utilizará en la educación de sus hijos, Raida menciona que con los ahorros que reunió en su Banco Comunal construyó su casa y compró la computadora para su hijo. Los sueños de Raida es que sus hijos sean profesionales, personas de bien y comprar un carro para que trabaje su hijo.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, noodles, milk, soda, cookies, soap and detergent.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
Saturnina is requesting a loan of 2000 soles. She will invest these funds in buying sugar, rice, beer, legumes and potatoes. Saturnina has been part of the Community Bank “Llapanchik” - which means “Everyone” in the indigenous language of Quechua for 8 years. Through the bank she learned how to run her business, guide her children, to be responsible and punctual.

Saturnina is 49 years old, mother of 6. She has a small store where she sells legumes, meats and other items. Saturnina started by selling drinks but diversified when she noticed sales increasing. With her savings she plans on paying for the schooling of her children. Her dreams are to generate more capital for her business and see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer.

Saturnina es socia del Banco Comunal “Llapanchik” que significa “Todos” en quechua hace 8 años. En su Banco Comunal le enseñaron a como administrar su negocio, orientar a los hijos, ser puntual y responsable.

Saturnina es casada, tiene 49 años y 6 hijos, Saturnina tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carnes, Saturnina cuenta que al inicio solo vendía bebidas y al notar que había demanda decidió surtir su negocio.

Saturnina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, cerveza, verduras y papa.

Sus ahorros lo utilizará en la educación de sus hijo que ingresará a la universidad y para incrementar el capital de sus negocios. Los sueños de Saturnina son tener más capital para surtir mas su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Saturnina is requesting a loan of 2000 soles. She will invest these funds in buying sugar, rice, beer, legumes and potatoes.

loans.name: Sonia's Group

texts.es:
Carmen, Paulina and Sonia are requesting loans of 600,400 and 1000 soles respectively. They want to invest the funds in buying cocoa, sugar, wheat, potatoes, cheese and other items. They are part of the Community Bank “Llapanchik” - which means “Everyone” in the indigenous language of Quechua – for 5, 3, and 5 years respectively.

Carmen is a 34 year old single mother of 3. Carmen and her sons make chocolates ( using cocoa, sugar, cinnamon and cove). It is a family recipe. They sell their chocolate to stores in the city of Ayacucho. Carmen also works in a factory sorting Chinese beans. Paulina is 42 years old, single mother of 3 children. She travels twice a week to buy cereals, small animals and cheese to sell in Puente Nuevo.

Sonia is 29 years old, mother of 3. She travels and buys potatoes, cereals and small animals to resell at the Mery Garcia market. They plan to use their saving to school their children and for emergency funds. They dream to grow their businesses, build their homes and help their children succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer.

Carmen, Paulina y Sonia pertenecen al Banco Comunal “Llapanchik” que significa “Todos” en quechua hace 5, 3, 5 años respectivamente.

Carmen es madre soltera, tiene 34 años y 3 hijos, Carmen junto a sus hijos elabora chocolates ayacuchanos (elaborado con cacao, azúcar, maní, ajonjolí, canela y clavo), actividad que aprendió de familiares, sus productos los vende al por mayor en tiendas y mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Carmen trabaja en un empresa seleccionando arveja china.

Por otro lado Paulina es madre soltera, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Paulina viaja a las ferias 2 veces por semana donde compra cereales, animales menores, quesos y los vende en el puente nuevo.

Mientras que Sonia es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 3 hijos, Sonia viaja a las ferias donde compra papa, cereales, animales menores, productos que vende en el mercado Nery garcía.

Carmen, Paulina y Sonia necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 400 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de cacao, azúcar, cebada, arveja, papa, haba y queso.

Sus ahorros lo utilizarán para alguna emergencia y para la educación de sus hijos. Los sueños de Carmen, Paulina y Sonia son mejorar más su negocio, sacar adelante a sus hijos, construir su casa.

loans.use: Carmen, Paulina and Sonia are requesting loans of 600,400 and 1000 soles respectively. They want to invest the funds in buying cocoa, sugar, wheat, potatoes, cheese and other items.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria has been part of the Community Bank “Llapanchik” - which means “Everyone” in the indigenous language of Quechua – for 9 years. Through the bank she learned how to save, prevent diseases and how to invest.

Candelaria is 42 years old. She is separated and mother of 2 children who are 19 and 17 years old. Candelaria has a small kiosk, in a stadium, in the city of Ayacucho. She sells candy, fruits, and beverages. She started in business many years ago with 50 soles little by little it grew. She has had the kiosk for 1 year. She is requesting a loan of 2200 soles. She wants to buy cookies, soda pops to diversify her kiosk merchandise. Candelaria plans on using her savings to send her son to the police academy. Her dream is to better equip her kiosk and to see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer.

Candelaria es socia del Banco Comunal “Llapanchik” que significa “Todos” en quechua hace 9 años. En su Banco Comunal aprendió a ahorrar, como evitar las enfermedades, los valores y como invertir el dinero.

Candelaria es separada, tiene 42 años y 2 hijos de 19, 17 años, Candelaria tiene un Kiosco en el estadio de la ciudad de Ayacucho, donde vende golosinas, frutas, bebidas, Candelaria inició su negocio hace muchos años con un capital de 50 soles, poco a poco fue creciendo, y hace 1 año tiene su kiosco.

Candelaria necesita un préstamo de 2200 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de galletas, gaseosas y para implementar su kiosco con mas andamios.

Sus ahorros lo utilizará para los estudios de su hijo que postulara a la escuela de policía. Los sueños de Candelaria son equipar bien su negocio, ampliar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: She is requesting a loan of 2200 soles. She wants to buy cookies, soda pops to diversify her kiosk merchandise.

loans.name: Berna's Group

texts.es:
Berna, Julia and Gath have been part of the Community Bank - “Llapanchik” which means “ Everyone” in the indigenous language of Quechua – for 12, 13, and year respectively. Through the bank they learned how to invest, save and deal with customers.

Berna is 48 years old and married. She lives with her husband and 3 children. She travels on Saturdays and Sundays to buy cereals, small animals, and cheeses to sell in the city of Ayacucho.

Julia is 39 years old and married. She lives with 5 of her 7 children. Julia travels and buys cheeses and sheep and sells them in the market of Santa Clara.

Gath is 25 years old and single. She is studying Education. Gath and her mother sell vegetables, fruits and legumes. Gath also works with catalog sales.

Berna, Julia and Gath are requesting loans of 600, 1000 and 800 soles respectively. They will invest in buying potatoes, cheeses, sheep, sugar, milk, cereals and other items. Their dreams are to own a hotel, be successful in her careers, build their homes and educate their children.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer.

Berna, Julia y Gath pertenecen al Banco Comunal “Llapanchik” que significa “Todos” en quechua hace 12, 13, 1 años respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a como invertir en sus negocios, a ahorrar y como atender al cliente.

Berna es casada, tiene 48 años y 6 hijos D. los cuales solo 3 viven con elL., Berna viaja a las ferias los días sábados y domingos donD. compra cereales, animales menores, quesos y lo reparte a sus clientes en L. ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Por otro lado Julia es casada, tiene 39 años y 7 hijos D. los cuales solo 5 viven con elL., Julia viaja a las ferias D. L. región donD. compra queso, carnero y lo venD. en el mercado Santa Clara.

Mientras que Gath es soltera y tiene 25 años, estudiante D. Educación, Gath junto a su mamá tienen un multiservicios donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras, útiles, frutas. Además Gath venD. productos naturales por catálogo.

Berna, Julia y Gath necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 1000 soles, 800 soles, dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. papa, cebada, arveja, queso, carnero, cerdo, azúcar, leche y cereales.

Los sueños D. Berna, Julia y Gath son tener un hotel, terminar su carrera, construir su casa y educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: Berna, Julia and Gath are requesting loans of 600, 1000 and 800 soles respectively. They will invest in buying potatoes, cheeses, sheep, sugar, milk, cereals and other items.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea A. es madre de familia de 3 hijos, actualmente su marido trabaja como albañil por su cuenta, movida por la necesidad de apoyar a su marido en el gasto familiar y su gusto por las ventas emprendió un negocio hace ya 8 años.

Inicio con la venta de ropa posteriormente lo combino con la venta de zapatos por catalogo y actualmente cuenta con una pequeña mercería, realizando simultáneamente las 3 actividades. Desea el crédito de US $950 que esta dispuesta a pagar en 6 meses para surtir mercancía ya que espera un incremento en sus ventas.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer.

Andrea A. is married with three children. Her husband works in construction.

Since her husband’s income was not enough to sustain the family, she started selling clothes and shoes by catalog eight years ago. Additionally Andrea has a little grocery store. At the present time she is involved with the three activities and would like to increase her sales for that reason she is requesting a loan of $950 to be repaid in 6 months to increase her inventory and income.

She started selling clothes and later selling shoes by catalog.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Fahara Janett

texts.es:
Fahara Rodríguez is a woman of Juárez, NL. She is a mother of 2 children, one of 5 months and another of 6 years. The idea to sell items via catalog was born amidst her wishes to succeed. In this way, she would be able to give her family a better quality of life and have extra income in addition to that of her husband who works as a machine operator at a company.

She hopes to count on the financial help of $475 USD which she will pay in 3 months to have the capital to purchase orders that her clients make.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Fahara Rodríguez es una mujer de Juárez, NL quien es madre de 2 niños uno de 5 meses y otro de 6 años, entre sus deseos de superación nació la idea de vender artículos por catalogo para así darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y tener ingresos extra además del sueldo de su marido quien labora como Tornero en una empresa.

Espera contar con el apoyo económico de $475.00 Dlls que pagara en 3 meses para así tener capital para poder comprar los pedidos que sus clientes le realizan.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Blanca Patricia

texts.es:
Blanca Patricia G. F. tiene una familia integrada por4 hijos de 11, 12, 16 y 24 años, ella esta casada y su marido se dedica a hacer trabajos de albañilería por su cuenta lo que generaba inestabilidad económica e su familia dado que el trabajo de su esposo era eventual por lo que un día hace 5 años compro una paca de ropa y la empezó a vender con éxito entre sus amistades, posteriormente emprendió viajes a Chinconcuac, México donde compra la ropa que ahora vende.

Ella desea contar con su apoyo para reunir US $475 que pagara en un plazo de 6 meses para así poder ir con un mayor capital y así comprar más mercancía ya que sus ventas se están incrementando.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer.

Blanca Patricia G. F. is married with 4 children 11,12,16 and 24 years old. Her husband works on construction jobs independently. Since his job does not provide stable income, 5 years ago she started to sell clothes among her friends. She now goes to Chinconcuac in Mexico where she buys the clothes in bulk and resells them.

She’s requesting a loan of $475 to be repaid in 6 months with this money she plans on increase her inventory.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Jaime Armando

texts.es:
At a young age Jaime left home so as to not be a burden to his parents. His parents did not have enough money to pay the expenses of both Jaime and his siblings. For this reason about 3 years ago Jaime began selling clothing and gifts in a small local store. Little by little he established himself in the community and now he has a considerable amount of faithful customers.

Nevertheless, Jaime wants to expand his business even more so that in the future, when he finds the ideal woman of his dreams, he will be able to marry and support a family. For this reason he is asking for a loan of $375, which he will repay within 6 months. With the money Jaime will buy more merchandise to advance his business. With your help Jaime will turn his dream into reality of running his own business.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Jaime a su corta edad comenzó a independizarse para no ser una carga para sus padres quienes no tienen tanto dinero para poder pagar los gastos de él y de sus hermanos. Fue por eso que hace 3 años comenzó a vender ropa y artículos para regalos en un pequeño local. Poco a poco se fue haciendo conocido y actualmente ya cuenta con un número considerable de clientes.

Sin embargo Jaime desea que su negocio crezca para que en un futuro que encuentre a la mujer ideal, poder casarse y formar una familia. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Jaime podrá comprar más mercancía para poder darle surtido a su negocio. Con tu ayuda Jaime logrará hacer su sueño realidad de tener su propio negocio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Like any mother who wishes the best for her children, Gloria S. U. works hard in order to provide her children with an education and a brighter future. She sells both generic and natural products. Gloria's work functions as a second source of income for the family. She has helped her husband handle family expenses and together they have made it through tough economic times. Her husband works in a wholesale food market.

Gloria, a diligent woman from Juárez, is requesting a $475 loan, which she will pay back within 3 months. With the money she will buy the products that her customers demand.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Gloria S. U. como toda madre de familia deseosa de que sus 3 hijos tengan un mejor futuro y sabiendo que esto se puede lograra a través de la educación decidió iniciar las venta de productos genéricos y naturistas para apoyar a su marido quien trabaja en una mercado de abastos, dado que sus ingresos eran insuficientes para los gastos de escuela de sus pequeños y pasaban por un periodo económicamente critico.

Es así como ella una mujer emprendedora de Juárez, N.L. solicita de su apoyo para reunir US $475 que pagara en un plazo de 3 meses para poder comprar los productos que sus clientes le solicitan.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Luis Esteban

texts.es:
Luis Esteban is a young man who likes to make his own way. He runs a clothing business, which is how Luis supports his family and pays home expenses. Little by little and with hard work his business has expanded.

Still, Luis wants his business to grow even more. For this reason he is requesting a $375 loan which he will pay back in 6 months. With the money Luis will buy more merchandise. This way he will have new products to offer to his customers. With your help Luis will be able to establish himself, save money, expand his business and form a family.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Luis Esteban es un joven a quien le gusta salir a delante por sus propias manos. Actualmente tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y accesorios para poder sacar dinero para pagar los gastos de él y ayudar a su familia con los gastos de su casa. Poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo Luis Esteban está creciendo su negocio.

Sin embargo Luis desea crecerlo más. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Luis podrá comprar mercancía para poder tener nuevas cosas que ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Luis podrá establecerse y en un futuro ahorrar para poder crecer más y formar una familia.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan Antonio started his own business ten years ago in the city of Guadalupe, Nuevo Leon. He was without a job, and after several months of job searching with no success, he decided to start his own food selling business. He is divorced and he has to contribute alimony to support his two children.

Currently he needs to buy more merchandise to supply his business, and that is why he is requesting a loan of $300 which he will repay in 3 months. Let's support Toño so that he can keep on contributing to the education and development of his children.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Juan Antonio inicio un negocio hace 10 años en Ciudad Guadalupe, N.L. cuando se quedo sin empleo y después de estar varios meses tratando de colocarse en algún empleo sin éxito, decidió hacer algo por su cuenta y se inclino por un negocio de venta de comida, ya que se encontraba separado pero debía contribuir para la manutención de sus 2 hijos.

Actualmente el necesita comprar mercancía para surtir su negocio por lo que solicita de su apoyo requiere US $300 los cuales liquidara en un plazo de 3 meses. Apoyemos a Toño para que pueda seguir contribuyendo a la educación y desarrollo de sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel M. C. does everything he can to provide for his 4 children. 20 years ago he and his wife had their first child. From then on Manuel worked welding doors and windows. Little by little he learned this trade and generated the income needed to pay for home expenses. From there Manuel and his wife went on to have 3 more kids.

Thanks to Manuel's hard work, his family has been able to move forward. Nevertheless there is still much ground to cover. For this reason Manuel is asking for a $750 loan, which he will repay in 6 months. With the money he will be able to buy a new welding machine. This way he will be able to provide customers with better service. With your help Manuel will be able to support and empower his family.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Manuel M. C. es padre de familia de 4 pequeños a quienes desea brindarles siempre lo mejor. Hace 20 años que su esposa quedó embarazada. Fue como Manuel comenzó a dedicarse a soldar puertas y ventanas. Poco a poco se fue dando a conocer y de ese trabajo sacó dinero para poder pagar los gastos de su casa y los que iban surgiendo con el nacimiento de sus otros 3 hijos.

Gracias a esta labor que realiza Manuel es por lo que ha podido salir adelante su familia. Sin embargo queda mucho camino por recorrer y es por eso que Manuel está solicitando un crédito de US $750 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Manuel podrá comprar una máquina para soldar nueva para poder ofrecerles mejor servicio a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Manuel logrará sacar a su familia adelante.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine

loans.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.es:
Maria Ofelia lives in the city of Juarez, Nuevo Leon with her husband and their three children. She started her own business to help support her husband with the house expenses as well as the education of the children. She does catalog sales and slowly all her family (including her husband and kids) started getting involved and helping her by selling to colleagues and acquaintances.

Ofelia requires $475 which she will repay in 3 months in order to buy merchandise for her business. She and her family hope that with the support that they receive they will be able to prosper and make her business more successful.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

María Ofelia radica en la Ciudad de Juárez, Nuevo León vive con esposo quien es soldador y sus 3 hijos, ella inicio su negocio para apoyar a su esposo en la educación de sus pequeños así como en gastos de la casa, se dedica a las ventas por catalogo poco a poco toda la familia se fue involucrando ayudándole a Ofelia tanto sus hijos como su esposo, vendiéndole a sus compañeros y conocidos.
