Ofelia requiere US $475 que pagara a 3 meses para invertir en mercancía para su negocio, ella y su familia esperan que con el apoyo que reciban puedan seguir prosperando y hacer este negocio más exitoso.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: María Del Refugio

texts.es:
Unfortunately, Maria del Refugio suffers from advanced diabetes and can not work in a company because sometimes she feels very ill. That is why she decided to start her own business in order not to be a burden to her husband.

Moreover, Maria has 6 children and she needs to contribute to the household’s income as her husband’s salary is not enough to sustain them.

Maria sells food and groceries. She started in 2000 selling her food on a small wooden table and 3 different types of meals. Now she has a better stand outside of her house.

Now Maria would like her business to grow even more. Therefore, she requests a loan of $475 that she will pay in 6 months. With this money, Maria will buy more merchandise for her business. With your help, Maria will be able to bring up her family and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Desgraciadamente María Del Refugio padece de diabetes, enfermedad que ya tiene avanzada y por la cual no puede mantener un trabajo en empresa puesto que en muchas ocasiones se siente muy mal. Es por eso que decidió comenzar su propio negocio para no ser una carga para su esposo.

Además de que María tiene 6 hijos a los cuales tienen que mantener y con lo que gana su esposo no es suficiente. María vende comidas y abarrotes fuera de una empresa. Comenzó en el 2000 con una pequeña mesa de madera y tres guisos. Actualmente ya tiene un establecimiento más elaborado fuera de su casa.

Sin embargo María desea crecer más su negocio. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero María podrá comprar mercancía para tener bien surtido su negocio. Con tu ayuda María logrará sacar adelante su negocio y a sus 6 hijos.

loans.use: Maria will buy more merchandise for her food and groceries business

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
María Guadalupe is a fruit and vegetable salesperson in the city of Guadalupe. She started 7 years ago to support her family with expenses. She inherited this business from her father, and now not only sells these products, but also steamed tacos.

She would like a loan of $575 USD that she will repay in 6 months; she counts on your cooperation since she needs to buy merchandise to continue working and see an increase in sales.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

María Guadalupe es comerciante de frutas y verduras en ciudad Guadalupe inicio hace 7 años para apoyar a su familia en los gastos familiares este oficio lo heredo de su padre, ahora ella no solo vende estas sino también tacos a vapor.

Ella desea un crédito de US $575 que liquidara en 6 meses, espera contar son su cooperación ya que necesita comprar mercancía para continuar trabajando ya que espera u incremento en sus ventas.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Nora Patricia

texts.es:
Nora Patricia N. is the mother of two teenagers (ages 13 and 15). Six years ago she was looking for an activity that would allow her to produce some income to help contribute with her husband to the daily expenses. While she was unemployed she had the opportunity to buy a batch of clothes, which she then re-sold, and realizing that this activity could provide her with some earnings, she decided to continue with it.

Now she needs economic support in the amount of $300, which she will repay in three months, in order to buy merchandise so that she can continue to support her husband. Nora and her family await for your cooperation.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Nora Patricia N. es madre de 2 adolescentes de 13 y 15 años, hace 6 años estaba en busca de una actividad que le permitiera generar ingresos para apoyar su marido con los gastos familiares ya que en ese momento se encontraba desempleado fue así como se le presentó la oportunidad de comparar una paca de ropa, la cual revendió al darse cuenta de que generaba buenos ingresos decidió continuar con esto.

Ahora ella requiere de un apoyo económico de US $300 los cuales pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y continuar apoyando a su esposo. Nora y su familia esperan tu cooperación.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Amanecer De La Mujer Group

texts.en:
“Amanecer D. L. mujer” is a small rural community bank of FINCA Peru’s Wari-project which provides its credit with educational services in the rural areas of Huancavelica. Huancavelica is considered one of the poorest regions of Peru and has many limitations, being a very mountainous area (altituD. ranges from 6,000 – 17,000 ft above sea level). People there also face the cold, the difficulty growing crops, and the lack of an adequate infrastructure of roads and communication systems.

BCR “Amanecer D. L. mujer”, whose name can be translated as the “Awakening of the Woman”, is located in the community of AntacalL. in the district of Anco, province of Churcampa. The main activities of the population are growing corn (lower altitudes), potatoes and wheat (higher altitudes); raising guinea-pigs, pigs, and chicken, and they also have cows and bulls. The community of AntacalL. faces many difficulties due to its remoteness, lack of public transportation and access to markets. It receives very little in the way of public and social services.

The bank has just completed half a year of existence and its first loan-cycle, with currently 11 female borrowers and a total loan of 3,600 soles (about US$ 1,240). The loans range from 100, 200, 400 soles, up to 600 soles. Besides repaying their loans, the group was able to save over 1,500 soles (about US$ 520) during the first loan-cycle, and they will continue to put asiD. savings in the future.

During their first loan cycle, most members have learned how to do business. Whereas before most of their production was for home consumption, more and more they have learned to be entrepreneurs, to earn a little money with the work they do. And, sometimes for the first time in their lives, they have learned how to improve the quality of their lives and the importance of saving.

One of the members of the community bank is Saturnina Durán Chacasan. Saturnina buys and sells "tuna", the fruit of the tuna-cactus. Besides buying the fruit down at the Mantaro river-basin, she grows her own tuna in a small field of tuna-cactuses. She sells her tunas in one of the major cities in the central Peruvian Andes, Huancayo, more than 5 hours away from AntacalL.--at least, when she is lucky enough to find transportation. Her new loan of 500 soles, she will not invest in her tuna-business, however. This time she will buy a cow! Starting a new business! Although the cow will cost her 1,000 soles, she will put in the other half of the price of the cow herself, from her savings. One of the things she learned in FINCA Peru is not to talk badly of other people.

Another story is that of Florentina M. Durán, who has her business of baking and selling bread. Like all women in the community bank, she also has her fields with corn and wheat. Most of the production is for home consumption, but fortunately she also is able to sell some of her product. She will invest her 200 soles loan to buy more wheat for her bakery.

Rosa Ana S. D. L. C., who has requested a 400 soles loan, has a small business selling shoes, and Sundays when AntacalL. has its weekly market, she also sells meals. She will invest her loan in buying new shoes for her business. It's a good time for that, because schools are about to start again, and most children need new shoes to go with their school uniforms. And, like most members of her group, her dream is for her family to improve their quality of life and for her four children to study. She will use her savings for buying school necessities because a new school year is starting.

loans.use: expanding their small businesses or starting up new ones

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa has 2 kids and her husband works as a printer. What he earns is not enough to pay the household bills, and this is why, for 23 years, Maria Luisa has been selling clothes and accesories to factory workers who, little by little, have come to know about her. Now she has many clients who are always asking her for clothes.

However, she does not have enough merchandise to offer to her clients. This is why she is asking for a loan of $375 that she will repay over a period of 6 months, and with this money Maria Luisa will be able to buy this season's clothes to offer a variety to her clients, so that she will not lose them to competition. With your help, Maria Luisa will be able to help her kids move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

María Luisa tiene dos hijos y su esposo trabaja como impresor. Y con lo que gana no es suficiente para pagar los gastos de su familia. Fue por eso que María Luisa comenzó hace 23 años a vender ropa y accesorios a los empleados de fábricas y poco a poco se fue dando a conocer. Actualmente ya tiene varios clientes que constantemente le piden ropa.

Sin embargo no cuenta con mercancía suficiente para poder ofrecerles a sus clientes. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero María Luisa podrá comprar mercancía de temporada para así poder ofrecerle variedad a sus clientes y éstos no se vayan con la competencia. Con tu ayuda María Luisa logrará sacar a sus dos hijos adelante.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Comprar mercancía

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Looking for a way to support her husband and provide the best to her 3 young children, Patricia T. started to work with her sister 7 years ago. She started selling used clothes to later acquire a bulk of clothing to start her own business.

She currently needs $300 USD to purchase merchandise since her sales are increasing. She will repay this loan over the course of 3 months. Lets support Paty so she can reach her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Patricia T. buscando apoyar a su esposo y brindarle a sus 3 pequeños hijos lo mejor, hace 7 años empezó a trabajar con su hermana vendiendo ropa usada para posteriormente adquirir una paca e iniciar su negocio.

Actualmente necesita US $ 300 para comprar mercancía ya que ahora sus ventas se están incrementando, este crédito lo pagara en 3 meses. Apoyemos a Paty para que vea realizadas sus metas.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.es:
Three years ago, because of a family problem, she visited a prison, and saw that the prisoners were doing drawings. It was from there that she got the idea of selling them therefore helping herself and the prisoners. Bit by bit she started to advertise them, and saw results. Now she has clients who ask for different types of drawings. Moreover, she also added clothes that she buys to the list of items she sells.

However, Rosalinda does not have enough merchandise to offer her clients. This is why she is asking for a credit of $675 which she will repay over a period of 6 months, and with this money Rosalinda will be able to buy merchandise to offer to her clients. With your help Rosalinda will be able to do well with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Hace 3 año, por un problema de un familiar, visitó el penal, y fue ahí donde se dio cuenta que los internos realizaban cuadros. Y fue ahí donde surgió la idea de venderlos para así ayudarse ella y ayudar a los internos. Poco a poco comenzó a ofrecerlos, dándole resultados. Actualmente ya cuenta con clientes que le piden cuadros de diferentes tipos. Además de que después agregó a sus ventas, ropa que ella compraba.

Sin embargo Rosalinda no cuenta con mercancía suficiente para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $675 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Rosalinda podrá comprar mercancía para así poder ofrecerles a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Rosalinda logrará sacar adelante su negocio y a los reos.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Comprar mercancía

loans.name: Eshkuzi

texts.en: A. Eshkuzi is 52 years old and is married with three children. Eshkuzi has been raising and selling cattle since 2000. Every morning he gets up at 6am in order to feed the animals and look after them. Eshkuzi now sells 2 cows per month. The business is successful and generates a stable income for his family, allowing them to  improve their living conditions. Today Eshkuzi requests a loan of 2000.00 Somoni (600.00 US Dollars) for 12 months. The loan is required for the purchasing of  cattle and of fodder for them. This is the first loan for Eshkuzi and he thanks everyone for trusting and supporting him and promises to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: To expand a cattle business

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.en: C. Abdullo is 40 years old and is married with two children of school age.  He is a cattleman. At the present time, he is raising five head of cattle (two of them small cattle) on 0.20 hectares of  land where he grows fodder for them.  Abdullo has been in this business for 11 years already. The business is successful and generates a stable income for his family. Now Abdullo is planning to expand the business and purchase more small cattle. For this reason, he requests a loan of 3000.00 Somoni (875.00 US Dollars) for 9 months. Abdullo has a positive credit history and promises to repay the loan promptly.  He hanks everyone for supporting him.

loans.use: Purchasing of small cattle for sale

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.en: C. Marhamat is 50 years old. She is a vendor in the central local market where she sells candies and other sweets. This business has been the main source of income for Marhamat's family for the last 12 years, allowing improvement of their living conditions. Now Marhamat is planning to expand her business and to increase the range of goods for sale. Therefore, she requests US$1,000.00 for 5 months. Marhamat has been a client of IMON since 2005 and she promises to repay the loan promptly. She thanks everyone who supports her.

loans.use: To expand a sweets selling business.

loans.name: Yahe

texts.en:
Yahe is 56 years old. He and his wife have raised six children. Yahe is a doctor at the City Central Hospital. Yahe was raised in a rural area. Though he had graduated from the Medical Institute and worked as a doctor for more than 20 years, Yahe never forgot how to work the land. Ten years ago he decided to find an additional source of income in order to better support his large family and to arrange the weddings and dowry for all of his children. Thus he started growing onions.

Yahe believes that the onion business is quite profitable and generates considerable additional income for his family. He now requests a loan of 2,000.00 Somoni (US$600.00) for 12 months to purchase seeds and fertilizer. Yahe has received one previous loan and managed it with accuracy. He promises to repay the new loan on a timely basis and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: Purchasing of the seeds and fertilizer for growing the onion.

loans.name: Komila

texts.en:
Komila is 36 years old and is married with four school-age children. She runs a private store in which she sells a wide range of goods including foodstuffs, soft drinks and perfumes. Komila has been in this business for 13 years and is successful. Her husband left for Russia to increase his earnings and now Komila works even harder to generate sufficient income for her family.

Komila plans to enlarge the range of goods for sale in her store. For this purpose she requests US$650.00 for 3 months. Komila has been a client of IMON since 2005 and has proved herself to be reliable. She promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To diversify  goods in a store.

loans.name: Abdukayum

texts.en:
Abdukayum is 31 years old and is married with three children. He is a market vendor of animal fodder. The income generated by this business is mainly used to purchase small bulls for future sale. Abdukayum is an on-going client of IMON and he is grateful to mention that his IMON association has enabled him to develop his business quickly and to improve the living conditions of his family.

Now Abdukayum has applied for a loan of 3,000.00 Somoni (US$875.00) for 12 months. He plans to increase his working capital to expand the business and will then use the generated income to establish a private farm for breeding cattle. Abdukayum thanks all who support him and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To Increase working capital in order to expand and diversify a cattle business

loans.name: Chamshed

texts.en: Chamshed is 24 years old and is married with two children.  He began working as a cook when he was 16 years old and thereby gained much experience.  Chamshed decided to run his own café but he did not have sufficient funds for a private café.  Therefore,  he rents one located in the central market of the city where he provides various meals of both the national and European cuisines. The business is profitable and Chamshed hopes one day to open his own private café. However, at this time he needs to purchase foodstuffs such as potatoes, carrots, onions, and oil for cooking. He requests a loan of US$600.00 for 12 months. This is the first loan for Chamshed. He thanks everyone for trusting him and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs for cooking meals in a café

loans.name: Murodbek

texts.en:
Murodbek is 37 years old and is married with two children. He is a market vendor who sells oil and animal fat in the central local market. In traditional Tajik cuisine, the majority of foods are fried or cooked using much oil and animal fat. So the goods that Murodbek sells are of popular demand among the population. Six years ago Murodbek started his business with a rather small amount of money, and today the business is stable with a turnover of US$9,000.00.

Now Murodbek plans to purchase more oil and animal fat in order to increase the amount of his goods for sale. He requests US$1,000.00 for 9 months. Murodbek thanks all and, being a client with a positive credit history, he promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To diversify goods for sale

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.en:
Munavvar is 54 years old and she raises four children alone. Munavvar is a market vendor who sells foodstuffs such as oil, salt, and macaroni products. She trades in four local markets, thus trying to increase her income and make her business more profitable. Munavvar's business has been her main source of income for the last twelve years, allowing her to support her large family alone.

Now Munavvar plans to increase her inventory. For this purpose, she requests a loan of 2,700.00 Somoni (US$800.00) for 9 months. Having received loans from IMON several times, she has proved herself a reliable client. Munavvar promises to manage the current loan with accuracy.

loans.use: To increase inventory for sale.

loans.name: Ugil

texts.en:
Ugil is 57 years old. She and her husband have raised nine children. Ugil is a market vendor. Every day, early in the morning, Ugil goes to the city bus station in order to meet her suppliers. She purchases eggs, chicken and dairy products for low wholesale prices. Then she sells all the goods in the local market for retail prices. Ugil's son and daughter help her in the business. Ugil's husband is a pensioner, so the current business is the main source of income for the family.

Ugil has borrowed from IMON several times and she expresses her gratitude to the organization, stating that with the help of IMON she was able to develop her business and to have the funds for purchasing her goods. Now she requests 600.00 Somoni (US$175.00 ) for 4 months. Ugil thanks all for support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale products for sale

loans.name: Khotam

texts.en:
Khotam is 43 years old and is married with four children. He is a jack of all trades in the sphere of construction and repair. Khotam works as a foreman on a team that provides minor and major repairs of houses and apartments. At the same time, he is a very good carpenter. Khotam dreams of providing a higher education for all of his four sons. Moreover in Tajikistan there is a tradition that a father has to build a house for each of his sons. Knowing all this, Khotam is working really hard to make the business successful and generate a stable income for his large family.

Khotam now plans to purchase construction equipment. This loan is his first. Khotam promises to work harder to be able to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchasing of the construction equipment.

loans.name: Karomat

texts.en:
Karomat is 35 years old and is married with four children. She is a market vendor who sells grains and legumes. Karomat travels to the neighboring country of Uzbekistan to purchase her goods. As a rule, Karomat sells her grains and legumes in the local market of her home city as well as in the market of the neighboring region of Isfara. The business is successful, allowing Karomat to contribute significantly to the family budget and to help her husband support their family and her husband's parents.

Karomat plans to increase the range of goods for sale. For this purpose, she requests US $650.00 for 3 months. Karomat has proven herself as a reliable client with several years of cooperation with IMON. She promises to manage the loan with accuracy and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Amin

texts.en:
Amin is 54 years old and has been raising cattle for the last 27 years. During those years, two of his children became adults and now help him, as does his wife. Currently Amin has 6 head of cattle in the household. This type of business is both time-consuming and labor-consuming. At the same time, it generates stable profits.

In spring Amin plans to purchase three more cows and the fodder for them. For this purpose, he requests US $600.00 for 8 months. This is Amin's first loan and he is grateful to everyone for trusting and supporting him. He promises not to let his supporters down.

loans.use: To expand a cattle business

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 45 years old and is married with four children. She is a market vendor who sells confections including caramel, sugar and chocolate. She also picks almond nuts and sells them wholesale. Fatima first applied to IMON  several years ago and she states that IMON helped her to develop her business and increase the income for her family. 

Fatima now requests 3,000.00 Somoni (US$875.00) for 12 months. She plans to increase her working capital and to purchase land in the center of the region to construct a private store. Fatima thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: Increasing of the working capital and expanding of the business and constructing of the private store.

loans.name: Islom

texts.en: Islom is 48 years old. He and his wife are raising four children, two of whom are still going to school. Islom has been a cattleman for 20 years. During these years he became a real expert in knowing which cattle to choose for breeding and how to raise them. He loves the animals and feels satisfied when he sees the results of his labor. Currently Islom has five cows for sale and is planning to purchase another two cows to raise. He shall also need to purchase the fodder they need. For all this Islom requests US$600.00 for  8 months. This is the first loan for Islom and he promises to repay it on time and thanks everyone for trusting and supporting him.

loans.use: To increase a cattle business

loans.name: Muhtor

texts.en: Muhtor is 46 years old. He and his wife have raised four children. Muhtor has been providing taxi services with his vehicle for 8 years. Muhtor owns both the vehicle and the taxi business license. In order to decrease his expenses for fuel, and consequently reduce the fees for his services, Muhtor plans to replace the vehicle's current gasoline fuel supply system with a system using another type of gas. For this purpose he requests a loan of US $950.00 for 10 months. This is Muhtor's first loan and he thanks everyone for their trust and support and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To modify a taxi to use less expensive fuel

loans.name: Kurbonjon

texts.en:
Kurbonjon is 36 years old and is married with four children of school age. She runs a café where she provides meals of both the national and European cuisines. The café is located in the central local market, which allows Kurbonjon to have many clients from among the market's customers. The business has been generating a stable income for the past 7 years. Kurbonjon's husband is unemployed and the business is their only one source of income.

Kurbonjon plans to purchase foodstuffs including potatoes, carrots, onions, and oil at wholesale prices. For this purpose, she requests US $900.00 for 5 months. Kurbonjon has been provided with several loans by IMON and has proved herself to be a reliable client. She thanks all who have supported her and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To enable the purchase of wholesale-priced foodstuffs for a cafe

loans.name: Nafosat

texts.en:
Nafosat is 24 years old and is married with one child. Nafosat works the land together with her husband and his parents. This united family works hard; during the growing season, they work in the fields from the early morning until late at night. Nafosat grows crops such as potatoes and carrots. The family business is stable and generates their main income.

Nafosat plans to purchase seeds and fertilizer. For this purpose she requests US $850.00 for 9 months. Part of the loan will be spent for the salaries of hired seasonal workers. Nafosat has already demonstrated herself to be an accurate client. She promises to repay the new loan on time and thanks all for their support.

loans.use: To support farming during the next growing season.

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.en:
Abdusattor is 48 years old and is married with four children.  He is a foreman on a farm and,  at the same time, he works his own land where he grows such crops as potatoes and carrots. Moreover, Abdusattor sells the small cattle that he buys and raises in his household. Abdusattor's wife and two sons are also involved in the business and help him. The business is successful, generating a stable income for the family and allowing for the improvement of their living conditions. 

Abdusattor requests US $1,100.00 for 12 months. The loan will be spent for the purchase of mineral fertilizer,  seeds and cattle. Abdusattor has a positive credit history and promises to repay this current loan on time. He thanks all who support him.

loans.use: To support the coming season's planting and expansion of a cattle business

loans.name: Murot

texts.en:
Murot is 48 years old and he and his wife have raised two children.  Murot breeds cattle and currently has three cows in his household. After ten years in this business that requires much time, effort, and labor, Murot strongly believes that his efforts are profitable and allow him to support his family and his parents. The wife of Murot who is pictured is also involved into the business and helps the husband to look after the animals.

Now Murot plans to expand the business and to purchase more fodder for his cattle. For this purpose, he requests US $600.00 for 8 months. Borrowing for the first time, Murot promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all for trusting him.

loans.use: Purchasing of 1 cow and the fodder.

loans.name: Harng

texts.en:
Mrs Harng H., 23, is married and cares for her  young child at home everyday. She and her husband, Mr. Yoeurn Yen, are rice farmers and duck feeders who earn about $6 a day. She lives with her family in the Krosung Krom Tbong Village in the Staung District of the Kompong Thom Province. The business allows Harng and her husband to support their family’s living expenses.

In order to expand her duck-feeding business, Harng  requests a loan of $1,100 to buy more 500 ducks. She appreciates Kiva for their support and promises to be prompt in repaying her loan

loans.use: To buy  500 more ducks in order to expand her duck-feeding business

loans.name: Munavar

texts.en:
Munavar is 66 years old; she and her husband have raised ten children. In spite of her senior age, Munavar is still full of energy and works hard. She worked on a collective farm and later on she bought the plot of land that she works today. There is 1 hectare of land where Munavar grows grapes and 0.50 hectare of  garden.  Munavar has been in this business for 20 years and has managed to make her business profitable. 

Munavar plans to purchase mineral fertilizer and to pay the salaries of hired seasonal workers. For this purpose,  she requests US $850.00 for 9 months. Munavar has proved herself a reliable client and she promises to repay this loan promptly.

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizer and hired seasonal labor

loans.name: Marhamad

texts.en:
Marhamad is 52 years old and has worked for 15 years as a market vendor. She sells dishes of the Oriental style in the central local market. This kind of china is popular and is widely used for girls' dowries and family celebrations.

Marhamad plans to enlarge the range her goods and to purchase china in the neighboring countries of Uzbekistan and Kyrgyzstan. For this purpose she requests US $1,000.00 for 5 months. Marhamad is a client of IMON with a positive credit history. She promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks everyone for supporting her.

loans.use: To increase and diversify inventory

loans.name: Ergash

texts.en:
Ergash is 44 years old and is married with four children. He is a farmer who works a plot of 0.60 hectare where he grows potatoes and watermelons. He also breeds cattle. Ergash has been running this business for ten years and during that time it has become very stable and profitable. The farm generates the main income of the family, allowing Ergash to improve their living conditions. 

Ergash plans to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuel and cattle for breeding.  Ergash is aclient of IMON with a positive credit history and he promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To support a farm and cattle business

loans.name: Masudajon

texts.en:
Masudajon is 48 years old and is married with three children. She is a market vendor who sells dishes of the Oriental style in the central local market. Masudajon has been in this business for ten years and with it she supports her family and her husband’s parents.

Masudajon plans to increase her inventory and to purchase the dishes and plates at wholesale prices. For this purpose, she requests US $900.00 for 5 months. Masudajon thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchasing of the dishes and plates as a wholesale in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Ruziboi

texts.en:
Ruziboi is 34 years old and is married with five children. He has a private cattle business in which he breeds cattle and sells two cows a month. In addition, Ruziboi grows fodder for the cattle on rented land. The business is stable and is the main income for Ruziboi's large family. 

Ruziboi is applying for a loan for the first time. He requests 2,000.00 Somoni (US $600.00) for 12 months. The loan will be spent on the purchase of cattle for breeding and selling.

loans.use: To expand a cattle business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for International MicroLoan Fund (IMON), a partner of Mercy Corps - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Kutfi

texts.en:
L. Kutfi is 47 years old. She is married with two children. 

Kutfi is a farmer who grows and processes the grapes. She has been in the business for ten years. Kutfi managed to make the business stable and profitable generating a significant income for the family. 

Kutfi needs to purchase mineral fertilizer. She also hopes to hire seasonal workers to help her. Therefor, Kutfi is requesting $850.00 US Dollars for a term of 9 months. Kutfi had been provided with several loans, that she managed to pay with accuracy and she promises to repay the current loan promptly. Kutfi wishes to thank all for the support.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and hire seasonal workers

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.en:
S. Mavzuna is 27 years old. She is married with two children. 

Mavzuna is a market vendor, selling clothing for kids and  women's shawls. She has been in business for six years. Mavzuna is a friendly and polite woman. She is trying to diversify the range of goods she sells to satisfy the needs of her clients with various levels of income. 

 The business is stable and helps Mavzuna make a considerable contribution to the family budget. Mavzuna is planning to purchase new clothing for kids and head shawls for women. With this purpose she is requesting
$1000 Dollars for a term of 12 months. Mavzuna thanks everyone who's supporting her and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner as she did with her previous loans.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and shawls to diversify goods for sale.

loans.name: Tuhfa

texts.en:
S. Tuhfa is a 46-year-old married woman and has three children. Tuhfa works in a tailoring shop sewing the national quilts. Her shop is well known in the neighborhood. As a result of this she gets lots of orders. Tuhfa has been in this business for 25 years. The business has been successful and generates a stable income allowing Tuhfa to contribute a significant amount to the family budget.

Tuhfa wishes to purchase additional materials required for the production of the quilts. With this purpose she's requesting $1000 for a term of 12 months. Tuhfa expresses her gratitude to everyone that's supporting her and promises to manage the loan with accuracy.

loans.use: To purchase fabric for sewing the national quilts.

loans.name: Muhamadi

texts.en:
M. Muhamadi is 46 years old. He and his wife has two children. Muhamadi is a lawyer, currently working in the Environment Department. However, his salary is not sufficient to meet the expenses of the family. Muhamadi owns a farm in which he grows onions. He has been in business for 10 years. Muhamadi managed to make the business profitable generating a stable income for his family.

Muhamadi is planning to purchase seeds and fertilizer for his farm. He's requesting $700 for a term of 12 months. Having proved himself as a reliable client Muhamadi promises to repay the current loan promptly and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Gies

texts.en:
M. Gies is 43 years old. He is married with three children. Gies has a higher education in industrial engineering. Unfortunately, he was not able to find a job in his specialty. For years he tried various types of activities. Finally, two years ago he started his business selling cell phones. Gies believes that this business is profitable and the income generated allows him to support his family.

However, Gies thinks that it is too expensive to purchase the cell phones locally and plans on purchasing them from China. With this purpose Gies is requesting $600 for a term of 12 months. This is the first time he's requesting a loan. Gies is grateful to everyone that will be supporting him and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase cell phones for sale.

loans.name: Norkuzi

texts.en:
S. Norkuzi is 52 years old. He is married with four children. Norkuzi sells small cattle. His business is private and has been operating for 6 years. After purchasing the small cattle it's kept in Norkuzi's house. Currently he has 10 heads of small cattle for a turnover of $700. The business generates a stable income and helps improve the living conditions for the family.

Norkuzi is requesting $150 for the term of 9 months. Norkuzi will use the loan to purchase fodder for the small cattle. Norkuzi has had previous loans with IMON and has proved himself as an honest client. He thanks everyone that's supporting him and promises to repay the loan with accuracy.

loans.use: Purchase fodder for the cattle

loans.name: Khamdam

texts.en:
M. Khamdam is 56 years old. He is married with six children. Khamdam is a farmer. He is working the land and growing such crops as onion and wheat. At the same time part of the land is allocated for growing grapes. The elder sons and his wife are also involved in the business. He has been in business for thirty years. Khamdam states that the business is profitable allowing him to generate sufficient income to support his large family.

Khamdam needs to purchase seeds and fertilizer. He also wishes to hire seasonal workers. With this purpose he's requesting $900 for the term of 9 months. Khamdam had a previous loan and now he promises to repay the current loan promptly and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: Purchase seeds, fertilizer, and hire seasonal workers

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.en:
M. Firdavs is 27 years old. He is married with three children. Firdavs is a farmer working the land. He has been in this business for 8 years. Firdavs grows such agricultural crops like potato and carrots. Considering that the business is the main source of income for Firdavs, he is working hard in order to make the business stable and successful.

Firdavs is planning to purchase seeds and fertilizer. With this purpose he's requesting $900 for the term of 9 months. This is Firadvs's second loan and he promises to repay the current loan promptly and thanks everyone for their support and trust.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Salom

texts.en:
S. Salom is 45 years old. He is married with three children. Salom has been a cattleman for 7 years. He buys, raises and sells cattle in the local animal market. Currently he has 4 cows for a turnover of approximately $1000. The business is successful generating a considerable amount of income for the family. It also helps improve the living conditions of the family.

Salom is requesting $300 for the term of 9 months. The loan will be used to purchase one cow. He thanks everyone that's supporting him. He has a positive credit history and he promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase one cow.

loans.name: Dodo

texts.en:
S. Dodo is 48 years old. He is married with four children. Dodo is a doctor and working in the Central Regional Hospital. Considering that he has a large family the salary of a doctor is not sufficient to fully support his family. Dodo decided to find an additional source of income. Thus Dodo grows onions. This business is stable and generates a significant income for the family.

Dodo is requesting $600 for the term of 12 months. The loan will be used to purchase seeds required for growing onions. Dodo has been given a loan once before and he managed the loan with accuracy. He promises to repay the current loan promptly and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds for growing onions.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for International MicroLoan Fund (IMON), a partner of Mercy Corps - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Norkuzi

texts.en:
S. Norkuzi is 46 years old. He is married with five children. Norkuzi is a cattleman. He purchases the cattle in the local market, and then he breeds them and sells. The cattle are kept in the house and it takes a lot of effort by Norkuzi to care for them. Every day he gets up early in the morning in order to feed the animals, all day till late at night Norkuzi is busy looking after the cattle. Fifteen years ago Norkuzi started selling one bull, and today his business has turned successful and stable.

Currently he has got a turnover of cattle for the total amount of about $400. The business is the main source of income for the family. Norkuzi is requesting $600 for the term of 12 months. The loan will be spent to purchase fodder for he cattle. Being loaned for the first time, Norkuzi thanks everyone supporting him and promises to be very accurate when managing the loan.

loans.use: Purchase fodder for the cattle.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for International MicroLoan Fund (IMON), a partner of Mercy Corps - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Vahob

texts.en:
V. Vahob is 50 years old. He is married with three children. Vahob has been running his business for more than 14 years. He sells combustive-lubricating materials like benzene, diesel and others. The elder son of Vahob helps him in the business. Vahob believes that the current business is rather profitable and has helped him support his family all these years.

Vahob is planning to expand his business and wishes to increase the inventory of combustive-lubricating materials for selling. With this purpose he's requesting $1000 for the term of 6 months. Vahob has received loans by IMON several times. He promises to repay the current loan promptly and thanks everyone for supporting him.

loans.use: To purchase combustive-lubricating materials to increase inventory

loans.name: Khakim

texts.en:
Khakim is 34 years old. He is married and has a one-year-old son. Khakim is running his own store selling foodstuff along with personal use items like perfumes, tooth brushes razors and other items. Khakim's wife helps him by working as a sales person in the store. At the same time Khakim provides taxi services with his vehicle. His store is located at one of the stops of the public transport system. This helps Khakim to have many clients part of who are customers for his store. Both of these businesses are successful, generating a stable income for the family.

Khakim purchases the goods for selling in his store in the neighboring city. Currently, he's planning to purchase additional inventory in order to increase the range of goods in his store. At the same time his car needs minor fixing. For all of this Khakim is requesting $600 for the term of 9 months. This is the first loan for Khakim and he thanks all who trust and support him, and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for selling in the store and minor fixing of the vehicle.

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.en:
N. Mavzuna is 21 years old. Mavzuna lives with her parents and supports them. Mavzuna is a market vendor. She sells dried fruits and grains. Mavzuna travels to the neighboring country, Uzbekistan to purchase the goods for sale. Mavzuna is trading in the local market of her home city as well as in the market of the neighboring city. Mavzuna has been working in this business trying to make it successful generating a stable income for her parents and her self.

There is a strong trend for further development of the business. She's requesting $675 for the term of 12 months. The loan will be spent to increase the range of goods for sale and thus generate more income. Having proved herself as a reliable client Mavzuna promises to repay the current loan promptly and thanks everyone for supporting her.

loans.use: To purchase dried fruits and grains to increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Gies

texts.en:
S. Gies is 43 years old. He and his wife have 4 children. Gies is a cattleman. He purchases cattle, raising it and selling in the market. The cattle are kept in the house. Gies has been in the business for 5 years. He has gained experience and has very good opportunities for further development.

In the near future Gies is planning to breed small cattle. However, for now he wants to increase the heads of cattle to generate more income from selling them. With this purpose he is requesting $ 1000 for the term of 6 months. This is the first loan for Gies and he thanks everyone supporting him and promises to pay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to increase income.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 30 years old. He is married and has three children. Two of them are studying in the primary school. He has a sister who is suffering from diabetes and is living with his family. He has a small shop of snacks and he applied to borrow $1200 to purchase a new cooking stove and some tables and chairs. He wants to renovate the shop and develop his project to increase his income and save for a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase a new cooking stove and some tables and chairs

loans.name: Budumuli East A C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Suzan N.. She is currently in the business of used clothing sales and is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. Suzan is 24 years old and is married with a husband who is a mechanic for work. She has 1 son aged 4 who goes to school. Each week, Suzan makes approximately UGX 60000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save for future use. Suzan has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to stock more clothes and the loan was paid back on time.

Suzan is joined in her small group by Agnes P., Harriet N., Hawa C., and Justine M.. Agnes P. has a business selling charcoal and wants to purchase in bulk. Harriet N. is currently operating a business selling second hand clothes and wants a loan to stock more clothes. Hawa C. operates a business in maize produce sales and wants to purchase a lorry of produce. Justine M. is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to add more stock and furniture.

loans.use: To boost clothing business

loans.name: Budumuli East A D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Hellen B.. She is currently in the business of grocery store and is requesting a loan to build another stall. Hellen is 29 years old and is divorced. She has 4 children ranging from age 7 to 13 and her children go to school. Each week, Hellen makes approximately UGX 60000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children Hellen has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 150000 in order to add in grocery business and the loan was paid back on time.

Hellen is joined in her small group by Mariam N., Mariam M. and Margret T. . Mariam N. has a business in selling tap water and wants to purchase more tanks and make more water connections. Mariam M. is currently operating a business in selling groceries and wants a loan to add in stock. Margret T. operates a business of retail shop and wants to add in stock and buy a weighing scale.

loans.use: To add working capital in grocery business

loans.name: Budumuli East A E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rose B.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to purchase a fridge and add more stock. Rose is 35 years old and is married with a husband who is a driver for work. She has 2 children aged 10 and 14, and both of her children go to school. Each week, Rose makes approximately UGX 70000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save and also pay the school fees for her children. Rose has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500000 in order to buy a public pay phone and more stock and the loan was paid back on time.

Rose is joined in her small group by Ruth N. and Aida N.. Ruth N. has a business in tailoring and wants to buy another sewing machine. Aida N. is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and wants a loan to stock more clothes.

loans.use: To add capital to retail shop and boost it

loans.name: Ismatov

texts.ru:
A. Ismatov is 47 years old, married and has 3 children. His wife works as a seamstress and sews kimono to order. A. himself works as a cashier at the local hospital. Recently A. purchased a plot of a land for gardening, but without fencing around it. He needs 1000 somoni to build a fence around his plot. A. feels that it will be more economical for him to take out a loan to build the fence and pay it back monthly using his salary.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Исматов Абдурахмон, возрост 47 лет имеет 3 детей ,жена портниха на дому шьет кимано по заказу.Сам Абдурахмон работает в областной больнице кассиром.Недавно Абдурахмон купил дачный участок ,но без ограждения.Ему для этого необходимо 1000 сомони.Абдурахмон считает что ему выгодней взяв кредит решить свою проблему, и каждый месяц погашать сумму со своей зарплаты.

loans.use: Fencing for a gardening plot

loans.name: Thai

texts.en: Mrs. Thai T., 26, works weaving mats at her house and makes around $2 a day. Her husband works as a construction worker building houses and as a fisherman in the rainy season earning about $3 a day. They have one child. To increase income he requests a loan from Kiva to purchase nets for fishing in the rainy season. The fishing revenue will be help support the whole family.

loans.use: To purchase nets to fish in the rainy season.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Budumuli East A F Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Kasifa N.. She is currently in the business of selling new clothes and is requesting a loan to increase inventory. Kasifa is 35 years old and is married with a husband who is a driver for work. She has 2 children, aged 10 and 14, and both of her children go to school. Each week, Kasifa makes approximately UGX 70000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save and also pay the school fees for her children. Kasifa has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to buy a counter and the loan was paid back on time.

Kasifa is joined in her small group by Fuida K. and Sylvia N.. Fuida K. has a business running a beauty salon and wants to buy a hair steamer. Sylvia N. is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and wants a loan to stock more clothes.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes in large quantities

loans.name: Budumuli East B A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Stella M.. She is currently in the business of running a bar and is requesting a loan to add more stock. Stella is 27 years old and is married. She has 2 children, aged 2 months and 9 years old, and one of them goes to school. Each week, Stella makes approximately UGX 200000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children. Stella has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Stella is joined in her small group by Ruth M. and Sarah K.. Ruth M. has a business in new clothing sales and wants to purchase more clothes in bulk. Sarah K. is currently operating a bar business and takeaway and wants a loan to purchase a fridge and an oven.

loans.use: To add more equipment to the bar like furniture and television

loans.name: Ngem

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngem R., 66, is a widow with two children and works growing vegetables on her plot of land. She earns around $1.50 a day. One child is a farmer and the other one is a student. After classes, her daughter also helps her look after the plants. She would like to request a loan from Kiva to purchase a water pump to water the crops in the dry season when there is little water available. (Mrs. Ngem R. is pictured with her daughter)
.

loans.use: This loan will be used to purchase a water pump.

loans.name: Moun

texts.en: Mrs. Moun M., 39, works weaving  palm leaf and makes on average $2 a day. Her husband supplements the household work as a logger, earning around $2 a day. They have six children and 4 of them are students and the other two are too young to attend school. This couple needs to use this loan to purchase wood to strengthen their house. (She is pictured with her child and the firewood which is collected by her husband)

loans.use: This couple needs to use this loan to purchase wood to strengthen their house.

loans.name: Babaeva

texts.ru:
Z. Babaeva is 35 years old, married and has 3 children. She has a professional high school degree. For the last 2 years she has been selling children's clothes. She started her business after she got married, since her husband went to find work in Russia due to high unemployment in Tajikistan. Now she is the main provider of her family and is busily selling and purchasing goods to keep her business running and to feed her children and her husband's parents. In the future she is planning to travel herself to purchase clothes wholesale and become a wholesale clothing distributor instead of a market vendor.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Бабаева Замира – 35 лет .Имеет мужа и троих детей. Образование средне специальное. Занимается продажей детской одежды вот уже 2 года. Начала заниматься этой деятельностью после замужества, так как ее муж из за безработицы уехал в РФ на заработки. Теперь она как опора и поддержка семьи не смотря на любую погоду занимается куплей и продажей чтобы прокормить и свою семью и родителей мужа. А в будущем планирует ехать за товаром сама и перейти на оптовую продажу одежды.

loans.use: Expanding inventory

loans.name: Tom

texts.en: Mrs. Tom P., 40, works selling firewood with her husband door to door in her village earning around $10 a day in revenue. They have three children and all of whom are students. They request a loan from Kiva to create a small business raising pigs and any leftover money will be used to repair her house.

loans.use: Breeding pigs for sale.

loans.name: Budumuli East B(B) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Gertrude N.. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and tailoring and is requesting a loan to purchase an electrical sewing machine and more charcoal. Gertrude is 40 years old and is married. She has 5 children ranging from age 8 to 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Gertrude makes approximately UGX 150000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a piece of land. Gertrude has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 600000 in order to buy more charcoal and the loan was paid back on time.

Gertrude is joined in her small group by Merida N., Christine B., Joyce M., and Jessica N.. Merida N. has a business running a bar and wants to purchase a television. Christine B. is currently operating a business where she charges batteries and wants a loan to open up another branch. Joyce M. operates a bar business and wants to add more furniture. Jessica N. is currently in the business of selling millet and is requesting a loan to purchase more sacks of maize.

loans.use: To add to tailoring business

loans.name: Budumuli East B C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Nassim N.. She is currently in the business of tape recording and CD writing and is requesting a loan to purchase a computer. Nassim is 22 years old and is married. Her husband is a matooke supplier. She has 2 children ranging from age 2.5 to 7 and her children go to school. Each week, Nassim makes approximately UGX 70000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy basic household needs. Nassim has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to buy a CD player and the loan was paid back on time.

Nassim is joined in her small group by Nalongo N., Nusula N., Christine M., Habiba B. and Hadijja N.. Nalongo N. has a business selling chairs and wants to purchase a carpentry machine. Nusula N. is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and wants a loan to buy more clothes. Christine M. operates a business of selling used clothes and wants to add more stock. Habiba B. is currently in the business of selling old clothes and is requesting a loan to increase inventory. Hadija N. sells used clothes and wants to stock more clothes with the loan.

loans.use: To increase capital stock

loans.name: Peoy

texts.en: Mrs. Peoy C., 30, is a mother of two children and sells groceries in front of her house. She makes approximately $2.50 a day of profit. Her husband works raising pigs, chickens and ducks and sells them in the market when they grow up and earns around $3 a day. To grow the  business this couple would like to request a loan from Kiva to purchase grocery products, more pigs and chickens to breed.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products, pigs, and chickens to breed.

loans.name: Budumuli East C A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sarah N.. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to stock more charcoal. Sarah is 30 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from age 5 to 12 and her children go to school. Each week, Sarah makes approximately UGX 70000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase more charcoal. Sarah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 100000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Sarah is joined in her small group by Fauza B., Juliet N. and Safina K.. Fauza B. has a business in used clothing sales and wants to expand business. Juliet N. is currently operating a business in tailoring and wants a loan to buy more cloth fabric. Safina K. operates a salon business and wants to add more equipment.

loans.use: To increase charcoal purchases

loans.name: Sei

texts.en: Mrs. Sei H., 24, is a housewife that stays at home raising the children and cooking food for her family. Her husband owns a plot of land growing rice and makes about $3 a day. He requests a loan from Kiva to purchase a cow to assist in farming. (Her husband is pictured with the cow they are going to buy)

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Budumuli East C B Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Cissy M..  She is currently in the business of running a bar and is requesting a loan to open up another bar in a different location.  Cissy is 42 years old and is married with a husband who is a teacher for work.  She has 5 children ranging from age 6 to 18 and her children go to school.  Each week, Cissy makes approximately UGX 100000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save for future use.  Cissy has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to add more stock to her bar and the loan was paid back on time.  Cissy is joined in her small group by Jamawa N., Aminah N. and Rose L. .  Jamawa N. has a business selling produce and wants to purchase more sacks of produce.  Aminah N. is currently operating a business selling millet  and wants a loan to start a video recording business. Rose L. sells millet and wants to boost business with the loan.

loans.use: To expand bar business

loans.name: Len

texts.en: Mrs. Len H., 38, is a mother of three children and works selling grocery products in front of her house. She normally, earns around $3 a day in revenue. Her husband supports the family income by working as a farmer on his rice field. He normally earns around $3 a day. One of their children is married and lives away from home. She requests a loan from Kiva to purchase grocery products in bulk to save money. The leftover money will be used to buy a cow to assist her husband’s farming which will give the family further income.

loans.use: Purchase grocery products and a cow.

loans.name: Wanyange Lake F A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Safina T.. She is currently in the business of running a kiosk and is requesting a loan to add working capital. Safina is 30 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from age 15 to 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Safina makes approximately UGX 42000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save for future use. Safina has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 150000 in order to set up a kiosk and the loan was paid back on time.

Safina is joined in her small group by Alisati T. and Annet N.. Alisati T. has a farming business and wants to purchase farm fertilizers. Annet N. is currently operating a business in poultry keeping and wants a loan to purchase poultry feed.

loans.use: To increase inventory in kiosk

loans.name: Wanyange Lake F B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Hilda K.. She is currently in the business of rearing chicken and is requesting a loan to buy more chicks. Hilda is 45 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant farmer. She has 8 children ranging from age 9 to 23 and her children go to school. Each week, Hilda makes approximately UGX 140000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save for future use.

Hilda is joined in her small group by Esther K., Teddy N., Hasifah N., and Ramulah N.. Esther K. has a business in used clothing sales and wants to add more stock. Teddy N. is currently operating a business selling charcoal and wants a loan to open up a retail shop. Hasifah N. operates a wholesale shop business and wants to purchase a fridge and add more stock. Ramulah N. is currently in the business of selling used clothes and is requesting a loan to buy more stock.

loans.use: To add to poultry business and improve it

loans.name: Chor

texts.en:
Mrs. Chor K., 38, works making Khmer wine in addition to breeding pigs at her house. She earns around $2.50 a day of profit.
Her husband, Mr. Meng, works as a farmer growing rice on his farmland and makes $3 a day.

He wants to use this loan to purchase good rice seed to farm for next year and to buy more pigs. Any leftover money will be used to repair the house.

loans.use: To purchase good rice seed to farm, pigs, and any leftover money will be used to repair the home.

loans.name: Nazila

texts.en: Nazila lives in Khachmaz region. She has been in the bakery business for one year. Nazila, bakes "gutab", and sweets. Now she needs a loan of $850 to buy flour and other ingredients to bake bread that she can sell.  She thanks you in advance for the loan.

loans.use: to buy  flour and other products for baking  bread

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 26, 2008)

She has 6 children ranging from age 25 to 30 and her children go to school. Each week, Margret makes approximately UGX 80000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater for basic needs Margret has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 700000 in order to buy more goats and the loan was paid back on time.

Margret is joined in her small group by Lukia N., Jeniffer N., Ritah N., and Edith N.. Lukia N. has a business in laundry and wants to to purchase more flat irons and ironing boards. Jeniffer N. is currently operating a business in grocery store and wants a loan to purchase more groceries. Ritah N. operates a business of bar and wants to add in furniture. Edith N. is currently in the business of charcoal sales and is requesting a loan to purchase in bulk.

loans.use: She will use this loan to purchase more grocery products.

Margret is joined in her small group by Lukia N., Jeniffer N., Ritah N., and Edith N.. Lukia has a laundy business and wants to to purchase more flat irons and ironing boards. Jeniffer operates a grocery store and wants a loan to purchase more groceries. Ritah runs a bar and wants to add furniture. And Edith sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to purchase her goods in bulk.

Grace has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Grace is joined in her small group by Sada W., Halima M., Bayati T., and Betty M.. Sada W. has a business selling charcoal and wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal. Halima M. is currently operating a business in clothing sales and wants a loan to boost business. Bayati T. operates a business selling clothes and wants to add more clothing stock. Betty M. is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to add more furniture.

The group leader of this small group is Mariam N.. She is currently in the business of retail shop and is requesting a loan to add in shelves and stock. Mariam is 38 years old and is married. She has 9 children ranging from age 6 to 21 and her children go to school. Each week, Mariam makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re-invest in business Mariam has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 600000 in order to add in business and the loan was paid back on time.

Mariam is joined in her small group by Florence N., Sarah K., Margret M., and Rose A.. Florence N. has a business in restaurant and wants to purchase a fridge. Sarah K. is currently operating a business in charcoal sales and wants a loan to construct a charcoal store. Margret M. operates a business of produce sales and wants to uplift business. Rose A. is currently in the business of fish selling and is requesting a loan to purchase in bulk.

loans.name: Ndifakulya West C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Mariam N.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add more shelves and stock. Mariam is 38 years old and is married. She has 9 children ranging from age 6 to 21 and her children go to school. Mariam has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 600000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Mariam is joined in her small group by Florence N., Sarah K., Margret M., and Rose A.. Florence N. has a business running a restaurant and wants to purchase a fridge. loans.name: Ndifakulya West D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rose N.. She is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. Rose is 29 years old and is married. Her husband is a forestry guard. She has 4 children ranging from age 3 to 9 and her children go to school. Each week, Rose makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a house for her children.

Rose is joined in her small group by Lamulati B., Aisha K., Mpenensi N., and Jane T.. Lamulati B. has a business in timber sales and wants to increase inventory. Aisha K. is currently operating a business selling potatoes and wants a loan to re-invest in her business. Mpenensi N. operates a business roasting and selling maize and wants to increase her capital stock. Jane T. is currently in the business of clothing sales and is requesting a loan to purchase in bulk.

loans.name: Djeyhun

texts.en: Djeyhun lives in the Guba region of Azerbaijan. He is 27 years old, and 2 years ago he started a livestock business.  He would like a loan of $850 to buy sheep to fatten for sale.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Din

texts.en: Mrs. Din A., 45, has a business milling rice for the local farmers with her rice grinding mill that takes the husks off the rice. She also breeds pigs. On average, she earns around $2.50 a day of profit. Her husband, who is a farmer, grows a rice on a plot of land, earning about $3 a day. They have six children, one of whom is married and lives away from home. Five others help the parents work. To increase the growth of the farmer, they need to buy good rice seed, cows, fertilizers, water pumps and so on to assist the farmer.

loans.use: To buy good rice seed, cow, fertilizers, water pump and so on to assist the farmer.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Mrs. Kong H., 53, works selling Khmer noodle at school and earns around $2 a day of profit. Her husband is a teacher at a school in his village with a salary $55 a month. They have 8 children, one of who is married and lives away from home and others who are students. She requests a loan from Kiva to reinvest in her business selling more fruits such as mango, orange, sugar cane and etc.

loans.use: Use this loan to sell more fruits.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru:
Zulfiya S. is 50 years old and has a professional degree. She is married and a mother of 5 children. Zulfiya works as a nurse in the village's medical facility, earning 60 somoni a month. The main source of income for the family is the fattening of cattle and agriculture. Zulfiya's daughters take care of the animals while her husband and her sons take care of the crops. Since they raise their own feed for cattle, the Samatov family save a lot of money. The feed crops are harvested by Zulfiya's sons. Mrs. S. has been a client with Microinvest since 2007 and she used her first loan to purchase a cow. Now she is planning to use the new loan to purchase several sheep and so increase the number of animals the family owns.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Саматова Зулфия – 50 лет, образование средне специальное. Замужем , имеет 5 детей. Зулфия работает в мед. пункте села Карабчи медсестрой. Получает около 60 сомони в месяц. Основной источником дохода семьи является откорм скота и земледелие. Откормом скота занимаются дочери Зулфии а земледелием муж и сыновья. Так как они занимаются земледелием на корм для скота они не тратят деньги. Корм для скота собирают сыновья Зулфии с полей где они занимаются земледелием. Первый кредит от МЗФ «Микроинвест » Зулфия получил в 2007 года и купила корову . На получаемый кредит он хочет купить овец и тем самим увеличить количество скота.

loans.use: Purchase of sheep

loans.name: Ndifakulya West E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Ruth N.. She is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to invest in her business. Ruth is 38 years old and is married, with a husband who is a peasant farmer for work. She has 4 children ranging from age 4 to 16 and her children go to school. Each week, Ruth makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children.

Ruth is joined in her small group by Stella A., Rehema K., Betty M., and Annet N.. Stella A. has a business selling matooke and wants to boost business. Rehema K. is currently operating a carpentry business and wants a loan to purchase more timber. Betty M. operates a beauty salon business and wants to buy more chemicals and hair oils. Annet N. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and is requesting a loan to expand business.

loans.use: To stock large volumes of clothes

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.en: Gulnar is a widow with three children. She lives in the town of Khachmaz. She has one year of experience in this business. She was born in 1969. Now, she needs a loan of $725 to buy clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Uljiboy

texts.ru:
Uljiboy Holoboevich S. is 43 years old, has a professional high school degree, is married and has a son. During the times of the Soviet Union he worked in the kolhoz (farming co-op) as a mechanic. After the break of the Soviet Union he lost his job and currently is making a living by feeding and selling cattle and by agriculture. His son and wife help him in this. Uljiboy took out his first loan from Microinvest in 2006 and purchased a flock of sheep. He is planning to use the current loan to purchase more sheep and so increase his income.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Саддилоев Юлчибой Холбоевич – 43 лет, образование средне техническое, женат , имеет сына. Во времена советского союза работал в колхозе механиком. После распада союза он остался без работы и на данный момент его источником дохода является откорм скота и земледелие. В этом деле ему помогают сын и жена. Первый кредит от МЗФ «Микроинвест » Юлчибой получил в начале 2006 года и купил овец . На получаемый кредит он хочет купить овец и тем самим увеличить количество скота.

loans.use: Purchase of sheep

loans.name: Reyhan

texts.en: Reyhan is a mother of 4 children. She was born in 1964. Five years ago, she started this business. She lives in the town of Khachmaz. Now, she needs a loan of $850 to buy clothes. She thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru:
Malika Gafurovna R. is 38 years old, has a high school diploma, is married and has 3 children. For the last 10 years she has been raising and fattening cattle for sale. Her children help her take care of the animals and this is Malika's sole source of income and main occupation. Her husband works as a mechanic in the kolhoz (farming co-op) and earns a minuscule salary of 10 dollars a month. The family owns a small plot of land where they grow wheat and potatoes, while Malika also owns 30 rams and several heads of cattle. The animals are taken out to pasture by her oldest son and to make the trip easier Malkia used her first loan from Microinvest to buy a horse. She is now planning to use her loan money to increase the number of animals in her herd and so increase the income the family earns from fattening and selling the animals.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Рабиева Малика Гафуровна - 38 лет, образование среднее, замужем имеет 3-х детей. Откормом скота клиентка занимается более 10 лет. Ее в этом помогают дети. Это ее единственный источник дохода. Муж Малики работает механизатором в колхозе , получает мизерную заработную плату около 10$ в месяц. Имеет семя небольшой земляной участок где они сеют зерно и картошку. Малика имеет 30 баранов и несколько голов крупно рогатого скота. Их на пастбище на корм ведет старший сын и чтобы не было трудно она на первый полученный кредит от МЗФ «Микроинвест » купила коня. Она планирует на получаемый кредит увеличит количество скота и тем самим увеличить доход семьи получаемый от откорма скота.

loans.use: Purchase of several more heads of cattle.

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Mrs.Vann S. has lived in her rural village since she was born. She is 32 years old and is married with five children, two of whom are students, while the other children are too young. Her husband, Vann Sang, is a fisherman, and can make around $7.50 per day. She would like to request a loan in order to buy fishing equipment, fertilizer , and a plow for her field.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment, fertilizer , and a plow.

loans.name: Ilaha

texts.en: Ilaha is a mother of 2 children. She lives in a small town called Khudat. She is a farmer who started farming 5 years ago. She is asking for $600 to help expand her farm so that she can be more profitable.

loans.use: to buy seedlings

loans.name: Busanzi. A. North A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Florence B.. She is currently in the business of selling fish and is requesting a loan to boost business. Florence is 38 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant farmer for work. She has 9 children ranging from age 2 to 17 and most of her children go to school. Each week, Florence makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy chickens and goats for rearing.

Florence is joined in her small group by Ziana K., Rose A., Margret N., and Agrace A.. Ziana K. has a business running a butcher's shop and wants to increase working capital. Rose A. is currently operating a business selling tomatoes and wants a loan to put up a stall. Margret N. operates a business selling matooke and wants to expand to bulk selling. Agrace A. is currently in the business of selling fish and is requesting a loan to purchase in bulk.

loans.use: To purchase more fish in bulk

loans.name: Busanzi. A. North B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jane B.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to purchase another fridge. Jane is 35 years old and is married. She has 7 children ranging from age 3 to 15 and her children go to school. Each week, Jane makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy goats for rearing.

Jane is joined in her small group by Jane N., Mariam K., Aida K., and Aida N.. Jane N. has a business selling charcoal and maize and wants to add to her charcoal business. Mariam K. is currently operating a business in clothing sales and wants a loan to invest in her business. Aida K. operates a business selling clothes and wants to purchase more clothes. Aida N. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add more stock.

loans.use: To add to retail shop business

loans.name: Yokubjon

texts.ru:
Yokubjon U. is 25 years old, he is married and has a college education. Yokubjon works as an accountant at a farming collective. He earns a salary of around 100 Somoni ($30) per month. His wife, Nigora is a teacher at the high school in the village of Baht. She earns 120 Somoni ($35) per month. Yokubjon lives with his parents and his father is a driver who owns a GAZ-53 vehicle(a truck) and has a stable income.

Yokubjon has been growing livestock for over 6 years. He will use his loan to purchase a cow and a pair of calves.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Урунбоев Екубчон Азамкулович - 25лет. Женат .Имеет высшее образование . Работает бухгалтером в дехканском хозяйстве. Получает заработную плату около 100 сомони в месяц. Жена Нигора работает учительницей средней школы поселка Бахт. Получает заработную плату 120 сомони в месяц. Он живет с родителями. Отец водитель. Имеет автомашину ГАЗ-53 (грузовая). Имеет стабильный доход. Откормом скота Екубчон занимается более 6 лет. Хочет купить одну корову и пару бычков.

loans.use: Purchase one cow and a pair of calves

loans.name: Busanzi. A. North C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Olivia A.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add more commodities. Olivia is 32 years old and is married with a husband who is a police officer for work. She has 4 children ranging from age 3 to 10 and her children go to school. Each week, Olivia makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to start a piggery business.

Olivia is joined in her small group by Esther N., Jesca N., Jane B., and Hanifa N.. Esther N. has a business buying and selling produce and wants to boost business.
