Jesca N. is currently operating a business selling rice and wants a loan to boost business. Jane B. operates a restaurant business and wants to purchase more utensils and foodstuffs. Hanifa N. is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to add more food.

loans.use: To purchase more shop items

loans.name: Busanzi. A. North D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Fauza A.. She is currently in the business of running a drug shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more drugs to sell. Fauza is 26 years old and is married. She has 5 children ranging from age 3 to 10 and her children go to school. Each week, Fauza makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. Fauza has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Fauza is joined in her small group by Bena M., Nubu N., Rukia Y., and Fazira M.. Bena M. has a business in tailoring and wants to buy more fabric. Nubu N. is currently operating a business selling clothes and wants a loan to add more stock. Rukia Y. operates a business selling fish and wants to boost business. Fazira M. is currently in the business of selling mandazi and is requesting a loan to re-invest in her business.

loans.use: To add more drugs and offer better services

loans.name: Marufhoja

texts.ru:
Marufhoja O. is 45 years old. He is married and has four children. He works as a teacher in the school #12 in the Bacht village, earning a salary of 200 somoni per month. Marufhoja has been receiving loans from Microinvest since the beginning of 2007. He used his first loan to purchase a young bull. After fattening the animal for 4 months he sold it and used the money to send his son to Russia to find work. His son is now sending money monthly back to his parents. Before he received the loan Marufhoja had one cow. Currently he has two cows and one calf. He is planning to use the loan to buy several more bulls for fattening.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Одинаев Маруфхоча - 45 лет. Женат имеет четыре детей . Работает учителем в средней школе № 12 поселка Бахт, получает заработную плату около 200 сомони в месяц. Кредитуется В МЗФ «Микроинвест» с начала 2007 года. На первый полученный кредит он купил бычка. После откорма в течение 4-х месяцев он продал и на полученный доход отправил сына на заработки в Российскую Федерацию. Сын отправляет ежемесячно деньги родителям. До получения кредита Маруфхоча имел одну корову. На данный момент он имеет 2-х коров и одного теленка. На получаемый кредит он хочет купить несколько бычков.

loans.use: Purchase of several heads of cattle

loans.name: Busanzi. A. North E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Eseza K.. She is currently in the business of retail shop and is requesting a loan to add in stock. Eseza is 31 years old and is married. She has 6 children ranging from age 2 to 10 and her children go to school. Each week, Eseza makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy goats for rearing

Eseza is joined in her small group by Marita N., Beatrice N., Esther N., and Serina A.. Marita N. has a business in selling cabbages and wants to add in business. Beatrice N. is currently operating a business in fish selling and wants a loan to increase purchases. Esther N. operates a business of tomatoe sales and wants to expand business. Serina A. is currently in the business of fish selling and is requesting a loan to increase inventory.

loans.use: To increase stock in retail shop and expand business

loans.name: Kagali East A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Betty N.. She is currently in the business of selling fish and is requesting a loan to purchase in larger quantities. Betty is 40 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from age 11 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Betty makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a house for her children. Betty has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 50000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Betty is joined in her small group by Jesca N., Prossy K., Rose A., and Yurita M.. Jesca N. has a business running a retail shop and wants to purchase another fridge and add more stock. Prossy K. is currently operating a business selling tomatoes and wants a loan to boost business. Rose A. operates a business selling fish and wants to expand business. Yurita M. is currently in the business of selling fish and is requesting a loan to add more capital.

loans.use: To add working capital to fish selling business

loans.name: Nureste

texts.en: Nureste A. is a livestock breeder in the northeastern Azerbaijan town of Khachmaz. She is married with five children and she and her family have been involved with this business for the last ten years. Nureste has already successfully repaid one prior loan with Norwegian Microcredit and is currently looking for funding so that she can purchase more livestock.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Selminaz

texts.en: Selminaz I. is a livestock breeder in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. She is married with three children and has been involved in this business for a number of years. She has already successfully repaid one prior loan with Norwegian Microcredit in the amount of 600 AZN (~$700) thus proving herself to be a trustworthy customer. She is currently looking for funding of $1200 in order to increase the size of her livestock.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Proloung

texts.en: Mr. Proloung Y. is 33 years old. He is a fisherman and makes around $5 per day. He is married with three children, two of whom are students, while the other child is too young to attend school. His wife, Vanny Sorn, sells vegetables. She makes around $2.50 per day. Her husband would like to request a loan in order to buy fishing equipment.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment

loans.name: Shergiye

texts.en: Shergiye I. is a livestock breeder. She is married, has 5 children, and lives in Azerbaijan, Khachmaz. Shergiye has been actively involved with her family business for the past ten years, and has already successfully repaid one of her loans. She is looking to increase her cattle supplies in order to continue the support she has been giving to her family.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Rahmonkul

texts.ru:
Rahmonkul Ottaevich O. is 41 years old, married and has 5 children (on the right in the photo). He has a high school diploma and currently is the sole bread winner for his family. His parents are retired and help him take care of the livestock. Rahmonkul has bin a client with "Microinvest" since beginning of 2007. He used his first loan to purchase a young bull, whom he sold after 6 months of feeding. He used his last loan to purchase a cow with a calf. Now Rahmonkul wants to take out another loan to buy two more bulls and feed for them.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Обидов Рахмонкул Отаевич – 41 лет, женат и имеет 5 детей. Имеет среднее образование. Единственный член семьи зарабатывающий на жизнь. Его родители пенсионеры и помогают за уходом за скотом.Рахмонкул - клиент «Микроинвеста» с начало 2007 года. На первый полученный кредит он купил бычка и продал после 6 месяцев откорма. На последний полученный кредит клиент купил корову и теленка. Он хочет получить кредит с КИВА и купит два быка и корм для них.( он справа на фото)

loans.use: Purchase of two bulls

loans.name: Taleh

texts.en: Taleh E. owns and operates a car wash in the northeastern Azerbaijan town of Khachmaz. He has been involved with this business for the last eight years and has already successfully repaid two prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit proving to be one of our valued and trusted customers. He is currently looking for funding so that he can purchase a new water spraying compressor for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a new water spraying compressor

loans.name: Hortence

texts.fr:
Hortence S., 44 years old and married, requests a loan to buy supplies and strengthen her business. She sells palm oil, oysters, and dried fish. Hortence has been a good customer of the Grand Yoff Diabir village bank in Ziguinchor for the last six and a half years and has always honored her commitments. The income drawn from her business allows her to support her household. She is seeking a 14th loan which she plans to reimburse at the end of six months with a single repayment.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Hortence S. ,44 ans, mariée demande un prêt pour acheter des produits et renforcer son activité , Elle vend de l'huile de palm, des huitres et du poisson sec.Hortence est une bonne cliente du BV de Grand Yoff Diabir à Ziguinchor depuis six ans et demie et a toujours respecté ses engagements. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d' entretenir son ménage. Elle sollicite ce 14ème prêt qu'elle compte rembourser au bout de 6 mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase of grocery products

loans.name: Arafa

texts.en: Arafa is a 64-year-old mother of five and a resident of Lumo area in Dar es Salaam city. She takes care of six grandchildren, all of them orphans. She has a charcoal store and a small shop alongside it, which she has operated for the past twenty years. She has been  with Youth Self Employment Foundation for the past eight years. She uses the profits from her businesses to take care of herself and her grandchildren. She is in need of a loan to help her expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam M. is a 53-year-old hardworking mother of five and a resident of Yombo, where she runs a shop. She has been with Youth Self Employment Foundation for the past six years. Her shop sells various items, including food products and other household items. The profits from her business have helped send all her children to school. In addition, she has been able to build herself a house, and she now takes care of her grandchildren. She is in need of a loan to help her expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Kimangano

texts.en: Kimangano J. is a 47-year-old resident of Lumo, an area in Dar Es Salaam. He has been running a retail shop for the past ten years, and things have changed for the better ever since he began. He sells all sorts of household items, including food products. He is in need of a loan to help boost his business.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Yaqut

texts.en: Yaqut V. owns and operates a market with her family in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Devechi. The town is located just off the western coast of the Caspian Sea. She is married with three children and has been involved in her business for the last fourteen years. Yaqut is currently looking for funding so she can increase and diversify her inventory stock.

loans.use: To increase and diversify her inventory

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen G. is married with two kids. She is 33 years old. She is a stylist who has been in business for the past eight years. She hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She needs a loan of $875 to buy dryers, relaxer, hair cream, and weavon.

loans.use: To buy dryers, relaxer, hair cream, and weavon

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Magdalene U. runs a phone booth and also sells clothes. She is single and 25 years old, and she comes from Edo State. She has been in business since 2002. She needs a loan of $450 to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg is married with two kids. He and his family live in Ivano-Frankivsk.  Oleg used to work as a café director. However, he resigned and decided to start his own business which would allow him spend more time with his family. Today Oleg owns a car and provides transportation services throughout Ukraine.  The business is the only source of income for his family of four. Oleg works very hard in order to bring in enough income.  He uses a walkie-talkie to help him facilitate his work and serve more passengers. 

Oleg has been in this business for year and a half. Currently, his daily income is about $40-$50.  Oleg would like to get a loan for $600 to purchase and install a new wheel amplifier in his car. One of his long-term plans is to eventually purchase a new vehicle.  Moreover, he is also hoping to finish construction work on his private house and make it as comfortable as he can for his family.  We are confident that the modesty, diligence and responsibility that have helped Oleg develop his venture and gain a good reputation amongst other taxi drivers will help him promptly repay this loan and allow him to succeed in his business endeavors.

loans.use: To purchase a new wheel amplifier

loans.name: Valentin

texts.en:
Valentin is divorced with an 11-year-old son. He lives in Ivano-Frankivsk and works as a taxi driver. He loves being self-employed and managing his own time. Valentin has a nice car and offers transportation services around the territory of Ukraine. He is a workaholic and is ready to work non-stop including weekends. Valentin has been in this business for 5 years. His daily profit is about $25-30. 

Valentin is really excited that he has had the chance to repair his old car, sell it and buy a newer vehicle. Now he doesn’t have to spend as much time in the mechanics shop as before when he had all different kinds of technical problems with his old automobile. Today Valentin is requesting a loan of $500 to cover some of the expenses connected with purchasing his new vehicle and pay for some of the paperwork that has to be done.

loans.use: Cover expenses for new automobile for taxi business

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline P. is married with three children. She is 36 years old and hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She sells ice cream. She has been in this business since 2004. She needs a loan of $725 to buy a deep freezer and a bicycle for her business.

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer and bicycle for her business

loans.name: Glory

texts.en: Glory G. is married with six children. She is 43 years old and hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in business selling goats since 1988. She needs a loan of $875 to buy more goats to sell.

loans.use: To buy more goats to sell

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is a business owner from Kahovka, Ukraine, living in the central part of the country. She sells a selection of dry-goods grocery items at an outdoor market in Kahovka. Alla is an experienced entrepreneur having been in business for ten years. She enjoys her work and the opportunity to help provide for her family. Alla is married and has a fourteen year old daughter. Her typical monthly income is around $400.

Alla has requested a short term loan of $400 to help purchase some new inventory. She experiences high inventory turnover rates with her grocery business. This loan will help her purchase additional food items and allow her to continue earning a good income.

loans.use: Purchase new grocery inventory

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya has a business selling beautiful, artificial flower arrangements which are commonly used in funerals and to memorialize grave sites in Ukraine. The large, colorful displays have been popular for many years as a way to honor and remember loved ones who have passed away. Nataliya has been selling these arrangements for about nine years. She currently has about $3,000 worth of inventory and makes around $350 a month.

Nataliya has requested a loan of $500 to increase her working capital and allow her to purchase additional inventory. By helping to meet the needs of grieving families, she is able to provide for her own family, children and grandchildren. We are happy for this opportunity to assist her in operating a successful business.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory of artificial flower arrangements

loans.name: Iyore

texts.en: Iyore O. is married with four children. She is 38 years old. She sells clothing--both wrappers and baby clothes. She is from Edo State, Nigeria, and has been in business since 2005. She needs a loan of $725 to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a single mother who is raising two teenage children. She has a fourteen year old and a seventeen year old. Margarita works hard to support her family with her small clothing sales business. She has been selling for three years and makes around $200 per month in profit. Her business is located at a busy outdoor market where she has a small covered space.

Margarita has requested a loan of $400 to purchase some additional clothing inventory and try to increase her profits. We are happy for this opportunity to assist Margarita as she seeks to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: Purchase new clothing inventory

loans.name: Cookey

texts.en: Cookey N. owns a cyber café where people can also make phone calls. He is married with three children and is 37 years old. He hails from Benin City, Edo State. He is a LAPO client and has been in business since 1998. He needs a loan of $875 to buy a generator.

loans.use: To buy a generator

loans.name: Onome

texts.en: Onome I. is a farmer. She is married with three children and is from Delta State, Nigeria. She has been a farmer since 2002 and studied her trade for seven years. She needs a loan of $175 to buy pineapple suckers and cassava stems for planting, and cassava to sell.

loans.use: To buy more cassava and other farm products to plant and to sell

loans.name: Paulette

texts.fr:
Paulette, 46 years old and married, has been a member of the Grand Yoff Diabir village bank in Ziguinchor for the last six and a half years. She is a good customer who honors her commitments. Paulette buys flour, sugar, monkey’s bread (baobab fruit), and other ingredients to make cookies and ice cream which she sells. This income allows her to provide for the needs of her family and to improve her business methods. She is seeking a 14th loan which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single repayment.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Paulette, 46 ans, mariée est membre du banc villageois de Grand Yoff Diabir à Ziguinchor depuis six ans et demie.Elle est une bonne cliente qui respecte ses engagements.Paulette achète de la farine, du sucre, du pain de singe (fruit du baobab) et autres ingrédients pour faire des biscuits et des crèmes glacées qu'elle vend.Ces revenus lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et d'améliorer les moyens utilisés pour son activité.Elle sollicite un 14ème prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de 6 mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to make cookies and ice cream

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en: Timothy Iyrekekpolor is single and is from Edo State, Nigeria. He is a photographer, and he also rents and sells VCDs. He studied his profession for three years and has been in business since 1997. He needs a loan of $300 to buy a digital camera.

loans.use: To buy a digital camera

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther E. is a widow with five children. She is 64 years old and comes from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and snacks. She  has been in business since 2000. She needs a loan of $875 to buy more provisions, as well as materials to bake snacks to sell.

loans.use: To buy provisions and materials for snacks

loans.name: Ade

texts.en: Ade O. is a widow with five children. She is 32 years old and comes from Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions, foodstuffs, and drinks. She has been in business since 2000. She needs a loan of $300 to buy provisions, foodstuffs, and drinks to sell.

loans.use: To buy provisions, foodstuffs, and drinks to sell

loans.name: Joko

texts.en: Joko A. is married with two children. She is 32 years old and owns a computer business. She studied computers for a year before starting her business. She resides in Edo State, Nigeria, and has been in business since 1998. She needs a loan of $600 to buy a computer and rent a bigger shop. She thanks you.

loans.use: To rent a bigger shop and buy an additional computer

loans.name: Dania

texts.es:
Mrs. Dania lives in Laureles Norte, a poor, semi-rural neighborhood, where basic needs such as water are scarse. Many of the villagers are people with low socio-economic needs. Dania lives with her two children, 8 and 21 years old, and her husband who works as a driver. She works as a counselor at a bus depot where she is allowed to sell soda in order to support herself and her family. These parents have been improving the infrastructure of their home thanks to the financing they've received through. They have been able to improve their living conditions and improved their family's way of life. Their house does not have a floor, it is just bare concrete. For this reason Dania hopes to tile her living room floor, the local brick store will give her a wholesale price and this will help with her kids' health. She will also be happy because she will have a prettier looking house.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Dania vive en los Laureles Norte, un barrio pobre, semirural, en donde existe escasez de los servicios básicos como el agua, los pobladores son en su gran mayoría de escasos recursos económicos. La señora habita con sus 2 hijos de 8 y 21 años y con su esposo, quien trabaja como conductor en una casa particular y ella se desempeña como conserje en una cooperativa de buses en donde le permiten vender gaseosas y refrescos para ayudarse, ambas actividades le permiten sobrevivir y mantener a sus hijos. Estos padres han ido mejorando la infraestructura de su vivienda por medio de financiamientos que han obtenido y con lo que han ido elevando el nivel de vida de su familia. La vivienda no cuenta con piso, sino que es embaldosada con cemento, por lo cual la señora desea poner en la sala de su vivienda piso rojo nacional que es elaborado en un negocio conocido del barrio, el tener la opción de comprar a precio económico estos ladrillos le permitirá mas limpieza y aseo en su vivienda factor importante para la salud de sus hijos y realizara el sueño de ver su casita mas bonita.

loans.use: Purchase of bricks for her home's floor

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Mrs. Filomena Calle lives in her own home, in the zone of Llojeta west of La Paz. She lives with her husband, Mr. Mario Titirico and their three children. Mrs. Filomena knits sweaters for a textile company and her husband works for a construction company.

The requested credit will be used for the construction of a bedroom (stucco and interior paint). This is the second time that they request a loan and their economic analysis qualifies them for it.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Filomena Calle vive en casa propia, en la zona de Llojeta ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo, el señor Mario Titirico y sus cinco hijos. La señora Filomena realiza tejidos de chompas a pedido para una tienda textil y su esposo trabaja como empleado de la construcción en una microempresa del ramo. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción en obra fina de una habitación (revoque de estuco y pintura interior). Esta es la segunda ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Completion of a bedroom in her house

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael is 56 years old, lives with a young lady he raised who has her own three kids. This young lady does his laundry and irons in his humble home located in "Laureles Norte". Ever since he became a widower he's been raising this young lady who had children which he treats as his own grandkids. He and his wife were never able to have children of their own and for this reason are so eager to help her. He needed a job and found one as a security guard, looking after homes in the adjacent neighborhoods. He's been doing this for approximately 8 years during the day and weekends. He's in charge of watching three blocks in the neighborhood. He has also been able to improve his humble home, which he's been able to fix according to his salary. His top priority at this time is to fix a wall that is in poor condition. He is afraid this wall will end up hurting one of these small children.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Rafael tiene 56 años, vive con una hija de crianza que tiene tres hijos menores de edad, esta muchacha lava y plancha en su humilde vivienda ubicada en el asentamiento “Laureles Norte”. Desde que enviudó hace varios años se quedó al cuido de esta joven que él y su esposa que no pudieron tener hijos la criaron como su hija y él le ayuda en la crianza y gastos de sus hijos a quienes quiere como nietos ya que el padre de ellos no le ayuda a la joven. Debido a la falta de empleos el señor decidió buscar una alternativa de sobrevivencia que le permitiera vivir de manera digna, es por eso que hace aproximadamente 8 años se dedica al negocio de vigilancia, cuidando casas de los barrios aledaños a donde habita, esta actividad la realiza en las noches, todos los días de la semana sin descanso. A su cargo, el señor cuida de dos a tres cuadras de casas, es esta actividad la que le ha permitido ayudar a su hija y nietos. También a logrado mejorar su humilde vivienda, la cual ha ido acondicionando de acuerdo a sus posibilidades económicas. La prioridad en estos momentos es la de construir una pared la cual la tiene en mal estado y necesita mejorarla, por que tiene el temor le pueda lastimar a uno de sus pequeños nietos.

loans.use: Purchase of zinc, concrete blocks, cement, sand and iron

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Cony Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Cory is 31 years old and lives with her husband and son in the neighborhood of 31 de Diciembre. This family began their own business 7 years ago as a way to make more money and cover their daily expenses. They also hoped to improved their son's way of life. They opened their own local market and now sell basic foods. This store is their only source of income and they dedicate all their time to it. These parents want a loan in order to be able to improve their home's infrastructure. At this moment they wish to build a bedroom for their 6-year old son who still sleeps with them. They want him to be more independent and at the same time give the parents more privacy.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Cony tiene 31 años, habita con su esposo y su hijo en el barrio 31 de Diciembre. Esta familia hace 7 años decidieron emprender su propio negocio, esto con el objetivo de buscar fuentes de ingresos que les permita cubrir todos los gastos del hogar y brindarle a su hijo buenas condiciones de vida, es así que montan en su vivienda una pulpería, la cual comercializan productos alimenticios de consumo básicos. Actividad la cual les ha sido muy fructífera ya que han podido subsanar los gastos de su familia. La pulpería es la única fuente de ingresos con los que esta familia cuenta, le dedican todo el día al negocio, el cual se encuentra en crecimiento, lo que les ha permitido mejorar poco a poco su nivel de vida. El deseo de estos padres con esta solicitud de crédito es el de acondicionar la infraestructura de la vivienda, la prioridad en estos momentos es la de iniciar a construir la habitación a su hijo de seis años, el cual duerme aun con ellos , para que de esta manera el pueda crear mas independencia y ellos podrán tener mayor privacidad, es de su negocio familiar que podrán darle en humildad un espacio propio a su pequeño hijo.

loans.use: Purchase of blocks, cement, sand, and iron to build a bedroom

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
Freddy is 28 years old and lives with his wife in the 31 de Diciembre neighborhood. This young couple does not have any children yet, as they have to establish themselves economically in order to then support their family. Freddy is the only income earner in the home, he works as a production worker in the free trade zone in Mercedes, so his wife is dependent on him. As fruit of his hard work, this young man has been improving the infrastructure of the humble home he shares with his wife. By financing, he has been able to build his home, which still isn’t complete. He still has to finish the back wall that leads to the patio of his small home, which he hasn’t been able to finish due to lack of capital. Therefore he is asking for a loan to finish enclosing his home by completing the back wall, providing a safe and secure home to live in so when they decide to have a family, his wife wouldn’t be able to work for fear of leaving their small home empty and returning to find themselves without their belongings.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Freddy tiene 28 años habita con su esposa en el barrio 31 de Diciembre, esta joven pareja todavía no cuentan con hijos, ya que tienen que establecerse económicamente para después formar una familia. Freddy es el único proveedor de la casa, trabaja como operario de una zona franca en las Mercedes, por lo tanto su esposa depende de él. Fruto de su trabajo, es como el joven ha ido mejorando la infraestructura de la humilde vivienda donde habita con su esposa. Por medio de financiamiento es como ha ido levantando la estructura física de su vivienda, la cual todavía no se encuentra en buenas condiciones, ya que le falta terminar de levantar el muro de atrás que da con el patio de su pequeña vivienda, el cual no ha podido cerrarlo por completo por la falta de capital. Es por eso que él solicita un préstamo para sellar su vivienda, la cual desea que se encuentre segura de habitar y segura para cuando su decidan tener familia actualmente no podría trabajar su esposa por temor a dejar sola su casita y encontrarla sin sus pertenencias.

loans.use: Purchase blocks, cement, sand and steel to finish the back wall of his home

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Robert

texts.es:
Robert works as an insurance agent and on weekends he is the guitarist in a group that plays tropical music. He lives in the Santa Rosa Grande area of the North side of the city of La Paz. He is single and lives in his grandparents' house. He covers his groceries, education, and other expenses with the earnings from his job since he is independent.

This is the first time that he is asking for a loan from Impro. The money will be used to pay for the enrollment and the monthly fees of the Universidad Salesiana in Bolivia.

He is getting access to this loan thanks to his job and his desire to improve.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR

Robert trabaja como agente de seguros y los fines de semana toca guitarra en un grupo de música tropical. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Santa Rosa Grande de la Ladera Norte de la ciudad de La Paz.. Es soltero y vive en la casa de sus abuelos y los gastos de alimentación, educación y otros los cubre con su trabajo ya que es independiente. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, el crédito será destinado para realizar el pago de matricula y mensualidades en la Universidad Salesiana de Bolivia. Su trabajo y las ganas de superación le permiten acceder a este crédito.

loans.use: Pay the enrollment and monthly fees of the Universidad Salesiana where he studies.

loans.name: Rebeca Argentina

texts.es:
Rebeca is 33 years old, single, doesn’t have children, and lives in the Unidad de Propósito neighborhood, with her mother whom she takes care of with much love. In order to make a living, for the past 4 years she has been selling clothing and shoes for children, teens, and adults of all ages as a traveling salesperson. With her small income she earns from selling to people in their homes she has been able to cover her household expenses and basic needs. The type of business and Rebeca’s pleasant personality have enabled her to gain a good number of faithful customers that also buy from her and ask her to acquire various personal use products such as perfumes and cosmetics. Rebeca hopes in a few years to put a store in her home, where she will be able to take care of her mother and be able to grow her microbusiness. Today she has little merchandise and has many orders for clothing, so she is asking for a loan to buy summer merchandise, clothing for women, children, and men, sunscreen, perfume, as these are the products her customers are asking for at this time.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Rebeca tiene 33 años, es una joven soltera, no tiene hijos y habita en el barrio Unidad de Propósito, con su madre a quien cuida con mucho amor. Para ganarse la vida hace 4 años se dedica a vender de manera ambulante ropa y zapatos para niños, jóvenes y adultos de todas las edades, los ingresos de su pequeño negocio a domicilio le ha permitido cubrir los gastos de su casa y llevar una vida humilde pero sin carencias. El tipo de negocio con el que cuenta la señora y su agradable personalidad le ha permitido capturar un buen número de clientes fieles que siempre le compran y le encargan diversos productos de uso personal como perfumes y cosméticos. La señora espera en unos años montar su tienda en su casa, en donde le permita cuidar de su madre y de esta forma poder ir creciendo como microempresaria. En estos momentos posee poca mercadería en existencia y cuenta con varios encargos de ropa, la señora solicita un préstamo para comprar mercadería de verano para esta época, ropa para dama, niños y varón y cremas protectoras de sol, perfumes, siendo estos los productos que más demandan en esta época sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase clothing for men and women, children's shoes, and perfume.

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
Mrs. Rafaela C. lives in her own house in the Pasankeri area of the Ciudad de La Paz (La Paz City) with her 12-year-old daughter. Mrs. Rafaela is an entrepreneur and sells household items in a public market.

With her prevous loan, she bought building materials and built the foundations of the front wall of her house, which allowed her to finish half the required construction. Currently, the previous loan has been fully paid.

The loan that she is asking for now will be used to finish the construction of the front wall plus the bathroom which currently has no bathroom fittings.

This is the third time that Mrs. Rafaela is asking for a loan and the socioeconomic analysis made on her reveals that she qualifies for the loan and can be granted one.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

La señora Rafaela C. vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri de la Ciudad de La Paz con su hija de 12 años, la señora Rafaela es comerciante y vende artículos domésticos en un puesto de venta en vía pública.

Con el crédito anterior realizó la compra de material de construcción y la construcción de cimientos en el muro frontal de su vivienda teniendo un avance de la mitad de la obra requerida. Dicho crédito a la fecha está completamente pagado.

El crédito solicitado será destinado a la conclusión del muro frontal más la habilitación de un baño que se encuentra sin los artefactos sanitarios.

Esta es la tercera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: To build a front wall and to buy bathroom fittings for a bathroom.

loans.name: Fatou Chérif

texts.fr:
Fatou Chérif D., 50 years old, married, and mother of five children is a member of the Tilène Daraal village bank in Ziguinchor. She sells Senegalese-style shoes, purses, and clothing, which she makes from embroidered fabric and damask, in Guinea-Bissau. In order to support her household she would like to strengthen her business. The loan she is seeking will be reimbursed at the end of six months with a single repayment.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Fatou Chérif D., 50 ans, mariée et mère de 05 enfants est membre du banc villageois de Tilène Daraal à Ziguinchor. Elle va vendre en Guinée Bissau des chaussures, des sacs à main et des tenues qu'elle confectionne en modèles sénégalais avec les tissus brodé et bazin. Afin d'aider à l'entretien de son foyer elle souhaite renforcer son commerce. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de 6 mois avec une seule échéance .

loans.use: Purchase of bolts of fabric, shoes, purses, and supplies

loans.name: Mujeres De Chiapas 9 Group

texts.es:
Rocelia is 25 years old and is dedicated to make traditional clothes of the region. She makes skirts and blouses, and then adds embroidery work, which is very time consuming. This merchandise is sold with other women in the area or neighbor communities. The little money she earns from this activity maintains her five children. With this credit, she would like to purchase fabric and threads to tailor more clothes. The other members of this group are: Cecilia Pérez Santis, María A. Pérez, and Fidencia Pérez Pérez, who are all craftswomen.

Rocelia tiene 25 años, se dedica a confeccionar ropa típica de la región, elabora faldas y blusas a las cuales les dedica mucho tiempo ya que también las borda, esta mercancía es vendida con mujeres de su misma localidad o comunidades cercanas, con el poco dinero que obtiene de esto mantiene a sus 5 hijos, con el crédito le gustaría adquirir mas tela e hilos para confeccionar mas ropa. Las otras integrantes del grupo son: Cecilia Pérez Santis, María A. Pérez y Fidencia Pérez Pérez son artesanas. Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: To purchase raw material (fabric, thread)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Alternativa Solidaria Chiapas (AlSol) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Pepenetik 3 Group

texts.es:
DOÑA ADELINA , 29 years old, is famous in his area for making elaborate traditional skirts. A large amount of thread is used for the multi-colored embroidery. These skirts are sold in the community to his neighbors. On some occasions her husband transports the skirts to the city to sell them to tourist shops. This work helps her to take care of her six children. With a loan, I would like to buy more different colored threads and fabrics to design elaborate traditional skirts.The other members of the group are Ofelia Vazquez P., who runs the store and Natalia G. R., the artisan.

This story has been translated by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

DOÑA ADELINA DE 29 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES FAMOSA EN SU LOCALIDAD POR ELABORAR FALDAS CON EL BORDADO TRADICIONAL, AUNQUE SE LLEVE MUCHO HILO EL BORDADO TIENE QUE SER CON MUCHOS COLORES NOS COMPARTIO, ESTAS FALDAS SON VENDIDAS EN SU COMUNIDAD CON SUS VECINAS, EN ALGUNAS OCACIONES SU ESPOSO SE TRANSPORTA A LA CIUDAD MAS CERCANA PARA VENDERLAS A PERSONAS QUE BUSCAN MERCANCIA PARA TIENDAS TURISTICAS, ESTE TRABAJO LES AYUDA A MANTENER A SUS 6 HIJOS, CON EL CREDITO LE GUSTARIA COMPRAR MUCHOS HILOS DE COLORES Y TELA PARA SEGUIR ELABORANDO SUS TRADICIONALES FALDAS, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON: OFELIA VAZQUEZ P. TIENDA DE ABARROTES Y NATALIA G. R. ES ARTESANA.

loans.use: To buy commodities (fabric, threads and colors)

loans.name: Yabteclum 3 Group

texts.es:
Carmela is 36 years old and is dedicated to the sale of cut-up chickens. In order to buy her chickens, she must travel to the Municipal Capital and keep them in her patio at home. Sales are low because meat is hardly consumed due to its elevated price. People in the community feed off their crops (corn, beans, and vegetables). With the small profit she makes, Carmela purchases more chickens and maintains five children. With your credit she wants to buy more chickens and a new scale. The other members of the group are: Maria G., who sells beans, corn, and is a craftswoman; Araceli De Jesus P. S., who owns a grocery store; Carmen P. R., who sells lollipops, pens, and cold beverages; and Lucia P. G., who is also a craftswoman.

Carmela de 36 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de pollo trozado, tiene que viajar a la cabecera municipal para comprar sus pollos y mantenerlos en patio de su casa, su venta es poca ya que en la comunidad casi nunca se consume carne por lo caro, la gente se alimenta de sus cosechas, (maíz, frijoles y verduras) que ellos mismos producen, con la poca ganancia que obtiene compra mas pollos y mantiene a 5 hijos, con su crédito ella quiere comprar mas pollos y una pesa nueva, las otras integrantes del grupo son: María Guzmán Pérez vende frijoles y maíz y es artesana, Araceli De Jesús Pérez S. tienda de abarrotes, Carmen Pérez R., vende paletas, bolis y refrescos fríos y Lucia Pérez Gutiérrez es artesana.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and a scale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Alternativa Solidaria Chiapas (AlSol) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Cindy Maria

texts.es:
Cindy is a single mother who has started a business of Pack Stores in 2005 and was motivated by the need to take care of her son, who could not find a good job. THe main form of support for this business is the dream she had with her father.

She needs a loan of $200 to pay back in 6 months in order to buy commodities for her store. SHe mainly wants to buy tin platings, a product that is in high demand from her clients. Help ups support Cindy so her and her small one can do well.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

Cindy es madre soltera incio un negocio de tienda de abarrotes en el 2005 movida por la necesidad de sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo ya que no encontraba un empleo bien remunerado y que le permitiera seguir al tanto de su hijo, su principal apoyo economico para iniciar este sueño fue su padre.

Ella necesita un credito de US $200 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia para su tienda principalmente latas que es el producto que mas le estan demandando sus clientes. Apoyemos a Cindy para que ella y su pequeño salgan adelante!!..

loans.use: To buy commodities.

loans.name: Pervane

texts.en: Pervane A. is an Internally Displaced Person from Fuzuli region of Azerbaijan. She has lived in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijin since 1993 with her family. She is 34 years-old, married and has three children. She has raised chickens in her yard and sold them in Beylagan city bazaar for more than seven years. She applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan of $250 for developing her business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Shamakhi

texts.en: Shamakhi A. is an Internally Displaced Person from Fuzuli region of Azerbaijan. She settled with her family in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan in 1993. She is 53 years old.  She is married and has four children. She raises chickens in her yard and sells them in the Beylagan City bazaar. She has been doing this for four years. She applied to the Normicro Beylagan Branch for a KIVA loan of $700, which she plans to use to build a new hen-house.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Rena

texts.en: Rena J. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. She is 50 years old, married and has three children. Rena rented a small booth in Beylagan city bazaar and sells butter, cheese, sour milk, etc. there. She has been engaged in this business for more than seven years. Now, she needs a loan of $600 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen is a very hard-working woman and since she moved to her new place of residence, she has noticed the alaming need of a place that sells basic products amongst her neighbours. This is why, in her humble home, she developed a small shop which, bit by bit and thanks to the good advice she has received from Prisma, sold more and did very well. For this school year she wants to increase the smaller products that she offers, such as paper, pens, notebooks etc, and with this in mind and with great enthusiasm she will keep working for the well-being of her family and her community; and this is why she would like a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Carmen es una mujer muy trabajadora y empeñosa desde que se instaló en su nuevo lugar de residencia observó la alarmante necesidad de sus vecinos por obtener sus productos de primera necesidad en un establecimiento cercano a sus domicilios; por esa razón instaló en su humilde casita una pequeña bodega que poco a poco y gracias a la asesoría que le ha otorgado, Prisma para mejorar sus ventas ha ido obteniendo mejores resultados. Para esta época escolar desea incrementar sus productos ofertando también pequeños artículos como: papeles, lapiceros, cuadernos, etc; con este deseo en mente y su gran entusiasmo por seguir trabajando en bienestar de su familia y su comunidad solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: To buy small school articles/Compra de pequeños artículos escolares.

loans.name: Muzaffer

texts.en: Muzaffer A. is a 58 year-old man, is married, and has two children. He lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. Muzaffer is engaged in fruits & vegetables sales in a Beylagan city bazaar. He started his business seven years ago. He borrowed two loans from Normicro Beylagan Branch and used those loans for developing his business. Now, he needs a loan of $600 for expanding his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen is a dedicated and hard-working woman, and her sense of responsability has lead her to work in many fields so that she can improve her quality of life. For about 2 years she has been raising and selling guinea pigs, and thanks to the watercress grown on her land, this has gone very well. She is thinking of increasing her field of work and she would use the investment to put more effort into her work, and this is exactly why she wants to ask for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Carmen es una mujer dedicada y laboriosa, su alto sentido de responsabilidad la han hecho incursionar en diversas áreas de trabajo con el deseo de incrementar la calidad de vida de su familia. Hace aproximadamente dos años decidió involucrarse en la crianza y venta de cuyes, debido a que cultiva alfalfa en grandes extensiones de tierras, le ha ido muy bien y está pensando ampliar su campo de trabajo y su capital de inversión para dedicarse con mayor fuerza en este trabajo y es precisamente a esa razón que atiende su petición de un préstamo.

loans.use: To increase capital from the raising of guinea pigs/Incremento de capital para criar mayor cantidad de cuyes.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida H. is an Internally Displaced Person from the Fuzuli region of Azerbaijan. She has lived with her family in Beylagan since 1993. She is 35 years old, married and has five children. She raises chickens in her yard and sells them in the Beylagan city bazaar. She has been engaged in this business for more than seven years. She applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a KIVA loan of $800, and she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business of raising chickens.

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es:
Clorinda, who has 3 kids, has been sewing potatoe, maze, onion and other earthy vegetables in the land that she rents since she was young, and each year she increases the amount of products she sews. Thanks to her perseverance and impetus she has been able to improve the quality of life of her beloved family and she has helped out her husband too. She wants to fertilize the land that she has just rented to sew potatoe and maze and this is why she wants a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Clorinda, tiene tres hijos y se dedica desde joven a la siembra de papá, maíz, cebada y otros vegetales en sus tierras de cultivo y en las tierras que alquila año a año para obtener mayor cantidad de productos; luego de haber concluido la siembra espera seis largos meses para la cosecha y comercialización de sus productos; gracias a su perseverancia e ímpetu ha podido elevar el nivel de vida de su querida familia y ha contribuido con el trabajo de su querido esposo. Desea abonar las tierras que acaba de alquilar para la siembra de papa y maíz y a esta razón atiende su solicitud de un préstamo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer/Compra de abonos.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita is a very hard-working woman. Since she was young, thanks to the family apiary where they raised bees, she has known how to have them in the house, looking after them and giving them the right food so that they produce excellent quality honey. Each month she collects the sweet nectar to offer it in the monthly market in the city. The earnings have become a good source of income for the family and her desire is to increase the number of panals they have, and that is why she wants a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Margarita es una persona muy trabajadora. DesD. pequeña, gracias al vínculo D. su familia con la crianza D. abejas obtuvo el conocimiento para mantenerlas en casa, cuidadas y con el alimento suficiente para que produzcan miel D. excelente calidad. Mensualmente recolecta este dulce néctar para ofertarlas en las ferias mensuales D. su ciudad, las ganancias se han convertido en un ingreso muy bueno para familia y su deseo D. incrementar la cantidad D. panales la conducen a solicitar un préstamo.

loans.use: To buy wood in order to build more panals/Compra de madera para construir mayor cantidad de panales.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz T. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. She is 33 years old, married, and has two children. She and her husband are selling men's shoes in the Beylagan city bazaar. They established their business five yeas ago. (Her husband is pictured, he is on the left). Shahnaz applied to the Normicro Beylagan Branch for a $700 KIVA loan to purchase more kinds of shoes and develop her business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Having grown up around an agricultural land and stock farm has enable Betty to obtain the necessary skills to perform successfully in this business. For now, and before having had a baby, she worked on her father's corn and barley farms. Her intention is to increase the quality and quantity of her products so as to increase her revenue and establish her own stock farm closer to her home. For this reason she asks for a loan. Your important support will help contribute to the realization of this dream in due time.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Haber nacido en una tierra agrícola y ganadera han hecho que Betty, obtenga los conocimientos necesarios para desempeñarse con éxito en estas labores, por ahora y después de haber tenido un bebé, se desempeña en los cultivos de papa, maíz y cebada; con el objetivo de incrementar la calidad y cantidad de sus productos a fin de acrecentar sus ingresos para establecer una espacio ganadero cerca de su hogar, solicita un préstamo.Tu importante ayuda colaborará con el cumplimiento de este noble anhelo a mediano plazo.

loans.use: To invest capital to increase the quality and quantity of her products

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis is an unselfish father who has always sacrificed to gain the well-being of his family. He manages livestock and has aspirations of converting his business into the largest breeder in the community. It is for this reason that he asks for a loan. He hopes to increase the number and variety of his livestock. Your important contribution will help him realize this dream.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Luis, es un padre de familia abnegado que siempre se ha esforzado por generarle bienestar a los suyos. Se dedica a la ganadería y tiene el deseo de convertirse en el ganadero más importante de su comunidad y es precisamente a este sueño que atiende la solicitud de su préstamo debido a que desea incrementar el número y la variedad de los animalitos que posee.Tu importante aporte contribuirá a concretar este deseo.

loans.use: To invest capital to increase the quantity and variety of his livestock

loans.name: Ferhad

texts.en: Ferhad A. comes from a loz income family. He is a 43 year-old man, who is married and has two children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Fuzuli a region in Azerbaijan. He settled with his family in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan in 1993. He has been driving a taxi for a few years to earn a living. Ferhad applied to the Normicro Beylagan Branch for a KIVA loan of $400 in order to purchase necessary spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es:
Angélica is a mother of a young family who learned that the best business is one performed as a team. She and her husband take care of their beehives daily and weekly harvest the honey to sell in the Saturday fairs of her great city. She aspires to increase the quantity of beehives. Her objective is to convert her business into one of the largest producers of honey in her community, and this is why she solicits a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Angélica es una madre de familia joven que aprendió que el mejor trabajo es el que se desempeña en equipo, ella en compañía de su esposo a diario cuida de sus panales a fin de retirar la miel semanalmente para ofertarla en las ferias de los sábados de su bella ciudad, desea incrementar la cantidad de panales que tiene con el objetivo de convertirse en los productores de mejor miel de su comunidad y precisamente a este deseo atiende la solicitud de un préstamo.

loans.use: To invest capital to establish a greater number of beehives for honey production

loans.name: Murabe

texts.en: Murabe I. lives Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. She is 43 years old, married and has three children. Rena rented a small booth in Beylagan city bazaar and sells butter, cheese, sour milk etc. She has been engaged in this business more than four years. She applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a KIVA loan of $800 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand business selling butter, cheese, and sour milk

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz is very hard-working woman. She cultivates alfalfa from her expansive farming fields to offer them in the market and to utilize them as nourishment for her livestock. With this daily production, this unselfish mother is able to provide for the well-being and comfort of her dearest seven-year-old child. Her aspirations of increasing the quantity of her livestock to offer them for sale in the daily fairs drive her to ask you for your help by means of a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Luz, es una mujer muy trabajadora. Se dedica a cultivar alfalfa en sus extensos campos de cultivo para ofertarlos en el mercado y para utilizarlos como alimento para sus pequeños animalitos, con este desempeño diario ésta abnegada madre le otorga bienestar y comodidad a su querido pequeño de siete años. El deseo de incrementar la cantidad de animalitos que posee en casa para ofertarlos también en las ferias diarias la conducen a solicitar vuestra ayuda a través de un préstamo.

loans.use: To invest capital to increase the number of her livestock

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
The great responsibility of maintaining the security of his family in his home has led this unselfish father to dedicate many hours to his job inside his small vehicle. With the daily work that he carries out he has been able to establish their well-being. However, despite his sacrifices he has not been able to perform complete repairs on his car. Temporarily, the malfunctions have depleted his profits. His aspirations of improving his vehicle's conditions have driven him to ask for a loan to cover satisfactorily the large number of hours for labor.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

La inmensa responsabilidad de mantener a buen recaudo a su familia dentro de su hogar, han llevado a este abnegado padre a desempeñar largas hora de labor a bordo de su pequeño automóvil. Con el trabajo diario que lleva a cabo les ha procurado bienestar pero a pesar de sus esfuerzos no ha podido refaccionar su vehículo completamente y temporalmente las fallas merman sus ganancias. Su deseo de mejorar las condiciones de su vehículo lo conducen a solicitar un préstamo para cubrir con satisfacción las inmensas horas de labor.

loans.use: To repair his small vehicle

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Despite being an excellent mother and teacher, Luisa has not been able to carry on her business successfully due to unemployment in her city. Because of what is required to sustain a family, she has had to find another job, and now along with her children prepares delicious dishes. She offers these dishes during festival days and with the revenue obtained from the sale of these dishes she is able to contribute to her family's future. She asks for a loan to attend to the necessity of renting a commercial space to offer these dishes with greater convenience and security.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Luisa, a pesar de ser una excelente madre y maestra, no ha podido ejercer con éxito su profesión por la falta de oportunidad laboral que existe en su ciudad, debido a que tiene una familia que mantener tuvo que recurrir a otra actividad y ahora prepara un delicioso platillo en compañía de sus queridos hijos para ofertarlos en las ferias dominicales y contribuir con los ingresos que obtiene con el desarrollo de su querida familia.Su solicitud de un préstamo atiende a la necesidad de alquilar un espacio de ventas para ofertarlos con mayor comodidad y seguridad.

loans.use: To rent a space to facilitate the sale of her food

loans.name: Adil

texts.en: Adil G. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan.  He is 32 years old, married and has two children.  He owns and operates a small barber shop in Beylagan. He has been engaged in the barber shop business for more than ten years. He applied to Normicro for a KIVA loan of $1000 to purchase some equipment for his shop to help improve the quality of his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Teodora Del Carmen

texts.es:
Teodora C. lives in San Caralampio, La Concha, is married, and her husband is a vendor. He sells cleaning products for the home, they have two children studying in high school. They are a hard working family who by combining their efforts has been making ends meet. For 15 years they have worked the earth producing pineapple, which they sell in the markets in the capital. They are asking for a loan to buy products to maintain the crop which will be ready for harvest soon. For their profits they have many plans for the earnings, such as high school tuition for their children, invest in the husband’s business which brings monthly income, and other expenses. Their dream is that their children help with the pineapple production work. To see the sunrise every morning over their beautiful pineapple plantation is a very emotional experience for this hard working mother.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Teodora C. habita en San Caralampio, La Concha, es casada y su esposo se dedica al Comercio. Vende productos de limpieza para el hogar, tienen dos hijos que estudian la secundaria. Ellos son una familia trabajadora que uniendo sus esfuerzos han salido adelante, desde hace 15 años trabajan las tierras produciendo piña, la cual venden en los mercados de la capital, solicitan el crédito para comprar productos de mantenimiento para la cosecha que pronto estará lista, sobre esta ganancia tienen muchos planes como gastos de colegio de sus hijos, invertir en el negocio de su esposo que les representa un ingreso mensual y otros. Su ilusión es que sus hijos le ayuden en el trabajo de la producción de piña, ver todas las mañanas el amanecer sobre su hermosa plantío de piña es una gran emoción para esta madre emprendedora.

loans.use: Purchase agricultural maintenance supplies

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
Maria Cristina is single. She had traveled outside the country looking for a better quality of life, but she had several difficulties so she decided to return to her country and work together with her family in Ticuantepe, an agricultural zone. Making use of the knowledge about agriculture that she and her family have, along with a few hectares of land, she decided to invest her savings and efforts in a small pineapple plantation, hoping to expand the business. In order to have a great crop she is asking for a loan to be able to maintain her crop and hopefully have excellent quality and success with this harvest. Her buyers are people who have purchased from her family for over 15 years and they are ready to buy. She hopes to be able to get ahead financially together with her family, putting all her energy in that which she owns and no one can take away - her land and her work.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Maria Cristina es soltera, se había ido fuera del país tratando de buscar un mejor nivel de vida, sin embargo se encontró con muchas dificultades por lo que decidió regresar a su país y trabajar junto a su familia en Ticuantepe que es una zona agrícola. Haciendo uso de los conocimientos que su familia y ella tienen en agricultura y de algunas manzanas de tierras decidió invertir sus ahorros y esfuerzo en una pequeña plantación que tenían de piña, logrando expandirse. Teniendo una hermosa cosecha solicita el crédito para darle mantenimiento a la misma y que la calidad esperada tenga éxito, sus compradores son personas que desde hace mas de 15 años le han comprado a su familia su producción y están listos para comprar. Ella espera poder salir adelante junto a su familia poniendo todo su esfuerzo en lo que posee y que nadie puede quitarle como lo es su tierra y su trabajo.

loans.use: Purchase agricultural products

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Clarisa Del Socorro

texts.es:
Clarisa López is a 40 year old woman who is very respected in her community for being a hard-working woman, single mother, and head of family. She lives with her mother and her 6 children, the youngest two are still at home while the older children help with the work in the field. From when the children were little, she taught her children the value of work. She lives in the Eden neighborhood of the Ticuantepe region. She is asking for a loan to buy agricultural maintenance supplies for her 8 hectares of pineapple, which will soon be ready to go to market, and it is important to give them fertilizer to produce good quality.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Clarisa López, es una señora de 40 años de edad, muy apreciada por su comunidad por ser una mujer trabajadora, madre soltera y jefa de familia. Vive en el Barrio el Eden del Municipio de Ticuantepe con su señora madre y sus 6 hijos de los cuales los dos últimos son menores de edad y los mayores le ayudan en el trabajo del campo, desde pequeños le ha enseñado a sus hijos el valor del trabajo. Solicita un crédito para comprar Insumos de mantenimiento de su cultivo de 8 manzanas de piña, que ya están prontas a salir al mercado y es importante darles mantenimiento para su buena calidad.

loans.use: Agricultural fertilizer supplies

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Laura Mery's Group

texts.es:
Mery, Isabel, and Teresa have belonged to the Banco Comunal Emprendedoras for 8 months, 1 year, and 1 year respectively. In their Banco Comunal, they have learned to save money, be responsible and to deal with clients.

Mery, 32 years old, is married and has one 4 year-old son; she has a store at her house where she has been selling groceries, vegetables, etc. for 5 years.

Teresa lives with her partner; she is 21 years old and has one daughter that is one year old. She is studying Accounting. Teresa and her husband sell clothes on order, their merchandise come from Lima.

Isabel is a 54-year-old single mother of 4 children; two of whom live with her. She makes skirts typical to her area. She makes them at her house and sells them in the Santa Clara market.

Mery, Isabel, and Teresa are asking for loans of 600 soles, 400 soles, and 400 soles respectively. They will use this money to buy rice, sugar, notebooks, pencils, pants, sweaters and fabric.

They will use their savings to build their houses, buy groceries and pay for their children's education. Mery, Isabel, and Teresa dream of having their own houses, offering a good education to their children, finishing their studies, and having a job.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

Mery, Isabel y Teresa pertenecen al Banco Comunal Emprendedoras hace 8 meses, 1 año, 1 año respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ahorrar, ser responsables y como tratar a los clientes.

Mery es casada, tiene 32 años y 1 hijo de 4 años, Mery tiene una bodega en su casa donde vende abarrotes, verduras, actividad que realiza hace 5 años.

Por otro lado Teresa es conviviente, tiene 21 años y 1 hija de 1 año, estudiante de Contabilidad, Teresa junto a su esposo venden ropa a pedido, su mercadería lo traen de la ciudad de Lima.

Mientras que Isabel es madre soltera, tiene 54 años y 4 hijos de los cuales 2 viven con ella, Isabel confecciona polleras típicas de la zona, su taller esta en su casa y vende en el mercado Santa Clara.

Mery, Isabel y Teresa necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 400 soles, 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, cuadernos, lapiceros, pantalones, chompas, telas.

Sus ahorros lo utilizarán para construir su casa, alimentación y educación de sus hijos. Los sueños de Mery, Isabel y Teresa son tener casa propia, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, culminar sus estudios y tener trabajo.

loans.use: Mery, Isabe, and Teresa are asking for loans of 600 soles, 400 soles, and 400 soles respectively. They will use this money to buy rice, sugar, notebooks, pencils, pants, sweaters and fabric.

loans.name: Donatilda's Group

texts.es:
Sulma, Donatilda, and Lucinda have belonged to the Banco Comunal “Llapanchik”, which means "Everybody" in Quechua, for 8 months, 3 years, and 3 years respectively.

Sulma lives with her partner. She is 25 years old and has a son of 3 years old. Sulma sells cheese and meat. She brings her products from her town, Sachabamba, and sells them in the Nery Garcia market, although she also does home deliveries.

Donatilda, 37 years old, is married and has a 17-year-old son. Donatilda has a little store in a school where she and her husband sell candy, fruit, food.

Lucinda, 44 years old, is married and has 3 children. Lucinda travels to the fairs in her area and buys cereals that she sells afterwards in the Nery Garcia market. Lucinda also travels every two weeks to the Rumichaka fair where she sells bread and processed cereal.

Sulma, Donatilda, and Lucinda are asking for loans of 600 soles, 800 soles, and 800 soles. They will use the money to buy potatoes, cookies, rice, oil, bread, corn, fava beans, and carob beans.

They use their savings for their daily needs, to improve the capital of their businesses and for their childrens' education. Sulma, Donatilda, and Lucinda's dreams are for their children to be professionals, to improve their capital, to buy a taxi cab for her husband to work and to buy a house.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

Sulma, Donatilda y Lucinda pertenecen al Banco Comunal “Llapanchik” que significa “Todos” en quechua hace 8 meses, 3 años, 3 años respectivamente.

Sulma es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo de 3 años, Sulma vende queso y carne, sus productos los trae de su pueblo Sachabamba y lo vende en el mercado Nery García, también reparte a domicilio.

Por otro lado Donatilda es casada, tiene 37 años y 1 hijo de 17 años, Donatilda tiene un cafetín ubicado en un colegio, donde vende golosinas, frutas, comida, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo.

Mientras que Lucinda es casada, tiene 44 años y 3 hijos, Lucinda viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región donde compra cereales, para luego venderlo en el mercado Nery García. Además Lucinda viaja quincenalmente a la feria de Rumichaka donde vende panes y cereales procesados.

Sulma, Donatilda y Lucinda necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 800 soles, 800 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa, galletas, arroz, aceite, pan, maíz, haba, arveja.

Sus ahorros son para alguna necesidad, incrementar el capital de sus negocios y la educación de sus hijos. Los sueños de Sulma, Donatilda y Lucinda son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener más capital, comprar un taxi para que trabaje su esposo y comprar su casa.

loans.use: Sulma, Donatilda, and Lucinda are asking for loans of 600 soles, 800 soles, and 800 soles. They will use the money to buy potatoes, cookies, rice, oil, bread, corn, fava beans, and carob beans.

loans.name: Cirila's Group

texts.es:
Cirila and Lidia both belong to the Banco Comunal Emprendedoras. In their Banco Comunal they have learned to invest and save money, and to support their children.

Cirila, 49-year-old, is a single mother of a 28-year-old daughter. Cirila buys cattle in the different towns and fairs of the Ayacucho region and then she sells it in the Sunday' animals fair of Ayacucho.

Lidia, 28-year-old, lives with her partner and has a 2-year-old son. Lidia and her husband have a car which they use as a taxi cab and to locally transport students.

Cirila and Lidia are askiing for loans of 800 soles and 600 soles respectively in order to buy cattle and to repair a car.

They will use their savings to improve the capital of their business and to build their houses. Cirila and Lidia's dreams are to improve their business, build a house, provide education to their children, and to have their own houses.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

Cirila y Lidia pertenecen al Banco Comunal Emprendedoras hace 8 meses, en su Banco Comunal aprendieron a como invertir su dinero, como atender a los hijos y a ahorrar.

Cirila es madre soltera, tiene 49 años y 1 hija de 28 años, Cirila compra ganado en los diferentes pueblos y ferias de la región de Ayacucho, para luego venderlo en la feria dominical de animales de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Mientras que Lidia es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 1 hijos de 2 años, Lidia junto a su esposo tienen un carro, con el cual hacen taxi y movilidad local a estudiantes.

Cirila y Lidia necesitan préstamos de 800 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado vacuno y para la reparación de su carro.

Sus ahorros serán para incrementar el capital de sus negocios y para la construcción de su casa. Los sueños de Cirila y Lidia son mejorar su negocio, mejorar su casa, que sus hijos estudien y tener casa propia.

loans.use: Cirila and Lidia are asking for loans of 800 soles and 600 soles respectively in order to buy cattle and to repair a car.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira, 45, is a single mother. She lives in a humble house in Managua's Laureles Sur neighborhood. For 10 years, she has operated a small store in which she sells various products. She's built the business with loans and she now has a store stocked with all kinds of products such as dairy foods, canned goods and everyday things like beans and rice that every household needs. She's asking for a loan to stock summer products because in the beach season there will be a big demand for sardines, canned tuna, etc. By working hard and using credit wisely, she hopes her small store will ultimately become a large general store and that when she is older, her children will take it over as a family business so that they can lead dignified lives.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Elvira R., es madre solera de 45 años, habita en una humilde vivienda del Barrio Laureles Sur y desde hace 10 años de forma improvisada montó una pequeña venta de productos varios, con créditos ha venido creciendo y hoy en día tiene una pulpería abastecida con toda clase de productos de alimentos lácteos, enlatados, alimentos crudos como frijoles y arroz entre otras cosas de importancia en el hogar como papel higiénico, pasta de dientes, etc. Solicita un Préstamo para abastecer de productos de verano para esta época de playa en que se demanda mucho las sardinas, atún enlatados, con su esfuerzo y el buen uso de sus créditos su sueño es que su pulpería sea una Miscelánea grande y que cuando ella este mayor sus hijos la administren y mejoren el negocio familiar con el cual su madre pudo darles una vida digna.

loans.use: Buy product for resale.

loans.name: Maria Zulema

texts.es:
Maria lives in a rented house in an outlying neighborhood of the city of El Alto. She lives with her family and is a single mother. She, along with her children, makes work uniforms. The children’s father abandoned them approximately six years ago and Maria provides for her family with the income from this business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria vive en una zona alejada de la ciudad de El Alto, en contrato de anticrético, con toda su familia, es madre soltera. Junto con sus hijos se dedica a la confeccion de ropa de trabajo para obreros. El padre de sus hijos la abandono aproximadamente hace seis años, la misma mantiene a su familia con los ingresos de su actividad..

loans.use: To buy fabric at wholesale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Emprender - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix, 32, is a teacher. He's married and has a 3 year old son. His wife works as a caretaker at the same school where he works. They live in the "municipio" of Ticuantepe in the San Antonio Sur neighborhood of Managua. Felix has worked as a teacher for 13 years, leading classes for primary schood students. His goal is to continue to improve his professional skills and he's now studying English. He needs a loan to buy construction materials and build a garage on his house. Little by little, Felix has improved his house, all thanks to his own labor. He hopes to continue the work and improve the lives of his wife and small son.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Don Felix M. es un profesor de 32 años de edad, casado y tiene un pequeño hijo de 3 años de edad. Su esposa se desempeña como conserje del mismo Centro de Estudio donde labora Don Felix. Habitan en el municipio de Ticuantepe, en el barrio San Antonio Sur. Tiene 13 años de ejercer la profesión de maestro, se dedica a impartir clases al área de primaria. Su meta es seguir profesionalizandose, actualmente se encuentra estudiando el idioma inglés. Requiere del préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción y construir el garaje de su vivienda, poco a poco Don Felix ha ido levantando su vivienda, y todo esto gracias a su trabajo. Desea poder seguir desempeñandose en su labor y salir adelante con su esposa y su pequeño niño.

loans.use: Buy building materials for a garage.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Maritza's Group

texts.es:
Maritza, Carmen and Maribel belong to the Women Entrepreneurs Community Bank since 1 year.

Maritzia is 25 years old; she is a single mother and has a 5 months old son. Maritzia is a school teacher and since 2 years, she sells ceviche (form of citrus marinated seafood salad) at the Pérez de Cuellar Park during the weekends. Moreover, Maritzia also works as a cashier at a nightclub.

Carmen is 26 years old and she is single. She sells salchipollo (typical Peruvian food prepared with potatoes and chicken) at her home’s doorway. Besides, Carmen works as an apprentice at a tailoring workshop.

Maribel is 20 years old and she is single. She breeds small animals in her home and sells them at the Ayacucho city’s markets or upon direct request from her clients.

Maritza, Carmen y Maribel request a loan of 400 soles each (140USD aprox.) to invest buying fish, lemons, onions, corn, rice, oil and sucking pigs.

They all have dreams. For instance, Maritzia whishes to have her own stand to sell ceviche and to continue working as a teacher and Carmen would like to buy sewing machines and to install her own tailoring shop. Maritzia, Carmen and Maribel want their businesses to thrive.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Maritza es madre soltera, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo de 5 meses, de profesión profesora, Maritza los fines de semanas vende cebiche en el parque Pérez de Cuellar, actividad que realiza hace 2 años. Además Maritza trabaja por las noches en una discoteca como cajera.

Por otro lado Carmen es soltera y tiene 26 años, Carmen vende salchipollo (comida preparada con papa y pollo fritos), en la puerta de su casa. Además Carmen trabaja como ayudante en un taller de confección de prendas de vestir.

Mientras que Maribel es soltera y tiene 20 años, Maribel se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, actividad que realiza en su casa, sus ventas los realiza en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho y a pedido de sus clientes.

Maritza, Carmen y Maribel necesitan préstamos de 400 soles cada una, dinero que será invertido en la compra de pescado, limón, cebolla, maíz, papa, arroz, aceite y lechones.

Los sueños de Maritza, Carmen y Maribel son tener una cebichería en un local estable, ejercer su carrera, comprar sus maquinarias e implementar su propio taller y que sus negocios sean prósperos.

loans.use: Maritza, Carmen y Maribel request a loan of 400 soles each (140USD aprox.) to invest buying fish, lemons, onions, corn, rice, oil and sucking pigs.

loans.name: Saturna's Group

texts.es:
Maria, Cristina and Saturna have belonged to the Communal Bank "Santa Isabel D. Acosvinchos" for 1, 1, and 3 years respectively. The partners are native to the Acosvinchos district, which is two hours from the city of Ayacucho.

Maria is married, is 58 years old, and has twelve children, 6 of whom live with her. She bakes traditional breads of the area, doing her baking in a rented oven. Maria also sells meat in the district's market.

Cristina, on the other hand, is a single mother, 49 years old, and has three children. Cristina sells meat at the market in her district, and she raises the animals herself.

Saturna is married, is 53 years old, and has eight children, four of whom live with her. Saturna buys and sells grains, which she purchases at a larger market and sells in the provisions market in Ayacucho. She also buys tara tree products, such as tanning oils, during their season, and sells them in Ayacucho.

Maria, Cristina and Saturna need loans for 600, 300, and 1500 soles , money which they will invest in purchasing pork, flour, rams and sheep, corn, wheat, and peas.
