It may not be the easiest or most environmentally friendly form of cooking, but it is the only option many people can afford.

loans.use: To purchase stock of charcoal and small general items for resale

loans.name: Hotensia

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 40 year old Hotensia M.. She is married with five children, between 8 months and 19 years old.

In 2006, Hotensia established a cake business. Working seven days a week for more than 16 hours a day and assisted by her sister and one employee, she earns about $520.00 per month from this business. She now requires a loan to purchase aprons and ingredients, such as eggs, butter, and sugar in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $175.00. In the future, Hotensia also plans to diversify her business, and employ more staff. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients in bulk to make more cakes

loans.name: Andres Magno

texts.es:
Andres is a hardworking person with four children. His wife is recovering from an operation in January in which a benign tumor was removed from her head. Mr. E. and his wife continue working together. This is the second individual loan he has been granted--he had previously participated in a group loan. He has an excellent credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Andres es una persona trabajadora que tiene cuatro hijos, su esposa esta en etapa de convalesencia, ya que en el mes de Enero fue sometida a una intervencion quirurgica de un tumor benigno en la cabeza, pese a eso, el Sr. E. y su esposa continuan desarrollando sus actividades juntos. Este es el segundo credito individual que se les otorgara, anteriormente trabajo en grupo solidario, tiene una excelente historia crediticia.

loans.use: To buy products with which to stock his business (cosmetics, incense, etc. )

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 30 year old Rehema N.. She is married with five children, between the ages of 2 and 14. She has two other dependents, who live with her because they are her younger sisters.

In 2000, Rehema established a fruit and vegetable stall business. Working seven days a week from 9 to 12 hours a day and assisted by her children, she earns about $75.00 a month from this business. Rehema now requires a new loan to purchase additional stock in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $30.00. In the future, Rehema also plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock.

When you walk down the streets of Dar, you are greeted at almost every corner by a stall or wheelbarrow full of mangoes, pineapples, bananas or sugarcane. Rehema is one such seller of this luscious fruit and she thanks you for the support she needs to continue and expand.

loans.use: To purchase fruit and vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 28 year-old Neema S.. She is married with two children, ages one and thirteen.

In 2007, Neema established a grocery store business. She works seven days a week from nine to twelve hours a day and is assisted by her husband. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA. She requires a new loan to purchase additional stock of rice, oil, biscuits, butter, and nuts in bulk. In the future, Neema also plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, oil, biscuits, and other goods, in bulk.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 21 year old Prisca K.. She is single and has no children.

In 2006, Prisca established a soft drink and snack business. Working six days a week for nine to twelve hours a day and assisted by her mother, she earns about $75.00 a month from this business. Prisca has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA. She requires a new loan to purchase additional stock of soft drinks, juice, and milk in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $85.00.

It is said that Coca Cola® is one of the most recognized symbols or "words" in the world. And it’s true. Even in the most remote villages in Africa, there is usually some kind of "bar" selling Coke, Fanta, and Guiness. (Pepsi has made it to most African capitals but not to the sticks, but I’m sure they’re working on it!) The hot weather makes soft drinks all the more appealing--a very cheap marketing tool! All of which explains why selling soft drinks is such a popular venture whether you’re the CEO of Coca Cola Ltd in the United States or a micro-entrepreneur in Tanzania!

loans.use: To purchase stock of soft drinks, juice, and milk in bulk

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
The cleaning products shop that Flor and her husband have operated for four years belonged to her father. He kept it open for forty years but, after an illness, he had to turn it over to Flor to run.

Flor used to live and work in Venezuela with her husband and two daughters. She worked an administrator for a realty company there. She decided to return to Peru with her family because she lost her job. Her husband got a job as a driver for a poultry processor and from time to time, they gave him chickens. When her husband was injured in an automobile accident, Flor was obliged to go to work and what could be better than selling the extra chickens around the house.

For eight years, Flor earned a living selling chickens until her father asked her to take charge of the cleaning product shop. Flor says that things are going very well now and her husband helps her tend the shop. She hopes to open another shop in another market in the near future because the money that she earns isn't enough to pay for both her daughters' schooling and medicine for her husband who suffers from diabetes.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El puesto de artículos de limpieza que Flor T. y su esposo manejan desde hace cuatro le perteneció a su papa. Fue el quien durante cuarenta años mantuvo abierta y vigente la tienda, pero que a causa de una enfermedad la tuvo que dejar a cargo de Flor.

En un inicio Flor trabaja y vivía en Venezuela con sus dos hijas y esposo. Estuvo diez años trabajando para una inmobiliaria como administradora. Decidió regresar al Perú con su familia porque perdió su trabajo allá. Su esposo consiguió un trabajo como chofer de una avícola en Lima y cada cierto tiempo le regalaban pollos. Fue cuando su esposo sufrió un accidente automovilístico que ella se vio obligada a trabajar y nada mejor que vendiendo pollos que muchas veces le sobraba en casa.

Durante ocho años se dedico a la venta de pollos hasta que su papá le encargo a tienda de productos de limpieza. Actualmente, Flor asegura que le va muy bien, su esposo la ayuda en la atención de la tienda. Ella desea en un futuro cercano abrir una tienda más en otro mercado pues el dinero que le brinda su trabajo no es suficiente para el estudio de sus hijas y también para las medicinas de su esposo, quien sufre de diabetes.

loans.use: Open another store.

loans.name: Praxeda

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 28 year old Praxeda M.. She is married with one child, age four.

In 2004, Praxeda established a general store business. Working six days a week for nine to twelve hours a day and assisted by her husband, she earns about $520.00 a month from this business. She now requires a loan to purchase additional stock of soft drinks, juice, milk, and oil in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $150.00. In the future, Praxeda also plans to diversify her business. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of soft drinks, juice, milk, and oil in bulk.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
For five years, Silvia has earned a living from food sales. Until they split up, she and her ex-husband helped her sister-in-law with a shoe business. Sadly, she and her husband divorced and she then went on to sell clothes for four years. The income that she received from the work wasn't enough, however, so the decided to switch to food sales. The earnings from her labor were invested in the business and in the education of her 10- and 16-year old children. Her two oldest children are now studying and working in Argentina.

She would like to get a loan in order to remodel her shop and make it suitable for food sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace cinco años que Silvia se dedica a la venta de comida. Al inicio ella y su ex esposo ayudaban a su cuñada con la venta de zapatos, hasta que llego un momento en que ella y su ex esposo decidieron independizarse. Lamentablemente su esposo y elal se divorciaron y posteriormente, estuvo vendiendo ropa durante cuatro años, no obstante los ingresos que recibía de este trabajo no eran suficientes es por eso que tuvo la decisión de cambiar de negocio, es así que se animó con la venta de comida. Los ingresos que obtiene de su trabajo lo vuelve a invertir y lo gasta en la educación de sus hijos de 16 y 10 años. En la actualidad sus dos hijos mayores estudian y trabajan en Argentina.

Ella desearía obtener un préstamo parea remodelar su puesto y adecuarlo para la venta de comida.

loans.use: Remodel space for food sales.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.es:
Melisa is a young woman with a lot of dreams for getting ahead. For four years, she's made a living selling tableware. It was her aunt who gave her the idea to start a business because she too had earned a living selling in the markets and meeting the demand of her customers.

Melisa started small, only selling plastic kitchen items at first, but happily she's managed to grow the business thanks to the strength and dedication she gets from her six-year old daughter. For the future, she's thinking about buying a place and developing a large home products store.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Melisa es una mujer muy joven y con muchos sueños por delante. Ella desde hace cuatro años que se encarga de la atención de su puesto ambulante vendiendo vajillas de losa. Fue su tía quien le dio la idea de abrir negocio pues ella como vendedora también en el mercado vio la demanda en los clientes.

Todo empezó de a poquitos, al inicio ella vendía solo artículos de cocina de plástico pero felizmente ha logrado crecer gracias a su dedicación y a las fuerzas que su hija de seis años le brinda. En un futuro ella piensa comprar un local y tener una tienda mas grande de artículos para el hogar.

loans.use: Additional products for resale.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
The need to get funds to maintain her household led Epifania to head to Gamarra--a grand commercial district of Lima--to work as a street vendor peddling fruits to passes-by. She sold fruit until a financial crash left her with too few customers to make a living. She didn't know what to do until she realized she could draw on the skills she had developed knitting in her spare time. That day, she tried her luck selling not only handicrafts but also sweaters and scarves and, to make a long story short, it went very well. She decided to leave fruit behind to start selling what she knitted. For ten years now, she's sold wool items, handicrafts, clothing, and shoes; she also offers lessons in knitting. With this work, she has strived alone to get ahead and support her two children, 24 and 6. The only thing that she wants is to have a regular market stand so that she can stop working as a street vendor.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La necesidad de conseguir recursos para la mantención de su casa llevo a Epifania a salir a las calles de Gamarra -un gran centro comercial de Lima- a vender frutas como ambulante. Estuvo vendiendo frutas durante una temporada hasta que hubo una crisis en la que no vendía lo suficiente. Epifania no supo qué hacer hasta que no le nació mejor idea que sacar las manualidades de lana que ella en su tiempo libre solía tejer. Aquel día probando suerte no solo vendió manualidades sino también algunos chalecos y bufandas, en resumen, le fue muy bien. De esta manera decidió dejar las frutas para empezar a vender lo que ella tejía. Hoy en día, desde hace diez años vende lanas, manualidades, prendas de vestir, zapatos y además brinda clases de tejido a las personas que lo solicitan. Con este oficio ella sola intenta sacar adelante su hogar y también a sus dos últimos hijos de 24 y 6 años. Lo único que ella anhela es tener un puesto estable y no ambulante para poder hacer crecer su mercadería ya que si bien se mudo de mercado, continúa de ambulante.

loans.use: Rent a market stall.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Her two children were the main reason that Gloria decided to start a business selling food at a local market. For two years before, she earned a living working as a collector for a transportation company, until she became pregnant and had to arrange to be with her newborn daughter and her older child who also needed her.

Her husband is still working as a collector. Together they support the household with help from earnings from a car they bought and rent for use as a taxi. In the future, Gloria plans to build a restaurant and give her children a better education.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Sus dos hijos fueron la razón principal por la que Gloria decidió empezar a vender comida en un local dentro de un mercado. Hace dos años ella se dedicaba a trabajar como cobradora en una empresa de transporte hasta que quedo embarazada y tuvo que establecerse para estar cerca de su hija menor que recién había nacido y del mayor que también la necesitaba.

Su esposo continúa trabajando como cobrador también. El hogar lo mantienen entre ambos y también de la ganancia que les brinda el auto que compraron y que alquilan para taxi. En un futuro Gloria planea construir un restaurante y darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Expand shop.

loans.name: Chiku

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 46 year old Chiku M.. She is married with four children between the ages of 11 and 22. She has one other dependent, who lives with her because she is her niece.

Chiku owns a soft drink business, from which she earns about $125.00 per month. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and requires a new loan to purchase additional stock in bulk.

It is said that Coca Cola® is one of the most recognized symbols or "words" in the world. And it’s true. Even in the most remote villages in Africa, there is usually some kind of "bar" selling Coke, Fanta, and Guiness. (Pepsi has made it to most African capitals but not to the sticks, but I’m sure they’re working on it!) The hot weather makes soft drinks all the more appealing--a very cheap marketing tool! All of which explains why selling soft drinks is such a popular venture, whether you’re the CEO of Coca Cola Ltd in the United States or a micro-entrepreneur in Tanzania!

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks in bulk and ingredients to make snacks

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Even at 74 years old, Alejandrina has the same energy she did when she started her business. For twenty years, she's sold beverages such as colas and mineral water, thanks to a company that presented her with a market stall. She says that before she did a little of everything, selling food, green vegetables and "emoliente" (a hot drink made from barley) that she made herself.

Nothing was an obstacle for Alejandrina who always looked for a way to advance her three children who were then small. Her husband always supported her, happily, in maintaining the household; he also works to this day, as a gardener at a club in Chosica.

What Alejandrina most would like is to stock her small stand with more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

A sus 74 años, Alejandrina aún conserva las fuerzas con las que empezó su negocio. Hace veinte años que vende bebidas como gaseosas y agua mineral gracias a que una empresa le obsequio el puesto. Antes de esto ella afirma que se dedicaba a todo, vendía comida, verduras y emoliente (una bebida caliente hecha a base de cebada) que ella misma preparaba.

Nada fue un obstáculo para Alejandrina quien siempre buscó en sacar adelante a sus tres hijos que entonces eran aun pequeños. Su esposo felizmente siempre la apoyo en la manutención del hogar; él, hoy en día, trabaja como jardinero en un club de recreación en Chosica también.

Lo que más quisiera Alejandrina es abastecer de más mercadería su pequeño puesto.

loans.use: Buy extra merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
When Ana became pregnant with her daughter nine years ago, she had to leave her studies in Trujillo and go to Lima in search of a better future for her and her baby. She studied psychology at a national university for five years. Happily, she was able to live with relatives during that time and they helped her take care of her daughter. When she finished her studies, she wasn't able to get a degree because the university asked for a lot of additional requirements to graduate, requirements that came to more than 8,000 soles, more than she could afford.

Consequently, five years ago, she decided to open a small business selling cosmetics, jewelry and children's toys. She confesses that she ws very ashamed at the beginning because she never imagined being in that position. Her daughter gave her the strength to go on. Little by little, the business grew and, today, she can support her daughter herself, as she's never had help from the child's father.

In the future, Ana is thinking about buying her own stall in the market because the one she has is leased.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Cuando Ana quedó embarazada de su hija hace nueve años tuvo que dejar sus estudios en Trujillo y venir a Lima en busca de un futuro mejor para ella y su hija. Estudió durante cinco años en una universidad nacional la carrera de psicología. Felizmente en aquel tiempo unos familiares la hospedaron en su casa y le ayudaban con el cuidado de su hija. Al terminar su carrera ella no pudo ejercerla ya que la universidad le pedía muchos requisitos para poder graduarse, requisitos que ella no pudo costearse ya que sobrepasaban los ocho mil soles.

Fue así que hace cinco años decidió abrir un pequeño puesto en el mercado vendiendo cosméticos, joyería y juguetes para niños. Ella confiesa que al inicio lo hizo con mucha vergüenza, pues nunca se imaginó estar en esa posición. Su hija le daba fuerzas para continuar. Poco a poco fue creciendo y hoy, ella sola puede mantener a su hija, ya que nunca tuvo la ayuda del padre.

En un futuro Ana piensa comprar su propio local en el mercado, ya que el actual es alquilado.

loans.use: Buy a stall.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Mr. Roberto H. owns his home with his wife, Mrs. Virginia Catacora and they live with their 3 small children in the Pasankeri area, city of La Paz. Roberto works in public transportation in the city, and his wife sells vegetables at a public postin the city. With their prior loans they were able to complete the construction of their 4 room house (with running water and sewerage lines). This loan will be used for the construction of an embankment at the rear of his home, because the existing gap is allowing water to leak into his home. This is the fourth time that Roberto is applying for a loan. This loan will be made possible since his credit analysis came back favorable due to the payment history of his previous loans.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Roberto H. vive en casa propia con su esposa, la señora Virginia Catacora y sus tres hijos menores de edad en la zona de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz. El señor Roberto trabaja en el transporte público de nuestra ciudad y su esposa es comerciante, dedicándose a la compra y venta de verduras en un puesto en vía publica. Con anteriores créditos pudieron concluir la construcción de cuatro habitaciones con los servicios de agua y alcantarillado. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de un muro de contención en la parte posterior de su vivienda, ya que al encontrarse a desnivel se tiene problemas de filtraciones de agua. Esta es la cuarta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. Los tres créditos anteriores han sido cancelados en su totalidad.

loans.use: In order to build an embankment at the rear of his house to prevent water from leaking onto his property.  (Construccion de muro de contención en la parte posterior de su casa, para evitar filtraciones de agua)

loans.name: Amavi Mawuéna

texts.fr:
Amavi Mawuena A. is married and the mother of four. She was born on March 25, 1978, in Notsè, a city located 100 km from Lomé. She has been in the business of selling shoes and bags (purses, totes, etc.) since 2005 in the Adawlato marketplace where she displays them for sale. In the beginning, she only sold bags for women. But she noticed that her customers not only wanted bags but also shoes. She therefore decided to include commerce in shoes, which she started by using her first loan of 500,000 francs CFA. Very quickly, she sold out before her loan was due because of the vitality of her business. At present, she is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs CFA for 50 pairs of women's shoes and 5 dozen bags. The loan will increase her income in order to cover family expenses better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Mme A. Amavi Mawuena mariée et mère de 4 enfants, est née le 25 Mars 1978 à Notsè une ville située à 100 km de Lomé. Elle exerce son activité de vente de chaussures et des sacs de sortie depuis 2005 au marché d’Adawlato et les dispose en étalage. Au départ, elle ne vendait que des sacs de sortie pour dame. Mais elle a constaté que sa clientèle en plus des sacs sollicitait des chaussures. Elle a décidé alors d’associer le commerce des chaussures qu’elle a commencé avec son premier crédit de 500.000FCFA. Très rapidement, elle a soldé avant l’échéance en raison de la vitalité de son activité. Actuellement, elle sollicite un crédit de 500.000FCFA pour 50 paires de chaussures de femmes et 5 douzaines de sacs de sortie et accroître son revenu pour pouvoir mieux supporter les charges familiale

loans.use: To sell shoes and bags

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Mr. Guillermo L. owns his home with his wife, Mrs. Leandra Quispe. They live with their two grandchildren in the Tembladerani area, west of the city of La Paz. Guillermo is retired from the military. This loan will be used to fix a wall that separates his home from his neighbor's and to repair the ceiling in two of his rooms, which currently leak during the rainy season. This is the fourth time he is applying for a loan and he has been approved because his credit analysis has come back favorably. His three previous loans have been fully paid according to the payment terms of each contract.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer

El señor Guillermo L. vive en casa propia con su esposa, la señora Leandra Quispe y sus dos nietos en la zona de Tembladerani ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz. El señor Guillermo es jubilado de de la institución militar de nuestra ciudad. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la refacción de un muro que da al vecino y el cambio de techos en dos habitaciones que por el tiempo de uso presenta filtraciones en época de lluvia. Esta es la cuarta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. Los tres préstamos anteriores han sido pagados de acuerdo a los planes de pago estipulados en cada contrato.

loans.use: Repairing a wall which separates him from his neighbor's home, and to fix the ceiling in two rooms in his house.  (Refaccón de un muro y cambio de techos en dos habitaciones de su casa.)

loans.name: Bertille

texts.fr:
Born around 1961 in Ketou, in the Plateau department of Benin, Mrs. Bertille T. is a married mother of three children. She lives with her husband, who works in a local insurance institution, and she has been a shopkeeper since 1998. She has a business in Aglangandan, a neighborhood in Cotonou, where she sells various products such as rice, canned goods and condiments, among others. Every month, Mrs. Bertille T. sells around 150 cans of food and 60 bags of rice, wholesale or retail. Thanks to the construction of a new road in her area, demand has increased to 450 cans of food and 150 bags of rice, at a value of 800,000 francs. She currently has a cash flow of 300,000 francs, which is not enough to meet demand. She is thus requesting this loan to purchase the supplies necessary to satisfy her cutomers.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née vers les années 1961 à KETOU dans le département du PLATEAU, dame T. Bertille est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont elle a la charge. Vivant avec son mari qui travaille dans une institution d'Assurance de la place, dame T. Bertille est commerçante depuis 1998. Installée à AGLANGANDAN l’un des quartiers de COTONOU où elle exerce ses activités de vente de produits divers tels que le riz, des boîtes de conserve, des condiments etc. La vente mensuelle effectuée par madame T. Bertille est d’environ 150 boîtes de conserve, 60 sacs de riz en détail ou en gros. Grâce aux projets de construction de nouvelle voie dans sa zone, la demande est passée à 450 boîtes de conserve et à 150sacs de riz; le tout évalué à 800 000 francs. La liquidité dont elle dispose est de 300 000 francs ce qui est insuffisant pour répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. Elle sollicite alors ce prêt pour s’approvisionner afin de satisfaire à la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of 300 cans of food and 90 bags of rice

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Alidé - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Affiwa Akpé

texts.fr:
Ms. Affiwa Akpé A., age 52, is married to Mr. Richard TSOKONA, who is a taxi driver. They have three children. Ms. A.'s main business is commerce in fabrics at the grand marketplace in Lomé. She began in this business and has been in it since 1982. Her first loan of 450,000 francs CFA, which she has by the way paid off promptly, enabled her to avoid inventory shortages up until now. Given the size of her current customer base, she is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs CFA to buy 50 roles of new fabrics to meet customer demand better. With the income from this business, she helps her husband with family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 52 ans, madame A. Affiwa Akpé s’est mariée à Monsieur TSOKONA Richard qui est un conducteur de Taxi. Ils ont 3 enfants. Madame A. Affiwa Akpé a pour activité principale l’achat et vente de tissus au grand marché de Lomé. Elle a commencé par exercer cette activité depuis 1982. Son premier crédit d’une valeur de 450.000FCFA qu’elle a d’ailleurs promptement remboursé lui a permis de ne plus avoir une rupture de stock jusqu’à ce jour. Compte tenu de l’importance de sa clientèle actuelle, elle sollicite un emprunt d’une valeur de 500.000FCFA pour acheter 50 rouleaux de nouveaux tissus pour mieux répondre à la demande de ses clients. Avec le revenu de cette activité elle aide son mari dans les dépenses familiales.

loans.use: To stock an inventory of fabrics

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel is 48 years old. From a very early age she has worked farming on her family ranch. However, when her children were young, she decided to take on another job because her income was not sufficient. At first she found the opportunity to sell fruits in the market and this is how her business started. Then she began selling flowers. And gradually, over 24 years, her business has grown to obtain two posts where she sells flowers and fruits throughout the year.

In all this time she has managed, along with her husband, to raise their eight children, give them a better education and a chance for a good future - this has been her purpose for working so hard. In the future, Isabel hopes to open a bazaar at home and be able to run her business from there.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Isabel es una mujer de cuarenta y ocho años. Desde muy joven ha trabajado como agricultora en una chacra familiar. Sin embargo, decidió ocuparse en otro trabajo ya que tenia hijos pequeños y sus ingresos no eran suficientes. Encontró la oportunidad de vender frutas en el mercado y así empezó. Solo por temporadas vendía flores. Poco a poco, durante 24 años que lleva en su negocio, ha ido creciendo hasta obtener dos puestos donde vende en todo el año frutas y flores. En todo este tiempo ella ha sabido, junto a su esposo, criar a sus ocho hijos. Darles una mejor educación y la oportunidad de un buen futuro, a hecho que Isabel con muchas fuerzas trabaje a diario. En un futuro ella planea abrir un bazar en su casa y poder establecerse ahí.

loans.use: To establish two posts where she can sell flowers and fruit. (Implementar sus dos puestos, de flores y de frutas)

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Middle class client signing with her husband, who works transporting luggage at the El Alto airport. They live in an area distant from the city and maintain their underage children. They work every day from 7 am until very late at night, in order to make a living for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Cliente de clase media, quien firma con su esposo, el cual trabaja en el transporte de equipaje en el aeropuerto de El Alto; viven en una zona distante de la ciudad y mantienen a sus hijos menores de edad. Trabajan todos los dias desde la 7 de la mañana hasta altas horas de la noche, para generar los ingresos de la familia.

loans.use: Stock up her business with creams, perfumes, socks, flip-flops and batteries.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Emprender - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Gladys Patricia

texts.es:
Mrs. Patricia is is a mother and sole support of her family. She specializes in hairdos for dancers, so her work is well paid. She works on her own beauty salon and also makes house calls.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Patricia madre de familia es el sustento de esta, es especialista en peinar a bailarines, razon por la cual es bastante cotizado su trabajo, atiende en su propio salon y a domicilio.

loans.use: Buying materials for beauty shop (Compra de material para el salon de peinados)

loans.name: Yawa Kafui

texts.fr:
Yawa Kafui A. was born on September 3, 1970 in Lomé. Married and the mother of two children, she has been selling canned goods, sacks of rice, and drums of vegetable oil since 2005 in her shop that she has named ETS AKS ALBATROS. Her first loan of 350,000 francs CFA enable her to stock up enough inventory to avoid incessant round-trips to the Grand Market in Lomé. And it also enables her to back away from supplier loans, which don't allow her to earn enough. In addition, the volume of customer traffic is now better, and her customer base has grown to an adequate level. With regard to sales growth and to customer needs, she is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs CFA to buy twelve 25-kg sacks of rice and eight cartons of canned goods in order to grow her revenue, which would allow her to help with family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Yawa Kafui est née le 03 Septembre 1970 à Lomé. Mariée et mère de 02 enfants, elle est revendeuse des boites de conserve, des sacs de riz et des bidons d’huile végétale depuis 2005 dans sa boutique qu'elle a dénommée ETS AKS ALBATROS. Son premier crédit d’un montant de 350.000FCFA lui a permis de s’approvisionner en quantité suffisante pour éviter de faire d’incessants allers-retours vers le Grand Marché de Lomé et de se soustraire du crédit fournisseur qui ne lui permet pas de gagner suffisamment. De plus, son achalandage a été meilleur et la clientèle est devenue suffisante. Suite à l’accroissement de la vente et aux besoins de la clientèle, elle sollicite un crédit de 500.000FCFA pour acheter 12 sacs de riz de 25Kg et 8 cartons de boîtes de conserve afin d'accroître son revenu qui lui permet de participer aux dépenses de la famille.

loans.use: To sell food items

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es:
Sofía has been selling ceviche (fish meat) on a mobile stall in Matucana market. for ten years. She has four children, the oldest is 21 years old and is from her first relationship. For some time she had to bring her up by herself, until three siblings arrived from Sofía's new relationship. Her children have had a better upbringing thanks to the business, however it has been hard for her to start from scratch. Her husband also helps her with the housework, selling ceviche on another stall. They both want to be able to open a restaurant in the area and convert it in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Desde hace diez años Sofía vende ceviche en un puesto ambulante en el mercado de Matucana. Ella tiene cuatro hijos, la mayor tiene 21 años y es producto del primer compromiso de su madre. Durante un tiempo tuvo que trabajar solo para ella, hasta que tuvo tres hijos más con una nueva pareja. Brindarles una mejor crianza a sus hijos la animó a vender comida, aunque ha sido duro para ella empezar de cero. Su esposo también la ayuda con el mantenimiento de la casa vendiendo ceviche en otro puesto. Ambos desean en un futuro poder abrir un restaurante en un local y convertirlo en restaurante.

loans.use: Obtain a premises to open a restaurant

loans.name: Lucienne

texts.fr:
Born in the 1980s in Cotonou, in the south of Benin, Ms. Lucienne T. sells local and imported drinks and various products in the second largest car park in Cotonou. Ms. Lucienne T. sells an estimated 70 crates of drinks and 200 cans of food and other products each month. However, the monthly demand for her products currently exceeds 150 crates of drinks and 400 cans of food and other products. As she is lacking in means, she is requesting this loan to buy the necessary supplies in order to meet demand.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née à COTONOU dans les années 1980 au sud du BENIN, Demoiselle T. Lucienne est une revendeuse de boissons locales, importées et de différents produits divers dans le deuxième plus grand parc automobile de Cotonou. La vente mensuelle de demoiselle T. Lucienne est estimée à 70 casiers de boissons,200 boîtes de conserve et autres. Actuellement la demande mensuelle de sa clientèle dépasse largement 150 casiers, 400 boîtes de conserve et autres. Les moyens n’étant pas au rendez vous elle sollicite alors ce prêt pour s’approvisionner afin de répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of 80 crates of drinks, 200 cans of food and other products

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Alidé - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
C. Angeline, who married, with one child, is a retailer who sells clothing materials and slippers. Her business is doing very well and she hopes to expand her business, but lacks sufficient funds to meet her target.

She is asking for $525 to buy more clothing materials in order to increase her sales. She plans to expand her consumer base to both dressmakers and other individuals who use it for a variety of purposes.

loans.use: To buy clothing material

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Salome

texts.es:
Salome has belonged to the Obreras Community Bank for 7 years now. Through this bank, she has learned to save and be financially disciplined.

Salome is divorced, she 62 years old, and has 3 children. She sells propane gas at wholesale and retail prices and distributes to homes. She buys her products in the city of Lima. Besides this business, Salome and her children run a poultry shop (which they call Faco's) located on a main street in the city of Ayacucho. Her oldest daughter is in charge of the administration of this business.

Salome needs a loan of 2000 suns (Peruvian currency) - about $725.00 (USD) which she plans to invest in the purchase of propane gas.

Their savings will be used to buy a refrigerator. Salome's dream is to improve their business, and to have additional savings in order to build onto their home and extend their poultry store.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Salome pertenece al Banco Comunal Obreras hace 7 años, en su Banco Comunal aprendió a ahorrar y ser disciplinada.

Salome es divorciada, tiene 62 años y 3 hijos, Salome vende gas propano al por mayor y menor y reparte a domicilio, sus productos lo trae de la ciudad de Lima. Además Salome junto a sus hijos tienen una pollería llamada Faco’s ubicada en una calle principal de la ciudad de Ayacucho, la encargada de la administración de este negocio es su hija mayor.

Salome necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gas propano.

Sus ahorros son para comprar una refrigeradora. Los sueños de Salome son mejorar su negocios, tener otro deposito y construir mas pisos en su casa para ampliar su pollería.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase propane gas for her business. (Salome necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gas propano.)

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Y. E. Jane, who is married, with two children, owns a small store where she sells drinks and other provisions. Her business is doing very well and she wishes to increase her business.

She is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more drinks and other provisions for her store.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Feliza

texts.es:
Mrs. Felisa is a hardworking person, has worked with loans in solidarity groups, and currently needs an individual loan. Her guaranty is her husband, who works elaborating artisanal hats. They are humble people of middle low class with a tremendous desire to work. They have an impeccable loan history. They live in a popular zone in El Alto, and she sells books, fables, and novels in a famous fair which is attended by people of little resources. With this income she helps her husband to support their 5 children.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Felisa es una persona trabajadora, trabajo con crédito en grupos solidarios, actualmente necesita un credito individual. La garantia es la de su esposo el cual elabora sombreros artesanales, son personas humildes de clase media baja y con muchas ganas de trabajar presentan un historial crediticio impecable, viven en una zona popular de El Alto y vende libros, fabulas y novelas en una famosa feria donde acude gente de escasos recursos, con este ingreso ella ayuda a su esposo para sacar adelante a sus 5 hijos.

loans.use: Investing in books for the back-to-school season (Invertira por temporada de comienzo de clases en libros)

loans.name: Cesar R.

texts.es:
Cesar lives in his in-laws' home with his wife and their son on "flores" street, in the Tacagua area in the city of La Paz. He has an auto body shop on Jaimes Freyre street for nine months now which generates the income to support his family. The loan he is seeking is to buy tools and some materials such as paint, grease, thinner, varnish, etc. This is his first loan request, but his business qualifies him for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Cesar vive en casa de los suegros con su esposa e hijo en la calle flores de la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene un taller de chaperia (body shop) en la calle Jaimes Freyre desde hace nueve meses con el cual genera sus ingresos para mantener a su familia. El crédito que solicita es para comprar herramientas de trabajo y algo de material como ser pintura, grasa, tiner, barniz, etc. No tiene antecedente, es su primer credito, pero por la actividad que desempeña califica para obtener un préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase tools and materials, such as paint, grease, varnish, etc. (Compra de herramientas y materiales como pintura, grasa, barniz, etc.)

loans.name: Norma's Group

texts.es:
Gloria and Norma have been members of the Obreras Communal Bank for 10 years. From their membership with the bank, they learned to support their fellow man, to be disciplined and to save.

Gloria is 45 years of age, divorced and has one daughter. She sells Unión products like baked goods and desserts, products she sells through credit to workers from different institutions. Gloria also sells cosmetics through catalog.

Norma on the other hand is 45 years of age, married and has 5 children. She sells candies as a peddler in one of the central streets of the city of Ayacucho. Additionally, Norma works at an institution doing general cleaning.

Gloria and Norma need loans of 1200 and 600 soles, funds which will be invested in the purchase of baked goods, plantain snacks, loaves of bread, perfumes, jewelry, cookies, sodas and chewing gum.

Gloria’s and Norma’s dream is that their children become professionals, their businesses prosper, their financial situation is stabilized and that they are able to improve their home.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria y Norma son socias del Banco Comunal Obreras hace 10 años, en su Banco Comunal aprendieron a apoyar al prójimo, ser disciplinadas y a ahorrar.

Gloria es divorciada, tiene 45 años y 1 hija, Gloria vende productos Unión, como panes, postres, productos que vende al crédito a los trabajadores de distintas instituciones. Además Gloria vende cosméticos por catálogo.

Mientras que Norma es casada, tiene 45 años y 5 hijos, Norma vende golosinas de manera ambulatoria en una de las calles céntricas de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Norma trabaja en una institución haciendo limpieza.

Gloria y Norma necesitan préstamos de 1200 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de panes, piononos, pan molde, perfumes, joyas, galletas, gaseosas y chicles.

Los sueños de Gloria y Norma son que sus hijos sean profesionales, su negocio sea prospero, tener estabilidad económica y mejorar su casa.

loans.use: Gloria and Norma will purchase baked goods, plantain snacks, loaves of bread, perfumes, jewelry, cookies, sodas and chewing gum.

loans.name: Agala

texts.en: B. Agala, who is married to a mechanic, has three children.  Working in the food sector, she prepares and sells fried yam near a new taxi rank at night. Her food sales are increasing daily and she desire to expand her production, but lacks the funds to achieve her target. Thus, she is asking for $525 as an additional fund to buy more yams, oil and other food stuff to expand her food production and sales.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Fernando Antonio

texts.es:
Don Fernando is a hardworking man who ha been working this business for more than 20 years. His specialty is manufacturing frames and windows for houses and buildings. He carries out this activity in a workshop located in his own home, in the eastern side of the city of La Paz.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Don Fernando es un hombre muy trabajador se dedica a este rubro hace mas de 20 anos, su especialidad es la fabricacion de marcos y ventanas para casas y edificios, la actividad la realiza en el taller ubicado en su propia casa, en la ladera este de la ciudad de La Paz.

loans.use: Buying wood to manufacture windows (Compra de madera para la fabricacion de ventanas)

loans.name: Nelly Marisol

texts.es:
Nelly has been a member of the "Faith" community bank for 8 years, where she has learned to save and be responsable and punctual.

Nelly lives with her partner, is 27 years old and has 2 children, ages 12 and 8 months. She is a student in Business Administration at the university. Nelly sells cheeses which she buys at the markets in Paras and Viscapalpa, to where she travels weekly. She used to sell at one of the inter-provincial transportation stations, but now she sells door-to-door. In addition, 3 months ago she began buying wool and alpaca leather which she sells to intermediaries.

Nelly needs a loan to invest in the purchase of cheeses, wool and alpaca leather.

Her savings will be used for her degree and for her children´s education. Her dreams are to have a bigger business, to start up a new restaurant, have enough capital and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Nelly es socia del Banco Comunal Fe hace 8 años, en su Banco Comunal aprendió a ahorrar, ser responsable, puntual.

Nelly es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos de 12 años y 8 meses, estudiante de Administración de Empresas en la Universidad, Nelly vende quesos, producto que compra en las ferias de Paras y Viscapalca donde viaja semanalmente, anteriormente vendía en una agencia de transporte interprovincial, actualmente vende casa por casa. Además Nelly hace 3 meses compra lana y cuero de alpaca para posteriormente venderlo a intermediarios.

Nelly necesita un préstamo que será invertido en la compra de quesos, lana y cuero de Alpaca.

Sus ahorros los utilizará en su titulación y para la educación de sus hijos. Los sueños de Nelly es tener un negocio mas grande, iniciar un nuevo negocio de restaurante, tener capital suficiente y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase cheeses, wool and alpaca leather.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raul lives with his wife and daughter in a long-term leased property on Menédez and Pelayo Street in the Alta Sopocachi zone of the city of La Paz. He works as a mechanic to earn income; his wife has a general store and in this way helps out with family expenses. The loan he is requesting is to buy merchandise for the store so that they can offer a greater variety to their customers.

He does not have any previous record with IMPRO, this is his first loan and we believe that it is worthwhile to help this family improve their income and their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Raul vive con su esposa e hija en anticretico en la calle Menéndez y Pelayo de la zona de Alto Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es la de mecánico con la cual genera sus ingresos, la esposa tiene una tienda de abarrotes y así ayuda a su esposo con los gastos de la familia. El crédito que solicita es para comprar mercadería para la tienda y poder ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.

No tiene antecedente con IMPRO, es su primer crédito y creemos que vale la pena ayudar a esta familia para que mejoren sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of merchandise for a general store

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
O. Hawa, who is married, with six children, works in the food sector. The food that she prepares and sells, including rice and bean stew, is highly valued among her customers.

O. wishes to increase her food production and sales, therefore she is asking for $525 to buy more rice, beans, oil and other food stuffs.

loans.use: To buy more food stuffs

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leoner started selling meat in the market thirty years ago. She began helping her dad who was also a butcher. It was her father who gave her the stall and she, now, runs it with her husband. Leonor is fifty-two years old, has a daughter aged twenty-two who studies and works, and has two other businesses aside from the butchers. Five years ago she and her husband opened a grocery store close to the market, as well as a small shop/restaurant selling poultry. Her family have always been her support system, and therefore her daughter runs the grocery store while Leonor and her husband work from 6am to 4:30pm in the butchers before opening the poultry shop at 5pm. And so Leonor’s day starts at 6am and finishes at 12am. For the future she wants to be able to take on employees to work for her, and right now she needs to supply her grocery store with more produce.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Hace treinta años que Leonor vende carne de res en el mercado. Ella empezó ayudando a su papá que también fue carnicero. Fue él quien le cedió el puesto y ella, ahora, se encarga junto a su esposo de atender y manejar el negocio. Leonor tiene cincuenta y dos años; una hija de veintidós, que estudia y trabaja, y dos negocios más aparte de la carnicería. Hace cinco años su esposo y ella abrieron una bodega cerca del mercado y una pollería pequeña. El trabajo en familia siempre ha sido su apoyo, por eso su hija se encarga de atender la bodega mientras que su esposo y ella trabajan desde las seis de la mañana hasta las 4:30 pm en la carnicería para luego ir a las 5pm a abrir la pollería. Es decir el día de Leonor empieza a diario a las 6am y termina a las 12am. Ella quisiera en un futuro poder contratar gente que trabajar para ella, por el momento necesita implementar su bodega con más productos.

loans.use: Supplies for her grocery store and restaurant

loans.name: Akuété

texts.fr:
Akuété D., age 27, is single and runs a bar. He has been in this business since 2005 and has his own bar, which is named JUDAS DOREE. His first loan of 300,000 francs CFA enabled him to buy a new freezer to replace the old one in order to improve product quality. During this heat wave, the demand for carbonated beverages and for cold water has increased. To rise up to the challenge, he must restock to meet customer expectations and to maintain continuously the entire range of drinks. To do this, he is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs CFA to buy 38 cases of beer.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur D. Akuété célibataire âgé de 27 ans, tient un débit de boissons gazeuses. Il exerce cette activité depuis 2005 et dispose de sa propre boutique dénommée « JUDAS DOREE ». Son premier crédit d’un montant 300.000FCFA lui a permis d’acheter un nouveau congélateur pour remplacer l’ancien afin d’améliorer la qualité des produits. En cette période de forte chaleur la demande en boissons gazeuses et en eau fraîches a augmenté. Pour y faire face, il doit faire un ravitaillement pour satisfaire le besoin de ses clients et avoir en permanence toute la gamme de boissons. Pour cela, il sollicite un crédit de 200.000 FCFA pour acheter 38 casiers de bière.

loans.use: To sell fizzy drinks

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Aurea's Group

texts.es:
Maria, Aurea and Enedina have belonged to the "Faith" community bank for 2, 2, and 1 year respectively.

Maria is married, 50 years old and has 2 children. She sells anticuchos (grilled marinated meat served on a skewer) at night from the front door of her house, something which she has done for 2 years. In addition, she and her husband sell used batteries at the San Juan Bautista Sunday market.

Aurea is a widow, 43 years old and has 2 children. Aurea sells cheese in the Magdalena market as an ambulatory vendor.

Enedina is married, 30 years old and has 4 children. Enedina sells candy at the entrance to the Miraflores school from Abril to December and during the other months travels to local markets. Enedina, with her loan, is planning to start selling school uniforms and supplies.

The dreams of Maria, Aurea and Enedina are that their children become professionals, and to invest in other businesses and grow their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Maria, Aurea y Enedina pertenecen al Banco Comunal Fe hace 2, 2, 1 años respectivamente.

Maria es casada, tiene 50 años y 2 hijos, Maria vende anticuchos por las noches en la puerta de su casa, actividad que realiza hace 2 años. Además junto a su esposo venden baterías usadas en la feria dominical de San Juan Bautista.

Por otro lado Aurea es viuda, tiene 43 años y 2 hijos, Aurea vende quesos en el mercado Magdalena de manera ambulatoria.

Mientras que Enedina es casada, tiene 30 años y 4 hijos, Enedina vende golosinas en la puerta del colegio de Miraflores los meses de abril a Diciembre y los demás meses viaja a las ferias. Enedina con el préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado iniciar con la venta de uniformes y útiles.

Maria, Aurea y Enedina necesitan préstamos de 200 soles, 200 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de carne, queso, uniformes y útiles.

Los sueños de Maria, Aurea y Enedina son que sus hijos sean profesionales, invertir en otro negocio y aumentar su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase meat, cheese, school uniforms and supplies.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efraín lives in an antichretic lease on Collasuyo Street, in the Cota huma zone of the city of La Paz ,with his wife and two children. He works at Contraloría, but his salary is very low and thus, he also repairs photocopiers. The loan he requests is to implement a business in the sale of office supplies. He had been doing it on a smaller scale and did very well. Now, he decided to buy wholesale to increase his earnings. He does not have a credit history with IMPRO; this is his first loan.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Efraín vive en anticretico en la calle Collasuyo de la zona de Cota huma de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposa y sus dos hijos. El trabaja en la Contraloría pero su salario es muy bajo por lo cual independientemente se dedica a la reparación de maquinas fotocopiadoras; el crédito que solicita es para establecer un negocio de venta de material de escritorio, ya lo estuvo haciendo en menor cantidad y le fue bien ahora decidió comprar en cantidad para poder tener mejores ingresos. No tiene antecedente con IMPRO; este es su primer crédito.

loans.use: Purchase office supplies (notebooks, pencils, pens, etc.) wholesale.

loans.name: Julie

texts.fr:
Mrs. Julie Z. was born in 1975 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, and is a married mother of two children. For over five years, she has been running her business as a hairstylist and vendor of various cosmetic products and different types of hair extensions in a working-class neighborhood in Cotonou. Mrs. Julie Z. is an upstanding woman who is a leader in the hairstyling sector in her Cotonou neighborhood. She has around 30 to 40 customers who seek her services every day and is thus requesting this loan to improve her service and to meet demand.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Dame Z. Julie est née dans les années 1975 à Cotonou, ville capitale économique du BENIN. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants à charge. Installée depuis plus de 5 ans dans un quartier populaire de Cotonou, elle exerce son activité de coiffure,  de vente de divers produits cosmétiques et de diverses sortes de mèches. De bonne moralité, dame Z. Julie est une leader dans la coiffure dans ce quartier de ville de Cotonou. Le nombre de clients venant demander son service par jour est d’environ 30 à 40 clients par jour. Elle sollicite alors ce prêt pour améliorer sa prestation et répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of hair extensions and cosmetics

loans.name: Raquel's Group

texts.es:
Raquel and Ercilia have been members of the Fe Communal Bank for 4 months and 8 months, respectively. As members of the bank, they have learned how to save and invest money.

Raquel is 25 years of age, married and has two children ages 3 and 6. She sells poultry, which initially she distributed to grocery stores with the help of her husband. Currently, she only distributes chicken giblets because her husband is traveling, and she has no one to support her. Additionally, Raquel sells cosmetics through catalog.

Ercilia is 24 years of age, and is a single mom of two children ages 1 and 7. She sells prepared food in the MiraF. market. Additionally, during vacation months, Ercilia travels to the Ayacuchan jungle to work as a cook. In her free time, she also does other people’s laundry.

Raquel and Ercilia need loans of 400 and 200 soles, funds which will be invested in the purchase of cologne, jewelry, pots, plates, and also in the improvement of their homes.

Raquel’s and Ercilia’s dream is to purchase a plot of land and a car, that their business grows and they improve their home, and that their children have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Raquel y Ercilia pertenecen al Banco Comunal Fe hace 4 meses, 8 meses respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ahorrar y como invertir el dinero.

Raquel es casada, tiene 25 años y 2 hijos de 6, 3 años, Raquel vende carne de pollo, al inicio repartía a las tiendas con la ayuda de su esposo, actualmente solo reparte menudencias de pollo, porque su esposo esta de viaje y no tiene quien la apoye. Además Raquel vende cosméticos por catálogo.

Mientras que Ercilia es soltera, tiene 24 años y 2 hijos de 7, 1 años, Ercilia vende comida en el mercado MiraF.. Además Ercilia en los meses de vacaciones viaja a la selva ayacuchana a trabajar como cocinera. También en sus ratos libres lava ropa ajena.

Raquel y Ercilia necesitan préstamos de 400 soles, 200 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de colonias, joyas, ollas, platos y para mejorar su casa.

Los sueños de Raquel y Ercilia son comprar un terreno, carro, que su negocio crezca, mejorar su casa y que sus hijos tengan un futuro mejor.

loans.use: Purchase of cologne, jewelry, pots, plates, and also in the improvement of their homes.

loans.name: Maria Lucia's Group

texts.es:
Leonor, Marcelina and Maria have belonged to the Obreras community bank for 8, 8 and 10 years respectively. At their community bank they have learned to save and be self-sufficient.

Leonor is married, 54 years old and has 4 children. Leonor sells trout in the Nery García market, her product is bought by wholesalers. In addition, Leonor runs a general store from her house.

Marcelina, on the other hand, is married, 61 years old and has 5 children, of which 1 still lives with her. Marcelina buys and sells typical breads of the region such as "chapla" (a flatbread) which she distributes to stores in the area. She also travels to the various markets where she sells bread and vegetables and buys grains.

Maria is married, 52 years old and has 2 children. Maria has a restaurant on one of the main streets in the city of Ayacucho. Maria, with her loan, will be able to better equip her restaurant.

Leonor, Marcelina and Maria need loans to purchase trout, rice, sugar, barley, wheat, corn, onion, bread, cooking pots, cutlery and kitchen utensils.

Leonor, Marcelina and Maria dream of having their own homes, starting other businesses and that their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Leonor, Marcelina y Maria pertenecen al Banco Comunal Obreras hace 8, 8, 10 años respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ahorrar y a valorarse a si mismas.

Leonor es casada, tiene 54 años y 4 hijos, Leonor vende truchas en el mercado Nery García, sus productos los compra de mayoristas. Además Leonor tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.

Por otro lado Marcelina es casada, tiene 61 años y 5 hijos de los cuales 1 vive con ella, Marcelina compra y vende panes típicos como “chapla”, reparte por mayor a las tiendas. Además viaja a las ferias de la región donde vende panes, verduras y de las ferias trae cereales.

Mientras que Maria es casada, tiene 52 años y 2 hijos, Maria tiene un restaurante en una calle céntrica de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Maria con el préstamo que obtendrá implementara más su restaurante.

Leonor, Marcelina y Maria necesitan préstamos que serán invertido en la compra de trucha, arroz, azúcar, cebada, trigo, maíz, cebolla, panes, ollas, cubiertos y utensilios de cocina.

Los sueños de Leonor, Marcelina y Maria son tener casa propia, implementar otro negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase trout, rice, sugar, wheat, corn, onion, bread, cooking pots and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.es:
When Rosita’s daughter moved to Lima, Rosita was left in charge of a fish stall which opened twenty years ago. That’s how Rosita, now 61 years old, began selling fish in the market. Before that she spent ten years buying meat in Matucana and selling it in Lima. Rosita’s daughter suggested that she went to live in Lima with her but Rosta prefered to stay and work in Matucana because she was not used to Lima and furthermore because the climate in Matucana is better for her osteoporosis, which she has suffered from for many years. Nowadays she has spent seven years selling fish with the help of her son, and whatever she earns she uses for her medecine and taking care of her home. She insists that luckily everything is going well as she would like to open a grocery store in her home and pass on the stall to her son.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Al mudarse la hija de Rosita a Lima le dejó encargado el puesto de pescado que hace veinte años había abierto. Es así que Rosita en ese entonces con 61 años empezó a vender pescado en el mercado. Anteriormente ella se dedicó durante diez años a comprar carne de res en Matucana y venderla en Lima. La hija de Rosita le propuso ir a vivir a Lima con ella pero Rosita prefiere quedarse trabajando en Matucana porque no se acostumbra en Lima y además pero que el clima de Matucana es mejor para la osteoporosis que sufre hace un tiempo. Hoy en día ya lleva siete años vendiendo pescado con la ayuda de su hijo, lo que gana de ello lo destina a sus medicinas y al mantenimiento de su hogar. Ella asegura que felizmente le va muy bien pero que le gustaría abrir una bodega en su casa y dejarle el puesto a su hijo.

loans.use: In the future, open a shop in her home

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Don Emilio is a person devoted to his family and his work. He works side by side with his wife, she as his helper, to minimize their expenses and in this way be able to offer a better education to their children. He is starting his fifth loan, having kept an impeccable loan history.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Don Emilio persona entregada a su familia y a su trabajo, trabaja lado a lado con su esposa, ella como su ayudante, esto para minimizar sus gastos y asi poder ofrecer una mejor educacion a sus hijos. Esta ingresando a su quinta secuencia de prestamo, teniendo un historial impecable.

loans.use: Buying tires, batteries, and fixing the upholstery (Compra de llantas , bateria y  realizar algunos arreglos en el tapizado de los asientos.)

loans.name: Lidia's Group

texts.es:
Eulalia, Lidia and Bertha have belonged to the Obreras community bank for 4, 3 and 4 years respectively.

Eulalia lives with her partner, is 51 years old and has 6 children, 2 of whom live with her. Eulalia sells watches as an ambulatory vendor along Grau street, the products are purchased in Lima. In addition, Eulalia runs a small general store from her home.

Lidia, on the other hand, is married, 35 years old and has 2 children. Lidia has a general store in a rented commercial space. When she started off she had very little capital but currently the business is well-stocked.

Bertha is a single mother, 27 years old and has a daughter. Bertha initially sold fruit but left that business because it did not generate enough income. She currently works in a restaurant. Bertha plans to build her house so that she can open a general store.

Eulalia, Lidia and Bertha need loans in order to buy different types of watches, rice, oil and in Bertha´s case, buy materials to build her house.

Eulalia and Lidia dream of buying homes and that their children become professionals and Bertha dreams of building her house and having her general store.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Eulalia, Lidia y Bertha pertenecen al Banco Comunal Obreras hace 4, 3, 4 años respectivamente.

Eulalia es conviviente, tiene 51 años y 6 hijos de los cuales 2 viven con ella, Eulalia vende relojes de manera ambulatoria en la calle Grau, productos que son comprados en Lima. Además Eulalia tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa.

Por otro lado Lidia es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Lidia tiene una tienda de abarrotes, en un local alquilado, al iniciar tenía muy poco capital, actualmente su negocio es surtido.

Mientras que Bertha es madre soltera, tiene 27 años e hija, Bertha inicialmente vendía frutas, negocio que dejo de realizar porque no le generaba ganancias. Actualmente Bertha trabaja en un restaurante. Bertha tiene proyectado construir su casa para abrir una tienda de abarrotes.

Eulalia, Lidia y Bertha necesitan dinero que será invertido en la compra de relojes de diferentes modelos, arroz, aceite y Bertha comprará materiales para la construcción de su casa.

Los sueños de Eulalia y Lidia son comprar una casa, que sus hijos sean profesionales, y de Bertha construir su casa y tener una tienda de abarrotes.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of different types of watches, rice, oil and construction materials.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos is 50 years old and lives with his family in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood. His wife is a homemaker and tends to their 2 children. Marcos has been a bricklayer for more than 30 years and therefore, has vast experience in this occupation. He works independently, and that is how he has maintained his family. Thanks to his work, he has been improving the infrastructure of his home. Despite living in humble conditions, they have been making improvements to their home when their finances allow it. Their chief necessity at the moment is to erect the side wall of their home, which is currently deteriorated due to the poor infrastructure it was constructed with. Thus, it needs to be torn down and reconstructed using high-quality, resistant material. Marcos will perform this task himself to offer higher security for his home and his family. He will work on this project during the weekends and during his free time being that he currently has work orders from his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Marcos tiene 50 años de edad, vive con su familia en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y a cuidar de los 2 hijos que ambos procrearon. El señor tiene más de 30 años de dedicarse a la labor de albañil, cuenta con una vasta experiencia en ese oficio, trabaja por cuenta propia y es de esa forma como ha sacado adelante a su familia. Con su trabajo es que ha ido mejorando la infraestructura de su vivienda, a pesar que viven en condiciones humildes han ido acondicionando su vivienda de acuerdo a sus posibilidades económicas. La necesidad del señor en estos momentos es la de levantar la pared lateral de su vivienda, la cual se encuentra deteriorada debido a la mala infraestructura con la que fue construida, por lo tanto requiere de botarla y volverla a levantar con material de buena calidad que resista, trabajo que realizara por su cuenta para brindar mejor seguridad a su vivienda y familia, este trabajo lo realizara los fines de semana y días libres ya que cuenta con trabajo actualmente.

loans.use: Purchase bricks, cement, sand and iron to reconstruct the side wall of his home.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Gloria is 51 years old and married. Her husband works as a cheese merchant los Mercados de la Capital - the Ivan Montenegro markets in the capital city. They have 3 children, who are grown and live with them to support them financially. This family lives in the 14th district of Febrero. It has been 10 years that Gloria has had a small store in her humble home to support her husband and to have other means of income to support her children's education and other familial costs. The business has a small inventory but is well stocked with nutritious products that are consumed daily by families all around. At the moment, Gloria seeks a loan to restock her small store since she sells a large portion of goods to her customers on credit, which causes financial strains on her until she is able to collect the money on due dates. She does not have enough inventory for her customers that visit her daily.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

La señora Gloria tiene 51 años de edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja como comerciante de queso en uno de los Mercados de la Capital, de nombre Ivan Montenegro. Procrearon 3 hijos, los cuales son mayores de edad, viven con ellos y le ayudan económicamente en los gastos de la casa, esta familia habita en barrio 14 de Febrero. Hace 10 años, la señora con el proposito de apoyar a su esposo y tener otro ingreso que les permitiera darles la mejor educación posible a sus hijos, montó una pequeña pulpería en su humilde vivienda con el objetivo de obtener mayores ingresos con los cuales pudiera hacer frente a todos los gastos familiares. El negocio posee un inventario pequeño pero se encuentra bien surtido de productos alimenticios tiene de todo un poco de lo que a diario consumen las familias. En este momento la señora solicita un préstamo para abastecer de productos la pulpería, ya que como a diario vende grandes cantidades de productos al crédito y esto a veces la limita económicamente siendo hasta en las fechas de pagos que recoge dinero, en existencia no cuenta con suficiente inventario para cubrir la necesidad de los clientes que la visitan diariamente.

loans.use: To buy meat, vegetables, milk, eggs, etc to stock up her small store

loans.name: Trinidad Margarita

texts.es:
Mrs. Margarita arrived for the first time to this institution on February 23rd of 2008. Her main activity is the sale of fish. Her home is in the zone of Munaypata. Mrs. Margarita carries out her activity outside of her home in the zone of Tejar. She is a mother of two children, a 16-year-old and a 12-year-old, and together with her husband she works very hard to support their family because their children as in school and have many expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Margarita llego por primera vez a la institución el 23 de febrero de 2008, la misma tiene como actividad principal, la venta de pescados, con domicilio en la zona de Munaypata, la señora realiza su actividad fuera del domicilio en la zona del Tejar. Es madre de dos hijos, uno de 16 años y otro de 12, junto a su esposo trabajan mucho para sacar adelante a su familia, ya que sus hijos se encuentran en edad escolar y tienen muchos gastos.

loans.use: Buying fish wholesale (COMPRA DE PESCADO POR MAYOR)

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique is a hard-working man. For twenty years he has been selling drinks and sweets. He learnt everything he needed to know by helping his parents when he was little until he moved out of the family home. He has always been moving due to competition. Recently, four years ago, he obtained a more stable position which is where he is working now. Aside from selling sweets he also sells vegetables which grow on his plot. Depending on the crop, he sells: green corn, potatoes, broad beans, alfalfa, etc. Normally his son helps him when he's not studying. Enrique lives with his mother and 16 year old son. He seperated from his wife some time ago, who looks after their youngest child who is 11 years old. In the future he plans to convert his shop into a store where he can sell groceries and other produce. He also hopes to build a hotel in the future in the town of Matucana.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Enrique es un hombre muy trabajador. Desde hace veinte años se dedica a la venta de bebidas y dulces. Él obtuvo todos los conocimientos necesarios para este negocio ayudando a sus padres desde pequeño hasta que se independizó. Siempre ha estado en constante movimiento a causa de la competencia. Recién hace cuatro años obtuvo un puesto más estable que es en el que actualmente se encuentra. A parte de vender dulces él también vende verduras que siembra en su chacra. Por temporadas, según el cultivo, vende: choclos, papas, habas, alfalfa, etc. Generalmente su hijo lo ayuda cuando no esta estudiando. Enrique vive solo con su mama y su hijo de 16 años. Hace un tiempo se separó de su esposa quien se encarga de criar a su hijo menor que tiene once años. Más adelante el planea convertir su tienda en una bodega donde pueda vender abarrotes y más cosas. En un futuro el sueña con construir un hotel en el pueblo de Matucana.

loans.use: Convert his sweet shop into a grocery store

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Eusebio has had his grocery store for more than forty years. He has dedicated over half of his life to running this business. Luckily, he has always been able to count on the support and help of his wife and children. When Eusebio moved to Matucana he could not find a stable job, which is why he chose to open a shop in his home so that he could support the future and education of his two children, who were still young at the time. He invests part of his profits back into the business and the rest goes towards him and his wife, now that his children have their own families and have moved out of the family home. Eusebio would like to develop his store in order to achieve greater sales and in the future, take on an employee to run the shop.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Hace más de cuarenta años que Eusebio tiene su bodega. Ha dedicado más de la mitad de su vida al manejo de este negocio. Felizmente ha contado siempre con la ayuda de su esposa y de sus hijos. Al mudarse a Matucana no encontró un trabajo estable, fue por esto que se animó a abrir una tienda en su casa para poder mantenerla y para poder también darle educación a sus dos hijos, en ese entonces pequeños aún. Una parte de lo que gana de su trabajo lo vuelve a invertir y otra parte lo destina para el y su esposa, ya que sus hijos han formado una familia y son independientes. Lo que le gustaría a Eusebio es implementar más su bodega para lograr tener más ventas y en el futuro poder contratar una persona que trabaje encargándose de la tienda.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Mrs. Angelica is 49 years old and has had her stand for about 8 years. She commutes for approximately two hours a day from her home to her sales stand. Her business is well stocked and complete. She also offers photocopying services, and phone services, so her income is enough to support her minor children and fulfill her loan oblications. Her husband helps out in all activities.

As for her credit history, Mrs. Angelica A. has been a customer of Emprender since 2004, demonstrating punctuality in her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Angelica tiene 49 años de edad y en el puesto de venta unos 8 años de antigüedad, se traslada aproximadamente dos horas diarias de su domicilio a su puesto de ventas, el negocio esta muy bien surtido y completo, además presta el servicio de fotocopias, y también tiene un punto telefónico, por lo cual tiene bastante ingreso, que le permite mantener a sus hijos menores y cumplir con sus obligaciones de pago. El esposo la colabora en todas sus actividades.El. En cuanto al historial crediticio de la Sra. Angecila A., ella es cliente de Emprender desde el año 2004, demostrando puntualidad en sus pagos.

loans.use: Buying office supplies, especially photocopier paper (COMPRA DE MATERIAL DE ESCRITORIO Y SOBRE TODO HOJAS PARA FOTOCOPIAS)
